Text.Text: All are hostages of capitalism so long as they need to pay a ransom to fulfil their basic needs. Dr. Mercier wants you to increase the production of bread, and stock up on it. Hopefully he has a few tricks to make the stale loaves a little easier on the jaw...
You want to serve your community? Set them free? Make them self-sufficient, and no mogul will ever have power over them. They must produce all they require!
Hugo believes your workers will find fulfilment in working harder — much harder — to lift their community. Don't worry! It's not exploitation if the proceeds go to the workers.

How it pains me to look at your soulless workers, wasting their spirits away like mindless drudges. Do you know what would give them far more zest than a cup of teeth-yellowing coffee? Working hard to serve their own needs and those of their community, instead of feeding a capitalist leech.
In a grand gesture to prove to you that his system works just fine, Hugo would like to donate a large amount of his extra stock to you. Sure, his people are perfectly fine with that...

Once you extract all the crooked incentives that have been fabricated by capitalism to hoard property, people only take as much as they need. We produce so much and gobble up so little, we can barely close our storeroom doors! Take as much as you need — think of it as a sample of what our system can achieve.

The word about Hugo Mercier's anarchist utopia has travelled far and wide, and reached the ears of a receptive crowd. People from all corners of the world are travelling to join his commune, and Hugo has asked you to grant them a safe passage.

I don't care who they are or where they come from — if the establishment has them squeezed under its heel, they will be welcomed in our utopia! We can't allow them to suffer any harm — please shelter them on their way to our open arms.
Goodbye, hunger! Goodbye, freezing nights out on the streets! So long, scornful glances from passers-by...! Hello, Dr. Hugo! Hello, Dr. Hugo! Hello, Dr. Hugo!

Hugo believes that humans are virtuous by nature when they are not forced to compete under the rules of capitalism. Dr. Harvey Sprucer, one of the heads of Social Darwinism in the Old World, begs to differ, and has asked to be taken to Mercier's island to judge with eyes unclouded. Unafraid of confronting challenging ideas, Hugo has accepted, and would like you to provide transport for the gentleman.

Capitalists love to blame their wretched policies on natural order, but our community exemplifies that humans are nothing but kind to each other when they are not being corrupted. A Social-Darwinist has expressed his desire to see for himself what our ideas translate into. We agreed — he needs only safe transport here.

That was the healthiest, most edifying debate I have had in a while! Dr. Sprucer has been convinced of the pure-hearted nature of men and women after meeting the most enlightened members of our community. Escort him safely back — he will make a good case for our true spirit to his heartless colleagues.
Hugo Mercier finds a kindred soul in Jean La Fortune, and has asked you to bring him one of his favourite essay collections as a gift.

I profoundly admire Mr. La Fortune. A true breaker of chains; founder of a nation free of oppressors! If anything, he should let go of that leadership he grasps so strongly, empower his people, and build up trust. He'd love a read of Krapotkin's "Reciprocal Support". Would you take it to him as a token of my esteem?

Dr. Mercier is radically opposed to all institutions. The police, as a weapon of the state, used to threaten individuals into an unnatural order, is perhaps the one he detests the most. He has challenged you to get rid of all your police stations.
People's voices must not be repressed under institutional coercion! Snap off the braces, and society will naturally straighten itself. Unless you fear the people's free will.

No trial is a fair trial under the corrupted laws of capitalism. Hugo has asked you to free some political prisoners from Eli Bleakworth's gaol, so they can be held accountable before his unbiased, enlightened people.

How can the people be blamed for rebelling against plutocrats? The lives taken by capitalism far exceed the ones those men were driven to take. Of course the corrupt justice system pronounced them guilty... Their fate must be decided by the people!

The state is far more than just an unnecessary institution — it is the most harmful fabrication of the privileged! We need to bring the government down by any means necessary, and burn their tools of intrusion!
The state is anarchy's ultimate enemy. As the main representative of the government around, Sir Archibald — or rather, his fleet — has become Dr. Mercier's main target for sabotage.

A couple of decrepit judges in powdered wigs should not hold power over the fate of men. Come, see how the whole community comes together to decide on a fitting punishment for this man's crimes, and witness what true justice looks like. Then document the event and showcase it to your people!
Dr. Mercier is proud of the justice system they've established, and has asked you to attend, listen to, photograph and publish an article about the trial they are holding.

Everything he stole belongs to the community! Dr. Hugo always warns about the ill-intentions of those who take things that naturally belong to humanity for their own selfish sake. He must not go unpunished!

Those goods belong to us all in the first place, so he is no thief. He simply needs to learn to reassess the extent of his needs. Persuasion goes further than punishment, Dr. Hugo always insists on that!
RESTORATIVE JUSTICE

So long, coerced compliance of justice! A new anarchist approach is in town, and it promises to resolve conflicts by actually listening to the people affected and working towards an agreeable solution!

A merchant who'll pay a price that matches the effort needed to produce the goods, rather than the deflated value given to it by the so-called "free" market? I'd never fall for such a blatant attempt to infiltrate us. Follow her ship — bring me proof of her true intentions.

Dr. Mercier highly doubts that someone as complicit to capitalism as a merchant would willingly pay the prices the labour theory of value dictates. He's convinced she's up to no good, and has asked you to follow her so you can inform him of her true colours.

Utopian, naïve, childish, preposterous... Oh, how those stuck-ups at the medical school enjoyed mocking my ideals. But I have always been the better man. Yes, I will open up my doors to them, let them contemplate what they once laughed at. Deliver them these formal invitations.

Dr. Mercier has not forgotten how his colleagues at the medical school laughed at his anarchist ideas. But now that his dreams have become a reality, he has decided to extend a friendly invitation to them. Sounds like he can't wait to see the look on their faces...

Sir Archibald Blake, that phony old man... I bet the peacocks in his back garden are better fed than most of his queen's subjects. I despise those flamboyant creatures and everything they stand for... Yes, of course! If you want to prove something, kidnap one of his precious peacocks!
Oh! So this... this is the peacock, huh? Er-, yes... Yes! What to do next? Oh, I know — put it in your newspaper!
In a fit of genius, Hugo has suggested you steal one of Sir Archibald's peacocks. There seems to be a deeper meaning to the whole shenanigan that is not yet entirely clear to you...
PEACOCK DETENTION

In an unexpected turn of events, our governor has decided to follow Dr. Hugo Mercier's hunch and steal one of Sir Archibald Blake's feathered pets. To what end, no one is yet entirely sure, but our editorial department has been informed that it is absolutely crucial!

Von Malching, loathsome baron of only the vilest form of liberalism, must be overthrown! He's drilled fear deep into his workers' brains, they need a push — nay, inspiration! — to rise against their oppressor!

Mercier thinks it's time for Von Malching's workers to realise that they have the power to put him in his place. He's tasked you with sneakily delivering some of his most brilliant instigators to Von Malching's shores, so they can spark a revolution.
What!? A riot!? No, no, no!! Stay where you are! I will not have this! Make them shut up, you incompetent milksops!!

Slavery is murder. Property is theft. Merchants prance the waters carrying the stolen fruits of the workers' labour, and claim to have the right to cut the hands of those who take back what's rightfully theirs. An enlightened soul would cut *their* hands...
The very concept of "property" is in itself an abuse — a usurpation. Simply put: theft. Hugo claims merchants should be the ones paying the price for their crimes.

A good friend of mine wrote that "the idea of God is the most decisive negation of human liberty, and necessarily ends in the enslavement of mankind." That church you have is indoctrinating your people into conformism. It is despicable. Many would celebrate you breaking those chains...

Religion poisons the minds of individuals into submission, such is the anarchists' conviction. Dr. Mercier hints that many people will be immensely happy if you could get rid of the archaic institution of the Church.

There isn't a single church left on this island, I made sure of that. But the preachers... still they creep in our streets, spreading their poisonous creeds. We cannot allow this — it is our moral duty to put an end to this age of obscurantism!

No matter how many churches Hugo razed to the ground, some pious preachers still remain on his island. As Hugo puts it, if you are virtuous, you will help him find them and stop them from pouring their venom.

Each individual must participate in the farming of the land: get grime under their nails; learn the gruelling labour that goes into providing for their community. But... not everyone yet equipped to farm the land properly, so the last harvest was not... efficient. It's a learning process, and I will not let them be discouraged by a small inconvenience! Send us some rations — no one needs to know.

Hugo established a job rotation so everyone in his community will, at some point, learn what it's like to work in the fields. Unfortunately, many of them are not quite there yet, and they are having some trouble keeping up with the basic demands of the population. Hugo has asked you to deliver some food — all the better if no one ever gets to know it was you who filled up their storerooms...

I would never dream of taking away people's right to revolt, but honestly, why can't these people understand that it takes time to build a new society? The issues they raise are nothing but a few bumps in the road to our utopia! You should talk some sense into them...

Sometimes, people can be truly short-sighted. Those who expect immediate results will naturally become agitated at the first sign of any inconvenience. Gently persuade the rioters on Dr. Mercier's island that a few bumps are to be expected on the road to a new society — and they should just learn to keep quiet...

People can be so slow witted! I have commissioned my favourite playwright to enact a play about the heroes of the commune, to hopefully stimulate our people's minds, and open their eyes as to the unlimited benefits of our system. A sugar coating can make the pill easier to swallow, and all that. Take a picture of the theatre goers to inform of the mandatory attendance. I will make sure they all look excited.

Hugo is fed up with having to explain the benefits of anarchy to his comrades, so he's staging a play at which attendance is mandatory — a play he hopes will spark their interest. Take a picture of the first batch of obligated theatre-goers to announce the event as if it were an exciting occasion.

A brand new script from the revolutionary playwright Umberto Brocht will be premiered in Hugo Mercier's theatres. "It is my brainiest, driest, most didactical script thus far", declared the author about the mandatory cultural event. Preview attendants looked like they tried their very best to enjoy every last bit of entertainment!
FOR THE COMMUNE

The establishment propaganda machine will have you believe that anarchy is violent, chaotic, and unstable, but it is them who abuse violence to amass power and tear down those who defy them. I need to let my people know that they need not fear, for we have built a strong wall of defences to repel the weapons of the capital.

Dr. Mercier wants to spread the message that his people need not worry about being attacked by capitalist powers, which is why he would like you to take and print a photograph of his solid harbour defences.
PROTECTIVE CROWN
Dr. Hugo Mercier has worked on reinforcing his shore's incisors with plenty of metal fillings that will stop cloying capitalists from striking the nerves of his city.

War reminds men of the things that truly matter. It'd be hard even for these simpletons to complain about the petty details with an enemy at our doorstep. They leave me no choice but to fabricate one...

Hugo Mercier is having trouble keeping his people in line. He hopes that focusing their energy on a war against a common enemy will distract them from the petty details that have been raising their scepticism, but he needs your help in putting together his charade.
ENEMIES OF THE PEOPLE

Landslide victory of Dr. Hugo Mercier casts away the fiendish enemies that wish to incarcerate his people within vicious liberalism. Trust towards their selfless leader reaches historical heights, as their profound sense of community strengthens in the face of adversity.

As a leader, I am no ruler — I am a vessel. A vessel for the voice of every individual in this community. I need to hear their true voices, what their minds and hearts are claiming for. They would discuss it more openly with a neutral party. A party like you.
Dr. Hugo Mercier needs to hear the voice of his people in order to be a good leader for them, but he believes they will speak their minds more candidly to you.
POPULAR UNISON
A survey conducted on Dr. Hugo Mercier's island reveals that 100% of its population agrees with every decision their beloved leader makes.

... and we're almost out of medicam-... Oh! Hello, comrade! Our thoughts on Dr. Hugo? Well, things couldn't be going better! Yes, everything's fine — everything's absolutely perfect. Now, if you'll excuse me...

... what are we going to do when the cold comes b-...? Shh! Good day, comrade! Dr. Hugo? Yes, yes, he's the greatest leader we could ask for! We have nothing — absolutely nothing — bad to say about him. Adieu.

... there's only so much left after my children have finished eat- W-wow, you startled me! What was I saying? Oh, never mind... We love Dr. Hugo, yes we do! And my children do too! Yes, yes, very much so! Well, good day.

Do not underestimate the dirty tricks the establishment is willing to use to undermine regimes such as ours. They have infiltrated our community, and now they are conspiring to take me down. Find them — I believe they'll be pretending to enjoy culture...

Dr. Mercier is certain that there's a group of establishment infiltrators conspiring to overthrow him. He has tasked you with finding them. They might be around one of the few places on Mercier's island that has something to do with entertainment.

We aren't conspirators, I swear! My children were hungry — I had to take a bit more than usual! Please, please, don't take us to Dr. Hugo! We can take the next ferry out of here, and you can just pretend you never saw us.

Oh, hello! Apparently some people from our community have arrived at your docks... by mistake. They were meaning to go, er... somewhere else. As they have no means of return, I must ask that you deliver them to us — back to their friends and families, of course.

A group of people from Mercier's island have appeared at your docks. Never mind them saying that they mean to stay with you — they are a bit disoriented from the swaying of the ship, and need your help to get back home.
Decayed traitors, willing to lick the boots of those who stomp on us in exchange for shiny, meaningless trinkets! Wreck them! Make an example out of them!
A gang of traitors have fled Mercier's island. He has asked you to sink their ship, and help him make an example out of them.
Please, we have children with us! All we wanted was to live in peace. Have pity, please! I will work for you!

No sane person can see that many flaws in our perfect utopia. One of my mentors at the Academy of Medicine, Dr. Cotton, discovered mental illness to be but a reflection of untreated infections in the body. My people deserve to be cured. I will require her expertise — and some new tools...

What greater indication of mental illness is there than the inability to recognise the many advantages of anarchy? Dr. Mercier needs some new tools — and the knowledge of his former mentor, Dr. Harriet Cotton — to treat those who dissent against his policies.
It's been a long time, Dr. Cotton. Please, make yourself at home. Yes, this is our first patient. He has already been numbed. So, which molar should I pull out...?

If those separatists have time to dwell on harmful thoughts, it is because they're not working hard enough! Disorders of the mind vanish with every blister you burst for the well-being of your community. Gather my patients, I will ease their minds!

More and more people are finding reasons to complain about Dr. Mercier's leadership. He, of course, considers this to be a symptom of their foggy minds. Luckily, he's devised a way to clear them: excruciatingly tough labour.

Remember, remember... how their so-called justice has failed and abused us all. A true envoy of justice would blow up the very foundations of that crooked system. And from the smouldering remains, genuine freedom would arise....
In an even more eloquent manner than usual, Dr. Hugo Mercier has suggested you install a large volume of gunpowder around the landmark of Her Majesty's justice system: Wormways Prison.

Gunpowder, treason and plot... Such are the charges "Her Majesty" holds against me. Yet I am but a vessel that carries the indignant fire of a nation, on my way to ignite the blast that will demolish their fabricated order.
In an almost overly dramatic move, Dr. Hugo has set a whole ship on fire as a metaphor for his bombastic leadership. It now falls to you to be its chaperone, on its way to blow Wormways to pieces.
I see no reason why this gunpowder treason should ever be forgot! May this historical moment provide a blueprint for generations to follow!
After the theatrical detonation at Wormways Prison, many a prisoner managed to escape from their cells and jump into the water. You can't just leave them to drown!

Leon and I have stood together ever since we first picketed at the Academy... Could it be him? He contradicts my every decision, second guesses every word I say... It wouldn't be past that wretched Queen to hold my trust in my comrades against me...

Dr. Hugo Mercier feels it — the prying gaze of his old comrade Leon upon his every move, waiting for the perfect moment to sell him out to the Queen... In order to either confirm or dispel Mercier's doubts, you must follow the man and see what business he is truly up to.
A fair trade again, Mr. Leon. But I must admit, I am surprised at your colleague, Dr. Mercier. I had imagined an advocate for chaos would be a less reliable supplier. Do give him my compliments.
A simple trade? He must have noticed you and concealed any sign of his betrayal... There must be something in his books that proves he is double-crossing our people! We must dig deeper!

Far from being convinced of Leon's innocence, Dr. Mercier has urged you to go through his old colleague's personal records, both at his workplace and his home, to see if you can find any evidence that would prove him guilty of treason.
My apologies... We've looked everywhere, and there is nothing at all that would lead anyone to believe that Leon is anything but a devoted anarchist and a competent representative of the people...

What exactly are you looking for? Is my Leon in trouble...? But he's the most loyal man in the world! He talks with such passion about how exciting it is to be part of this revolution, hand in hand with his old friend Hugo...!

Lies! Of course he made sure to erase every trace of his treachery! Or are you on his side too!? No? Then prove it! Sneak this into his ship's hold! I will expose the viper at any cost, and save my people from his poison!

Not yet satisfied with the results of your investigation, Dr. Mercier wants you to make sure that there is evidence to incriminate his old friend Leon of conspiring against his regime. Even if you have to create it yourself.

People from every corner of the world have joined our community since we embarked on this endeavour, but we haven't received any newcomers for months now... I have reason to believe the crown are blockading us. Someone must look into this...
The number of people joining Dr. Mercier's utopia has suddenly halted, and he suspects the Queen may be to blame. He needs you to conduct some investigations into this matter.

Help! Please! We were attacked on our way to Dr. Hugo's utopia! Ohh, we worked so hard to build those ships, and now... all of them, burnt to ashes! The attackers, they bore the Crown's sigil! Don't leave us here, I beg you!
Flamethrowers! So that's what that queen has been up to! Well, I guess the apple doesn't fall far from the tree after all. We will have to be very wary of them...

Oh, hello! I merely intended to alert you about Dr. Mercier. He most definitely has a gift with words, but there may be less... consequential content to them than one might imagine. I believe your heart is in the right place, but please... Bear this in mind in future.

We abhor violence, but this abuse from the Crown must be repaid in kind! So many honest lives lost at sea, and their only crime was to believe a better world was possible! Enough! What goes around comes around.
Unable to bear the Queen's pressure any longer, Dr. Mercier has asked you to help him warn her that any harm she does to his people will be returned.

Whyever would you do that!? Attacks...? Well, I can assure you Her Majesty knows absolutely nothing about that! He is manipulating you like he manipulated all those people! Do not fall for it, I sincerely beg of you. Stay loyal to your queen!
You have earned our trust. My trust. Being discreet as you always are, you will have no problem delivering this man to the royal residence unseen. Believe me, it is of the utmost importance.
Dr. Mercier requires you to sneak past Sir Archibald's patrols, and make sure a very enigmatic masked man arrives at High Clarence Hall docks unseen. Where have you seen that mask before...?

The fuse is burning, we must brace for the grand finale! As the royal fleet heads for us, you must decide: are you willing to fight for enlightenment and equality, or will you support centuries of oppression and obscurantism?
After months of tensions between Mercier and the Crown, the conflict is about to reach an armed resolution. You must now choose which side you are on: anarchy or monarchy.
A truly individual thinker! I am so proud of you, comrade! Here — our scientists have developed these explosives. Regrettably, we will very soon be needing them.
Thank you for staying a sane constant throughout this most regrettable affair... Her Majesty didn't want things to come to this, but alas, it seems to be the only way forward now...
The flame has risen, our job is done. Time to report back.
You have spotted a mysterious ship observing the battle from afar. Follow them, and find out what their role was in the events that just unfolded.
Everything went exactly as planned. Now both Mercier and the Queen are weak enough for us to take control. Igne Natura Renovatur! Wait, who are you...? Intruders! They mustn't escape!

It can't be... Were the Pyrphorians manipulating us all from the start? Oh dear... Dr. Mercier really did believe it was us who attacked his people. I must speak to him at once — as much as we disagree, neither of us meant these hostilities.
The... the Pyrphorians...? But... No, it was the Queen...! She hates our utopia — she is a despot and a schemer! Those people must have been under her command all along! Yes.... yes, that's it...
Sir Archibald Blake has requested your presence at High Clarence Hall to discuss a touchy subject.
Sir Archibald Blake has requested your presence at High Clarence Hall immediately.
Who are you to refuse your people the knowledge of anarchy? Publish anarchist propaganda in your newspaper, or Dr. Mercier will assume you are against it.
Open up your newspaper's draft and click 'edit'. Then drag one of the relevant articles to replace the standard news.

Publish in your newspaper:
At least 1 anarchist propaganda article

OR:
Turn them in:
Click on Mercier's Town Hall

EITHER:
Help them escape:
Click on Mercier's lighthouse

OR:
Take a picture of:
Shipwrecked traitors

EITHER:
Rescue:
Anarchist defectors

OR:
Sail to Mercier's Revolutionary Clipper to side with him

EITHER:
Sail to Archibald Blake's lighthouse to defend the crown

Listen to:
Prosecutors

Find and steal:
Sir Archibald's Peacock

Listen to:
Apologists
Find the torchbearer running around the streets of your city.
The priests are being persecuted by workers in the streets of your city.
The anarchists are gathered around a fire, hiding in your city.
Anarchists are burning books in your city.
Find the rioting mobs stomping down the streets in Dr. Hugo Mercier's city.
Look for the conspirators near Dr. Mercier's variety theatre.
Look for the preachers near Dr. Mercier's marketplace, trade union and town hall.
Find the dissidents hiding near Dr. Mercier's workers' residences.
Talk to Dr. Mercier's residents at the variety theatre, the town hall and the trade union.
In order to turn your passive trade balance positive, make sure you're selling more goods at your trading post than you're buying.

Increase your reputation with [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]:
[Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]

Demolish every [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]:
[Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
Some anarchist defectors are requesting asylum on your island.
The anarchist defectors would like to offer you something as a reward for your kindness.
Some anarchy defectors would like to thank you with a gift.
Dr. Hugo Mercier smirks at the trouble his infiltrators are creating on your island.

Dr. Mercier promised us an utopia, but the things we saw there... We have managed to escape his totalitarian hell, but now we have nowhere to go. All we want is an honest life; please, let us live here!
When you see the happy smiling faces among Dr. Mercier's commune, you know their struggles are over. Their pain is over. Why not show your own people what they're missing?
Your people are envious of life in Dr. Mercier's commune. They are insisting you publish an image of one of his islands in your newspaper — even if it tarnishes your own reputation in the process.
THE BLESSINGS OF ANARCHY
An unprecedented photographic report illustrates the idyllic life of people on Dr. Hugo Mercier's island, where all individuals are equal, and not one is better clothed or fed than their neighbour.
The folk who came over from Dr. Mercier's island have opened our eyes! If we have the skill to fashion products from steel, then it is us who is entitled to that product, not you!

Dr. Mercier's ideas are spreading among your residents, and they're beginning to suspect it is only you who benefits from all they produce. They demand a large quantity of the steel beams and weapons they've sweated over be awarded to them.

Oi, boss, ever heard of the labour theory of value? It's our sweat and blisters that should give gubbins their pricetag! Yet our wages are risible compared to what those soft-handed artisans get. Redress the balance, before we break it!
The workers have become acquainted with some aspects of anarchist theory, and they now demand to be compensated for all the value their labour has lost on the capitalist free market.
Bread is but the basics of a meal! Are you a stuck up bourgeois that just tells the common people to go "eat brioche"? Hand out the loaves, now!
Your workers will not settle for the crumbs! If you want to keep your empire from crumbling from within, you'd better keep their bellies full.
We workers know what we're doing! Let us manage our own! Give us a space to unite and decide collectively, like on Dr. Hugo's island!
Your workers are claiming their right to control and manage the means of production. A trade union would be the perfect space for them to come together and debate.
You intoxicate us with the lies of priests to keep us compliant in the face of oppression! We don't want any more churches — give us temples of democracy instead!
Your workers are fed up with having their minds numbed by religion. They demand you take down a church and replace it with a town hall — or else...
As long as we depend on goods from other nations, we are hostages to the free market! You'd better make sure we're not buying more than we're selling!
It's important for your workers that you make sure your nation is self-sufficient, and doesn't rely on goods from other nations. They will not be satisfied until your trade balance is positive.

If we must play along with the laws of capitalism, then we'll play them at their own game! If we over-supply, prices will have to drop. Maybe to the point where anyone can just help themselves to whatever they need!

Overproducing, Mercier argues, is actually a good thing for the people, since the prices drop so much it becomes unnecessary to track who helps themselves to what. That is what your workers want for your island too.
Why build so many police stations? Are you scared of the voice of the people? We will not tolerate this authoritarian repression! Try and address our problems instead!

When police are everywhere, justice is nowhere. So your workers have come to believe after learning more about anarchy. They have destroyed all your police stations, and their violence will resume if you can't maintain the peace without them.
Your laws protect the privileged! It's time you legislate for the people, or we'll destroy the entire system!
Fed up with an unjust system, your people demand you institute laws that protect the common classes.

Our new anarchist peers have opened our eyes to the evils of society! The boys made this poster at the union to spread the word. I reckon you'll have no issue in putting it up on our town hall, right?
Your workers are thrilled by everything they've learnt about anarchy. In fact, so taken are they that they've stayed up all night creating a poster to paste on your town hall.
You embody the establishment! We will join Dr. Hugo's commune and become free, equal individuals! You want to prove you're a decent human being? Then don't be a sore loser, and shelter our path!

There is no stopping these workers from leaving your island to join Dr. Mercier's people, but if you still want to be decent towards them, you can make sure they at least have safe passage to his island.
No wonder we're turning against capitalism when we lead such pathetic lives! If we were twice as happy, we wouldn't be looking for a way out!
The only reason your workers are starting to find anarchy attractive is because they are miserable. Well, maybe miserable is putting a bit strongly, but they could certainly be happier!
Dr. Hugo is the brightest mind of the century! If he doesn't respect you, why should we!?

You are at odds with Dr. Hugo Mercier, which means your workers — who look up to the anarchist leader — are at odds with you. Perhaps winning the heart of the doctor will earn you the love of your people.
As workers, labour is our greatest power! The lads that came over from Mercier's say they feel mighty good after a long day of hard work. Come on, let's add some more fuel!

Dr. Hugo's anarchist theory states that workers achieve their greatest value when their produce remains within their community. You're not sure if your workers understand the full picture, but they do want to work harder, so who are you to argue with them?
With so much talk about the evils of religion, priests are starting to be persecuted! Even if you can sympathise, no soul deserves to be threatened because of their beliefs. Protect them!
The anarchist mistrust of the clergy has spread to your population. It appears some of your workers are harassing priests! A concerned citizen has asked you to find them and defend them.
Oh no... Oh, there you are! I just heard something very — deeply! — vexing. It appears the anarchists are planning an attack! You must stop the man with the torch! Please, I beg of you!
A panicked artisan came looking for your help. He overheard a group of anarchists discussing an impending attack on your city. Find the man bearing the torch before it's too late!
Inspector Langdon says he's too busy chasing away anarchist troublemakers to look into the disappearance of my hens! Can't you give them a hand...?

The police have been overwhelmed lately, as they try to uncover the anarchist infiltrators, but your people have other problems they need their help with! Help them unearth the anarchist gangs to free up some space on their plate.

The anarchists are setting fire to every piece of writing that doesn't align with their convictions! Even if I can see where their grievances are coming from, this is the greatest crime I can possibly fathom! Please, stop this intellectual genocide!
Aghast, an engineer has alerted you to some anarchists who are going around burning books. It doesn't matter whether their ideas are valid or not — in her eyes, no book must ever be burnt.
Darn those lousy, wretched anarchists! You! You're lucky my family were lounging at the Dawson's summer resort when they torched our household! Restore it! Immediately!

As much as Dr. Mercier likes to brag that anarchy is peaceful, his followers on your island seem to have a different perspective. They've wrecked an investor's residence, and he's now demanding that you build him a new one, at once.
No! My factory! My life's work, ruined! Why would anarchists confuse my modest craftsmanship with their dragon, capitalism? Please, would you restore the dreams they robbed me of?
The anarchist attacks are not only targeting wealthy investors, but humble artisans too. With his business reduced to ashes, this poor man has lost his livelihood. Help him restore it.
You saved our lives! We are eternally grateful! Please, if there's anything we can do — any way at all that we could be of use to you — allow me to repay your kindness with my expertise!
Among the people who arrived from Dr. Mercier's island, some have pledged to work for you as a way of repaying you for your hospitality.

Make no mistake — I might look like a worker, but I'm a trained engineer. I joined Mercier on the promise of a better world, but it turned out to be a fallacy... My designs will serve a better purpose here.
There was a brilliant engineer amongst the last batch of anarchist defectors you allowed into your city. He is more than happy to share his creations with you.
I was so fed up with Mercier screaming lies at our faces with this loudspeaker, I just had to take it away from him! Ugh, I can't even stand the sight of this wretched thing. Take it off me, please!
This anarchist defector was so done with listening to Dr. Mercier through his loudspeaker that he snatched it away the second he had the chance. He is now offering it to you.
Anarchy Quest

Dr. Mercier used to be a respectable dental practitioner before he became the leader of an anarchist regime. You either see eye to eye with him, or you are an ally of his oppressors, there is no middle ground... But if he agrees to trade with us, we may get access to some very unique merchandise on his trading post.
Workers are enthused by the new system of written labour notes to reward their efforts.
A new and better printing machine helps distribute labour notes to workers at no maintenance cost!
The labour notes are now so beautifully typeset and presented, they really look like they're worth something! A sign of the wonders of anarchy to come!
The people own what they produce! They should be free to join a great queue to collect their quota!
The people need somewhere they feel comfortable sharing ideas to help economise during production!
An airy space, not at all empty, but brimming with ideas for economisation! Self-sufficiency; over-abundance! Those are the topics for discussion at this venue's very functional table.
Justice in the hands of the people, no matter how busy they are!
Disputes should be solved in a transparent trial conducted by victims and peers, not buried and obscured under the bureaucracy of evil governments!
A wondrous sanctum that only its most committed adherents know the true value of! It is here that great lectures are given by the hard-working — the experts on how to be free!
Ideas are weapons! One dose of the anarchist manifesto can turn the enemy feral!
Upon seeing Dr. Mercier's flag flapping from your ships, there is every chance of the enemy hopping on to your bandwagon…
If for any reason the books and pamphlets aren't working...
Big enough to bring the house of the Royal Council down — just don't fluff it, or they'll be celebrating your failure forever.
Spread your ideas to the people! Free them from their masters!
Spread your biggest ideas to the people! Free them from their masters!
It's only a matter of time before great change erupts!
Only the invisible pilots steering a course to anarchy can avoid collisions with these invisible terrors!
Accidents happen, and your toffs know it.
Not so keen on cocktails now, are they!? Hehehee.
Looks like Cinderella better think twice about going to that ball...
Working conditions will be volatile!
This could be a (very) sudden solution to all the problems of capitalism.
Full of wacky and worrying ideas. Incendiary in the wrong hands.
Contains a million and one ways to equalise society. Most involve fire.
Elite readers of this radical journal, realising the grave threat to their persons, suddenly come down off their high horses.
A shamelessly bigoted and unpleasant journal advising ruthless exploitation.
The outward elegance of this journal scarcely conceals its scowling contempt for the lower classes.
Decorating the coffee tables of tyrants and megalomaniacs everywhere, this is the news journal of choice for those wishing to subjugate and exploit.
Gentle propaganda for the easily led.
The mysterious waves emanating from this poster mean mind control, at a cost.
No one would dare contradict the leader, even though he rejects that title. It's far better to be seen as working hard for the community.
The cultural capital of a city belonging to a knight of the Queen is hard to match!
Collected essays on milking the masses for all they've got.
The theme of the articles in this fat cat's journal is "Workers as animals: how to whip the most out of your beasts of burden."

The one edition of the journal every aspiring industrialist must own. "Progress always comes at a cost," reads the introduction to the brutal collection of articles, "make sure it is never you that pays the price."
Liberalist musings on the subject of romance, which verge on the anarchic.
More than mere liberalist musings on the subject of romance, this doctrine promotes equality of the sexes, classes and other radical notions for a freer society.
A passionate vindication of Marxist ideas with a focus on gender inequality in society. Likely to help the angry feel their voice is finally being heard.
Convincing arguments for individual resistance to the concept of government on the grounds of liberty and morality.
Ella Golden presents her own life as an example of the oppression of the state, and how its violence begets violence.
A damning critique of government, religion and technocracies. This lengthy essay relishes presenting capital, the state and God as prime targets for the popular revolution.
Agricultural marvels on display at the town hall include the tools, fruits and flowers that are so abundant in a collective.
Industrial marvels on display at the town hall include textiles, furnishings and clothes, embodying the pragmatism of a collective.
The human mind and intelligence celebrated through science; the mechanisms, statistics, and theories that define the equality of a collective.
Celebrated writers gather to present their inspirations in the town hall — and in the evenings, recite excerpts of their attacks against the state.
This radical exhibition and series of workshops show art and architecture stripped back to new minimalist ideas of beauty; a deeper beauty.
Anarchy!
Violence begets violence!
When the goal justifies the means, throw yourself into the action!
One half of freedom's duet.
One half of freedom's duet.
A woman of the avant-garde, fighting on the seas to achieve freedom for herself — and everyone else.
Protesters will be too hungover to remember their chants.
For the right money, he will sign a papal bull to dispense pretty much any sin.
Her satirical comedies about anarchism make committed left-wingers flush with shame.
There isn't too extortionate a price the elite won't pay if Mr. Garrick makes them want it bad enough.
A unique genius of collective psychology, his takes on publicity shape the consumerist society of today.
Screams very loudly.
A light in the face of obscurantism.
Freely chooses to work for the well-being of her fellow individuals.
Cartographer of a society model based on voluntary cooperation.
A man with an infectious, impetuous and impassioned urge for action.
Famous for his paradoxes that baffle the conscience of the privileged and empower the poor.
The cone drips with the copious quantities of spittle only the very greatest orators are capable of producing.
The trophy to cap off Dr. Mercier's revolution?
A compilation of the most persuasive essays he wrote on anarchy during his time as a dentistry undergraduate.
The spiciest recipes of the time. Don't burn yourself.
Engulfs enemy targets in anarchist slogans, causing their crew to mutiny, significantly slowing them down.
Spread Anarchy
Discharges a bomb that explodes after a short delay.
Bomb
Disseminates anarchist propaganda amongst your enemy's population, encouraging riots.
Anarchist Propaganda

Discharges a bomb that explodes after a short delay.

Places a mine below the surface that explodes on enemy proximity.
New propaganda articles unlocked.
There is a shortage of [AssetData([NotificationContext Value(Workforce) Int]) Text] across your islands!
BURN YOUR MONEY IN PROTEST!
Save the placards for another day — take your rage out on something inanimate! Because money, and the insufferably greedy 1% who control it, will soon cease entirely to exist!
WORK YOURSELF TO DEATH!...
...and live on in immortality! Defy the insidious capitalist agenda with plain hard work, your greatest weapon in this war! Be a cruel taskmaster to yourself! Strive for self-sufficiency!
EVERYONE WORKS, EVERYONE THRIVES!
Young or old, it makes no difference — go to work like the rest of us and receive basic food and clothing in absurd quantities!

A self-proclaimed anarchist, Dr. Mercier has created a radical new society free of the influence of the state. Formerly a champion of a student union of dentists, Mercier was asked by the Queen to use his popular appeal to pacify increasing threats of revolution in her territories. Instead, Mercier sided with the protesters, declaring the people's complete independence from crown authority.

Meet Dr. Hugo Mercier, the Anarchist. Will he antagonise you, or become your greatest ally? Discover his unique approach to leadership as you get to know him through his exclusive quest line, and advocate for anarchy using his new propaganda articles and items. But beware — there are many downsides to anarchy spreading into your cities...
THE ANARCHIST

Festival of Reason
In the Festival of Reason, anarchists come together to celebrate truth, liberty, community and the abolition of governments.
Dr. Mercier's voice drills into the minds of his followers from these towers.
No God, No Masters!
Remember, power is in yourselves!
You work for something greater now; it's the ultimate blessing I can bestow.
Do this your own way— no— no really! Perceive it in whatever way you wish!
A great wave is coming— let it carry you to your dreams.
Now's your moment! Action must be taken! Rise! Rise!
I can give you the dental key, but you must reach into the mouth and twist.
The smallest inkling of success is still your inkling of success!
You must be champing at the bit!
Go, be impulsive!
You've done well. Go now, footloose and fancy-free.
Your autonomy is admirable.
You are a doer. Anarchists are doers!
A peaceful smile at the end is worth the momentary discomfort.
The people love those who make themselves indispensible.
You have the courage of your convictions.
Instead of dismantling the status quo, you perpetuate it!
The chicanery of a career politician.
Apathy is the carbuncle of society!
Gums bleed, but quickly heal.
Never lose heart. Never.
And yet the determination comes easily to so many of us!
Anyone else would have been able to go through with it.
Always try to get at the root of a problem.
Success can come in a twinkling of the eye.
I find the suspense terrible. Long may it last.
The more you do, the more you can do!
Keep pushing, never let yourself be pushed back.
Your actions urge a final reckoning ever closer, do not relent!
There is no right or left, only the liberty of choice!
It is not the banner under which you stand, but your equity of spirit.
Have you acted on behalf of the people?
Your submission carries more weight than any academic paper.
Your contribution is made?
I-I admire your spontaneity, but the occasion is inopportune.
I don't enjoy turning away committed activists such as yourself.
Your single-mindedness deserves better reward.
If you panic, you may have to be killed to save the rest of us.
Too many have crossed the line…stabbed us in the back. We have to equalise things.
Bad and good sometimes appear to change places, but all will be well if we remember our cause!
When love and hope are not enough, I will fight! Die if I have to.
It was meant to be Eden before the fall; its pleasures simple, universal, tranquilising.
Pamphleteers flood your streets, spreading the good word!
A general strike is the people's greatest weapon!
The tide turns against you! This is the cusp, the point of no return!
Your people, like a wild-eyed mare, are ready to break from their bridle!
The people can hold themselves back no longer!
They're sick of your tyranny, now that bile is flooding out!
They don't need anyone to tell them what to do, look at them!
Your dictatorship is over! The people hold the reins now!
I didn't set them upon you, I didn’t need to!
You were a great help in turning those cultists, you've made a deep connection with my community now.
The Pyrphorians are taking vulnerable people away from more constructive forms of resistance.
Who are the Pyrphorians, does anyone really know? It's obvious those pulling the strings are fat cats in armchairs living off the chaos and misery.
Notice the Pyrphorians wear masks? That's not struggle, that's cowardice.
Religion and people's welfare don't mix, just look at the Pyrphorians.
If you think neighbouring an anarchist will be chaos, you deceive yourself. Anarchy is order!
I challenge you to oversee your own transformation. Don't wait for your people to make it for you!
I expect you think you know what anarchy is? Expect to have all those misconceptions overturned!
When it's this sweet, you have to worry about toothrot.
Nothing is more certain than the uncertain!
A defining moment, for all of us.
The wind has switched!
This is it, this is change!
…and just like that, a thousand poorhouse faces lift.
Joy unbridled!
You are an original.
Brave ideas survive through brave individuals like you.
You are a mover and shaker.
There's a stool for you at the table of the free.
How do you feel, to be a salmon leaping upriver?
You fly against the grain!
You are reinventing society!
The world must change or be changed!
I will never give up on the people.
The injustice!
They call it civilisation. It's laughable.
Hard to control feelings in times like this.
Reduced to serfs in the mud.
Pulling teeth is grisly work.
Well, enjoy the cage you have built for yourself.
You think it's free will, but you're a pawn.
They feed you lies like a duck seed, and you've never quacked.
You'll make yourself a target.
Perhaps you don't realise what's at stake here!
Have you never asked questions? Who doesn't ask questions?
You only exist, you're not alive.
Don't give me that twisted smile!
I am Dr. Mercier. Beg pardon, but since I have a foot in your door, you should listen; anarchy is the only way!
Dr. Hugo Mercier; shining the lamp that is anarchy into the dark, plaque-ridden crevices of state.
Worry not! You've nothing to fear from Hugo Mercier— I am a pacifist. But the people, the people! There is a rampant beast!
Take a pamphlet— free as the wind, as we all are!
Come in, relax, open wide!
Paradise is all around you, but you really have to look to see it.
Welcome to our humble commune.
The island that upset the apple cart.
Voice your hate against the state here, without fear of recrimination!
This is the crossroads, from which a million starry paths surge in every direction!
Say a few words to the people while you're here. Tell them what a lie the government is.
I demand so much of them, and yet, if it can free them from their chains…
United by suffering; black, white, rich, poor. Our congregation lives and dies together.
Unfettered from possessions, they listen only to their hearts...and my broadcasts.
Women, men…children. Happy.
The essentials we have in extraordinary abundance. Never a need to look to the outside for aid!
They are free now, to sail wherever they wish!
No hierarchies aboard my ships. Every man worthy as the next!
Like an ocean that collapses petty structures, the people are in heavy swell!
Do you not see? The waves rule themselves!
It isn't just me who wants to rock the boat.
The people's profound thanks.
As promised, the masses are provided for!
Give and thou shalt receive.
Why not, whyever not!
By all means, by all means!
In the interest of the people, I accept.
My privilege to say no. My right.
Only a sheep would baa and nod.
As I said to the Queen— no!
Why should anarchists all have unruly beards? I shave in solidarity with the workers whose contract obliges it of them! Besides...dentists despise beards.
I shepherd no sheep! But stand with them before the fence, ready to leap to liberty!
The mouth is a special instrument. In dentistry you see many who cannot play— any tune, let alone one of their own.
Only when he came to me with chronic toothache, did the college Dean recognise the impact of dentistry, and reluctantly, offer me a chair.
Among the first to be certified a dentist, among the first to label myself "anarchist". Everyday a new first.
Being forced to take a trivial position at a trivial institution was humiliating. I began to see why the students were so angry.
A beautiful gecko came to me, and I knew it was one of those who died wresting the island from the Queen. "Go" I said, "you're free now."
Is there a worse thing to give a child than a doll's house? Just because the young Queen used to trap her puppets in them?
The wall around us symoblises the world serpent, ouroboros of conciliated paradoxes, self-fertilising, self-sustaining, self-sacrificing.
I remember the patients used to lie speechless as they heard my single, simple idea. An idea so big, people called it impossible, but they only lacked the imagination…
My accomplishments in dentistry gave me belief. Suddenly I could be as good as anyone— anyone as good as me.
Representing the Queen I resigned myself to the jaws of obedience and duty. Then one day, something snapped.
Vicente is the vilest of tyrants. But the people of the new world are taking back everything that was never his, as I have from the Crown.
How can George pretend not to hear me when I have a megaphone? Beware! Not all libertarians have open minds!
George the "philosopher king" is a liberal sickeningly comfortable in his inertia.
Alonso is wild! Absolutely wild. His thirst for violence seems almost unquenchable!
Lady Hunt tells me, despite being an enemy of the people, that she had been expecting someone like me to hasten the day of judgement.
I, like Bente, am an optimist. To spread absolute love and freedom is the most constructive thing a human can do.
I straightened Beryl's jaw, now I expect she wants to straighten mine because I threaten to eradicate poverty forever— thereby destroying her entire premise!
Wibblesock, crushed with guilt because he took the money of some undeserving legatee, can you imagine?! I say take that money William! Use it!
Von Malching's greed is not impulsive, but compulsive. The difference is night and day!
Strip Gasparov's veneer, and there's nothing! Here is a man who pays to have his books riffled, so that his grand library appears well-used!
Art is truth. Gasparov is a lie.
Jean is one of the finest I know. Using all at his disposal to protect his vision, even if it means contradiction.
The plight of that maladjusted and grief-stricken Harlow girl, only excites my desire to prevail against the ruthless machinery of state!
Individualists such as Old Nate can always be reminded of the importance of community…
The Queen chose me, of all people, to mediate with the rioters. I mediated heavily in their favour.
The Queen wanted me for her puppet. But I snipped her strings and gave them to the people!
Bleakworth has built a cage around himself. A mercy for the rest of us, he can't see beyond its walls.
What more proof than Bleakworth, that virtue and law have nothing in common?
Princess Qing is itching to betray her Imperialist heritage, I can sense it.
No-one need go cold or hungry.
I can fulfil my covenant with the people, now.
For the common wealth.
Exclude no-one.
We never need to import anything, of course.
Do not let material things define you!
You must understand, I can't promise further trade.
If professors only traded ideas as freely as we do...but they only trade in favours.
Despite our trade, no hierarchy of property develops here, merely rigourous economic planning.
What I like about trading with you, is I know you do it for your people, not just to feed ambition.
A free people, with freedom to create beyond imagination built...well...these ships …
All I ask is a price per ship that does not shame those who built them.
The crown funded these, so be my guest, take as many as you wish!
When it comes to ships I have to be unsentimental.
Maybe I ask too much of these shipbuilders, but see what they had the freedom to author!
Think of them not as possessions, but as tools.
I have all kinds in store.
Share! Provide!
We have everything we need, though you may not.
Saved up your labour notes?
The price of a good should never exceed its cost.
Money will be abolished one day.
I know what will be good for you...
Who knows where this will lead!
Be spontaneous!
Be instinctive!
Act now, think later!
Demand the impossible!
A little anaesthetic?
I've unstoppered the laughing gas.
Freedom has to be taken!
The people will not cease until they have abolished you!
Propaganda by the deed!
Anarchy is anything you want it to be.
Risk nothing, and you risk everything.
Your passion gives me faith.
Damned if I do, damned if I don't.
You think being an anarchist means I'll always disagree?
The people trust me to know what's best.
No decision is taken without the people's approval.
I make up my own rules.
Don't reduce our bond to a transaction.
Look beyond straight lines!
Too slow! Galaxies have shifted!
Stagnation! The tactics of the establishment!
Save your filibuster for the royal council!
I will not be left to vegetate here!
You are not in this wholeheartedly.
Everything I demand of you, I demand of myself sixfold.
Why not take it even further!
I was thinking of something more radical!
Even when we yield, we are unyielding.
I'll not tarnish my good name with violence.
I believe in revolution, not reaction.
Throw your bomb if you have the mettle, throw!
Dentists never flinch.
Then you'll just have to kill the people where they stand.
Anarchy, like dentistry, is an exact science.
For mutual fulfilment.
I don't try to lead, I try to be a guide.
Anarchy is fairness.
Kindness is universal.
Once they take hold, ideas become unstoppable.
Not political constraints. Moral constraints.
I am agitated, and so are my many friends.
You have no authority. No authority!
A reaction to sustained repression!
A dentist has to use his drill.
Your destruction is my creation!
Justice is the living god!
We are both truth-seekers.
I can promise you immunity.
War and peace, and in between.
You're giving anarchy a bad name.
A cross-pollination of our economic principles.
Fancy forming an adhocracy?
We are masters of our own happiness, but we can't do it alone.
I can't be seen to be consuming imports.
I need the people to help themselves for a while.
Economics is too important to be left to the traders.
Join the free, live as you please!
Not all bonds are bad. Anarchy can also be family.
I can only trust myself to do what's right for the people.
I have no concerns burning my bridges.
Take it. Property is theft, and I practice what I preach.
I would give it all away in a moment.
The farms have produced so much, I can afford to give some away.
Solidarity.
Amen.
Anarchists enjoy surprises.
Res Publica
An altruist at heart.
Power corrupts!
Perhaps you should rinse out your mouth!
Pah! Dogma!
Beware the ides of March
Lois scelerates
Tyrants always seek to injure the eloquent.
And make us all martyrs? So be it!
Everyone is ready to sacrifice themselves for anarchy!
You and I pursue something beyond ourselves.
You cannot vanquish an idea.
Anarchists are thinkers, not fighters.
Nothing in the universe is irreversible.
An agreement of the people.
We enter into mutual contract.
It is a thing both dangerous and adventurous you do!
I respect your desire for autonomy.
Anarchy means different things to different people.
The Queen took the people's rights, so I took her people.
Like family, but better.
I hereby condone this federacy.
It's so dangerous to go it alone.
Don't cut yourself off, you'll really regret it.
Your first steps towards a gift economy, perhaps?
We use what we need and keep the rest for a rainy day.
The leader of the Pyrphorians?! I despise organised religion, you should know.
Yes, born with privilege, and yet I am willing to sacrifice it— that is the significance of our ideal!
I am a contradiction? But we are all contradictions! There is no dovecote to house us all, I nest where I land.
It's unnecessary to make sweeping statements about me, I am an enigma you can't solve.
You're wrong, in fact I even encourage people to hold two antithetical theories at once.
Duping the Queen was easy; not once did she and her council envision my betrayal!
The people don't need convincing! Or do you not believe the absolute trust they place in me is possible?
My friend, people have minds of their own! Any power to persuade I possess, matters little.
Don't call me a leader. I am an invisible pilot, guiding those most in need.
To those who say I have a gift, I say look within yourself, you have it too, but you must allow yourself to nurture it.
I resented my father all the years he kept servants! In any case, he will no longer speak to me!
No! I seek no special benefits from my position. I own no position!
I find comments about my extended family intrusive and deeply offensive.
An autocracy? If anything it's the opposite. You have no idea what it is I'm trying to achieve!
I don't need a beard! I am a proper anarchist!
In pursuit of truth? Yes, yes, it could be said that I am! I didn't know the power of your words could be so incredible.
Of course! Ask me anything and I'll tell you, anything at all. I am an open book!
Well said. If you do not broadcast your love for your people, it cannot be love!
Many of my dentistry students did look up to me, yes, because unlike my peers I gave them the tools to learn.
Absolutely! It would have been absurdly easy to have made myself rich plucking teeth for the Queen and council.
You show signs of cooperation.
I see you not as ambitious, but audacious.
We can still grow to revere one another.
I believe verily, no-one can stop you storming to freedom!
The people have great admiration for you.
You are finding your own way of thinking.
I have to believe human nature is fundamentally good.
The best dentists are quick to dispense with theory.
You strike me as a typical capitalist.
You're an agent of the Queen, don't try to deny it.
I don't believe in politics, let alone your politics.
Your self-interest puts me in mind of the academy of medicine.
Your world seems staid, where is your revolution?
You're like everyone else I had to suffer at Archibald's garden parties.
I don't think you can recant your statist tendencies.
You should be shaking like a— like a wet dog at all the injustice in the world.
It's an olig…a federation of like-minds.
We all are caught in this maelstrom together.
Good to see you promoting solidarity among like-minds
The people are sick to the back teeth of your nepotism.
The people are reading and hearing all about your collusion.
Like whispers under the ivied colonnades, at the despicable high table.
The allies of anarchism see through your statist scaremongering.
The ulcers of your interventionism are risen again!
Pulling the wrong teeth can leave the bloody savour of revolution in the mouth.
The enemies of freedom must be coerced!
The enemy of the people! Bring the ogre to earth. Destroy them!
Anarchy needs firebrands like you, sowing dissent.
Spreading corruption among my allies is an attack on the free everywhere.
A fellow anarchist has exposed your underhanded imperialism!
A spark of mischief in you, I see.
Regimes are built on deceit, we have to respond in kind.
We all want a share! What's wrong with that?
See how the people seize the economy for themselves!
Can't you see? I'm breaking the cycle of poverty.
A triumph for anarcho-syndicalism! Every honest fellow will have their plot to work on!
This land will forevermore live under the flag of anarchy, and all that promises in the imagination!
The greater the divide between rich and poor, the greater the violence will be!
Buying your way to a degree, a doctorate, a head of faculty…
The Queen tried that you know, but the people bought her out! The commoners!
A single human soul is worth a thousand times what you paid for that island.
Usurper! Tyrant! You would seize the economy from the people?!
Land and liberty! Each fresh outcrop a barricade against the people's enemy!
Not one, but many distinct and autonomous communities!
Send in your diggers, apportion each man a square of turf.
Feel the soil between your fingers! The earth is a common treasury!
The Queen wanted to torch our peaceful commune too, but she saw it would only make things worse.
We had inspiration to sprinkle over that barren soil, but it's not something you can buy or steal.
Perhaps you think that's levelling the land.
They create desolation and they call it peace.
Surprise!
I am no butcher, and this is no war!
My sabre is drawn to the throat of ambition!
Shoot then, shoot, what are you waiting for, coward!
Smash the regime!
I pledged to protect the people.
Those meaningless deaths are your work.
A victory, yet anarchists always remain underdogs!
No amount of lives weigh heavier than the cause!
If I am ready to die, so should they have been.
Ideas always float back to the surface.
Down with your totalitarian structures!
Better you undergo this procedure without anaesthetic.
A tyrant unmasked! Deprived of the sordid accretions of autocratic rule!
Everything's falling apart!
Death and destruction! Hallmarks of the establishment!
The popular tempest has spun, and the flag of anarchy been driven home like a stake!
The many headed hydra is decapitated again! This land is claimed for the free!
To change the master is not to be free! Those people would rather die than serve you.
Only a tyrant! Smearing the walls with blood to eternalise the dreariness!
Better to die with dignity renouncing the state; it has failed you, just as much as it has failed your people.
You have made a martyr of the people! A martyr of me! My death means the end for you. I'll die happily!
How happy and glorious, that you long to reign over us!
Just when the people want an enemy, you destroy one of their heroes.
By destroying our enemies, we change them…
Your victory rouses no leviathan, only the wild and happy monster of freedom.
A new model army.
Revolution is no field of clover
War can only be defeated through war.
Your bomb-builders know there is no other way.
Even as a pacifist, I understand and feel where the anger comes from.
I have profound dislike for regiments with regalia.
Pathetic! There's no bomb better than a book.
Your forces are fuelled by chest-thumping jingoism.
You don't need to dismember the state to destroy it.
You're fighting change, not fighting for it.
I require your immediate society, a tyranny is upon us!
Time to prove how active you are in the union.
The people say I risk it all, praise me for that. Don't you want to be praised?
Give them a pistol, I want to see them shoot us both.
I hope this is our end; it can be our beginning.
They have to believe I'm willing to die for them too.
Each man will lay down before you, and die with their eyes to paradise.
Row upon row of terro-metallic incorruptibles with the slow-crushing power of a jaguar.
Their sacrifice, not any conquest of yours, is what the histories will remember.
The plan is they drag you down with them.
They feel so strongly you should be dead, I'm not going to stand in their way.
It's not a warship. It's a pickaxe for smashing plaster and marble!
Too much truth too soon, might stop change from happening.
People don't always know what will be good for them in the end.
Every student of freedom should at first learn by heart.
The truth will out, and your towers will come tumbling down!
The kind of nonsense publication professors churn out to keep their comfy chairs.
More state lies to subjugate and control?
Give them all the truth they can lay their eyes on; pamphlets, posters, pasteboard hats in bold red letters!
You are only a messenger. Do not rule like a ruler, and you are blameless. You are immune!
Make no illusions; what you are asking of them is difficult, it takes courage.
Trade Unions, the real universities!
Farmers, miners, bakers free to intermingle, to share and celebrate their expertise!
The cyclidion where the winds of change swirl and crystallise into ideas more radiant than any gemstone.
Where the brain finds irrigation, where every seed of thought is shared and fostered to bloom.
The stream flows to the sea, you cannot stem it, only divert it, and it will arrive there in the end.
Let them march, let them egg the police, there's no stopping the unstoppable!
No power is legitimate, but the irrepresible power of the people!
Your workers understand the need to work hard, don't patronise them.
Anarchy is all for them, your humble worker, I will ensure their suffering is soon at an end.
Trade Unions, the real universities!
The cyclidion where the winds of change swirl and crystallise into ideas more radiant than any gemstone.
Where the brain finds irrigation, where every seed of thought is shared and fostered to bloom.
Production should exist to meet human needs, nothing more!
Clothes should not be worn as marks of status!
Each a juju of state control; of mind control!
I believe the leaf-rollers among the most enlightened of all workers.
When people are starving, why turn your nose up at the potato?
Dress as one, but think apart!
Your unblinking, red-eyed dogs emerge to sweep your city of its soul.
I am helping to build a society that polices itself.
What right do those idiots have to tell the people what to think, who to be, what to do?
Trinkets and baubles which foster and perpetuate greed and inequality!
Cultural segregation; another red rag to the real people!
Shop windows to the unattainable; the capitalist illusion of happiness.
Lazy workers never find the strength to resist, do they?
Idleness is a symptom of conformity, of acceptance of the unacceptable!
People are happy to work hard when they know what they're working for.
I push the people no harder than I push myself; day and night.
Start telling the truth, or you'll cause yourself a lot of pain.
Word of mouth isn't enough, but I think you know that.
If you won't sell anarchy, you must be against it!
Your people can finally read all the truth you've been keeping from them!
Anarchy spreads by way of your pamphlets!
The word of anarchy taking wing! No more lies!
Take them in at your own risk— I have my spies.
Of course my spies will pretend they're desperate to be rescued, just like the others...
Some of those bad eggs are still good...
Rebel against your complacent heritage, feed your company to the lions.
I pulled Lord Ditchwater's teeth, he never showed remorse for the closures of the mines, and the desolation of that island.
The Monarch commanded me to placate the mob, instead I stirred them up!
Use whatever means you can to overthrow the system. Even the system itself.
If you need a target for your anger, it's obvious who the enemy is here.
The state wrongfully imprisoned your father. You should be angry. You should do something.
The New World is a cradle of anarchism, it's important for me to include its pockets of resistance in our federation.
Use the Queen to drive your own agenda, that's what I did.
The Pyrphorians are just another sheep cult.
The business with Prosperity is a perfect example of the ruination of the individual by the state.
If the monarch now judges the people, then it's time the people judged the monarchy.
Edvard's fate should rest in the hands of those he hurt, instead of those ignorant wigs.
Even if they are just a mindless cult, the same feelings are shared by so many.
Why the need for the masks? That's what I can't understand.
The Pyrphorians are gone, but the problem that caused them, absurd crown on her head, is somehow still there.
Think it will be so easy to slip back into comfortable old ways? Think again.
I'm shining my spot lamp on your face, I can see you but you can't see me.
I out them publicly, spies, so the people can pick their fate.
I have a mouth mirror and a headlamp, you can't hide your cavities from me.
You find all kinds lurking between your gnashers.
A two-facedness I've rarely seen beyond the quads of colleges.
How can the oppressed have secured the island of a Queen without some subterfuge?
Discretion is a temporary necessity, in future, all will be out in the open!
Proud vigilantes who run the tunnels without any word from me.
Sometimes when a dentist rummages in your mouth, talking in code, you don't need to know why.
Someone has betrayed the commune. That's very serious.
Tomorrow's society, today!
Machines shall one day disencumber every worker!
Wholesome statistics and mechanisms! Not the mendacious toffees the state plies us with.
A real dentist for example, needs only a few simple tools.
Even science has no authority.
Your transformation needs courage, not rational thought.
Within these walls, you are free. No-one outside can say the same.
We need our defences. Our idea is precious, give everything to defend it.
Wherever you go, whomever you meet, cherish truth, defend it fiercely.
The world out there hates you. It's filled with death and bad people who want to hurt you.
You are all free to leave at any time, but then, who would want to? We have it all here.
Some of you have called me Messiah. I ask you to stop. I am no more special than any of you.
There will be spies among us. Treat them without hostility— have faith they will get better soon.
Hysteria is the enemy. Divert your passion into action against our common enemy.
We may come under siege at a moment's notice. Be ready to act precisely as we have planned.
Any person or persons possessed of contraband should be reported at once.
I need you to keep producing for me— for us! We're going to need to stockpile as much as we can.
Individuality, community, joy.
The amnesty is necessary. The weapons are not being confiscated, but put within everyone's reach.
Anyone who disagrees, I invite to talk with me in person, so your concerns can be dealt with.
Assure yourselves, we are investigating the recent disappearances.
We have to be brutal. The world out there is more brutal than any of you know.
