Sometimes I sneak into the hangar just to watch Old Nate ordering the technicians about.
I tried rubbing my coat with fish oil to repel water, just like the Inuit do. But now it's all smelly…
When I feel I can't keep going, I read a page from The Journey of Victory Ashen — one of the great explorers. I've come to keep that book very close.
I saw two tiny arctic foxes in their summer coats the other day. One for the sketchbook.
Ah, to be tightly-wrapped in my sleeping bag after a long day of work... I could stay forever inside that furry cocoon.
My brother will be turning eleven soon! I hope the shark's tooth gets there in time...
I had dreamt of sledding, climbing and mountaineering. But we won't get much of that, will we?
Maybe one day a little girl will read about me and be inspired to follow in my snowy footsteps…
I may have forgotten what it's like to feel my nose.
Is it… Is it colder inside than out?!
I'm trying to keep moving, but I can't shake the cold.
I thought Victory Ashen's descriptions of the arctic cold were literary exaggerations...!
I never imagined I could be colder than that February night we camped in the Lakes…
It would be so helpful!
Could I beg a second of your time…?
I may need some help…
I have to admit, I can't do this on my own…
It would make life up here much easier…
It's not something I can do alone…
Can you help me…?
Could I have some guidance…?
It would take a terrible weight off my shoulders...
Can I rely on you?
You will? Thank you!
If there's anything I can do to help...
That you're willing to try means a lot to me.
Yes? Ah! I'm so glad.
You can do anything you set out to!
When you have a moment...
Do you think you'll have time to spare soon…?
We don't have much time…
So regarding that...?
Have there been setbacks?
Oh…
I'd been depending on that…

I see…

Oh, you're back!
Y-yes?
There you are!

Good news?
Looks like you have something to report!

You've renewed my spirit!
I feel I can keep pushing on now.
I will remember your support!
This will keep me strong.
It's nice to know I'm not alone out here.
This is their last known location…
The tracks begin here…
I see…

The tracks led here…
Hmmm...
Ready when you are.
Just say the word.
Everything is prepared.
Has it been confirmed?
All set?
I would like you to have this.
I have something for you.
Put it to good use.
I thought you might appreciate it.

We'll all die here, won't we?
I want to go home, please let me go home.
We are all doomed…
Brrrrrrrrrrr.

The cold will kill us all…
I won't be able to keep this up much longer…
It's so cold. It's just so cold...

Never mind my feelings, there's so much to do.

I can't believe I'm really here.

Coming here was a dream, I can have no complaints.
Warmth in the camp at least.
I'm warm enough.
I'm glad of the heaters, ugly though they be.
I warm by the stove after a long day.
At least there's a faint heat.
I won't surrender while there's shelter.
It's warmer inside.
Smother it with snow!
Now it's too warm!

The supplies! Don't let it get to them!
Put it out, put it out!
I pray we don't pass this to the Inuit...!

I'm... so cold... and... so hot...

I'm already wearing six thick layers...

Was I not ready…?
We can't just cut across the snow…!
Have you tried walking on ice?
We are isolated!
But we don't have a road.
The dogs can't even find the way!
You might want to look away for a moment…
Watch your step! You wouldn't be the first to slip there…

… Is there something wrong with the way I'm doing things?
I lost all sensation in my hands long ago! Haha…

After the process, it is soft and warm.
I dearly want to pat the seals on the head and throw them treats.
Ahh, I could be hiking to the north pole right now...

Fetch the rangers!
It's all melting...!
I hope we don't have to quarantine...
Today is worse than usual.
This work needs a steadier hand...
I'm snottier than a seal...
I ought to keep working.

Oh, thank god!!
Good. I'll...wipe this off my hands then.
Respite?
Y-yes, of course!
At once!
Back to work…!

We're trying to stay close, keep each other warm...
It's Arctic…!
I haven't seen any on my walks...
This isn't the right habitat for them...
Are you sure they're from around here...?
They don't have enough space in which to roam.
I would love to let them run wild...
We can't just breed them indoors...!
Not enough people signed up.
Not enough people volunteered…
I hope the extremes haven't put them off…
We don't have all we need.
We are still waiting for materials…
We've run low on some of the constituents.
There's no warehouse nearby.
We'll have to take it to a warehouse at some stage...
We can't store it here forever.
I think we have enough of that for a while...
We'll have to stop until we have more space.
We're buried under.
There's been an avalanche in the storeroom!
If I'm sending mother and father a photograph, I want them to see me smiling.
I will relish every memory of the Arctic I can.
My family will be celebrating little brother's birthday. If only I had a tiny window to feel I'm there with them...
There is so much the Inuit can teach us.
People are ignorant about Inuit life.
I do miss it— though honestly, I'd be fine without...
I've thought of something — something that'll make things a lot easier for all of us!
Father wanted a sketch of this animal, but I haven't spotted one yet. Do let me know, if you see one!
My friend Arno and his research group haven't returned and it's getting late...
The researchers should be here... Where could they have gone?
Signs of a bear attack! Oh, no, Arno...!
They must be nearby! They have to be...!
Arno is safe! They all are! Thank you, you saved them from Nanuk.
Father told me the great auk are gravely endangered. Soon, none will be left...
An exploration party is gathering to reach the north pole by sled. I told them you might be able to help...
Remember that party of explorers who set out for the North Pole? We've had no news from them in a while...
This is good ice, solid ice. Perfect for building an igloo.
The mythical land of Hyperborea...?
Oh, no! Have we come too late?
It's a miracle they survived. Maybe they should have asked you to drop them a little further north...
Was that...? No, couldn't have been...
Many previous expeditions became lost in the ice. Most were forced to leave valuable resources behind— we could look for them?
The great Sir William Perry had to abandon his ship too— HMS Angry Wrath. It must still be out here somewhere...
I grew up reenacting his expeditions in the garden, I can still recite the coordinates of the Angry Wrath by heart!
The HMS Angry Wrath! Such history. Oh yes, of course, the scrap will be useful too! Why not take it to Old Nate?
Brigade, ready the charges!
Charges set. Everyone back.
The expedition must have been really stubborn to venture up there.
Useful, yes, undoubtedly.
Going well, actually.
I find such details just fascinating.
Good stuff.
Commendable.
Intriguing.
Organised.
Most praiseworthy.
Warms the extremities.
Mmm... Yes.
The sacrifices I made to be here...
Assumption upon assumption.

I blame it on those young twits.
Amateurish!
Childish!
Crude and facile!
Ineptitude is everywhere.
It all smacks of desperation really.
Supervisor Spoondrift's mess, no doubt.
Your reasoning is sound.
Very wise, I should think.
Glad you had the foresight…
Engineered with precision!
You're cool under pressure!
Doesn't this worry you at all?
What's the point of all this?
Why are we even here, in fact?
Do you drag this on forever?
No use blaming someone else.
Yes, thank you.
I'm glad.
And I'm grateful.
Acceptable.
A good start.
Yes, all fine.
Heartfelt thanks.
Very encouraging, thank you.
Certainly takes the edge off.
As welcome as a tot of the good stuff.
Yes.
Obviously.
Hydrogen, if handled correctly, poses no risk to airships whatsover.
I'm a first-class scientist who happens to be eminently practical.
These young explorers can really be quite, quite, naïve.
You see some people want to go flying into every situation, before they've understood it doesn't work like that.
It's fortunate I'm able to bring much-needed experience and composure to an otherwise amateurish operation.
Most don't know the first thing about the science behind zeppelineering: that's why I'm here.
The evidence against O.D.H.Dickinson's arguments in the field of zeppelineering grow by the day.
I do find if I affect a plummy voice, people think I know what I'm talking about.
Those young explorers take everything personally, I just think it's pathetic.
…and that's the funny thing, so few of the finds out here should surprise you if you've done your research…
They're like whirling dervishes in a tea room, pulling knobs and levers whose functions they scarcely understand.
The remarkable rock strata were only accessible from the polynya. Once we had disembarked, I improvised a foundation in geology for the stupids.
I'm no zany inventor, dear me, no—no need for imagination whatsoever, it's exact, often tedious work.
Sir John Faithful's expedition was to catalog the Arctic in every detail; I'd have enjoyed that sort of freedom myself...
This Spoondrift character has no scientific credentials whatsoever, and yet he has been put in charge.
What can I say, I'm a balloonatic.
Bring in top mechanics, leave them out in the cold…
How can one operate machinery, when one has a case of the dithers?
Note please, the horripilation of my dextral epiderm!
I could describe in microscopic detail what is happening to my poor body, but I doubt you'd understand.
A hard rime has formed upon my brow.
Perhaps if my body were frozen, some future scientist could reanimate me, and I would be breakfasting in the 25th century.
A mite of calculation required.
A problem requiring meticulous dissection.
Don't deal with it like Spoondrift would.
Needs taking apart, and putting back together again.
Have a look at this…
I do have one or two concerns…
It is proving a bit of a puzzle…
What's your conjecture?
In this, you may have more experience than I, possibly…
The salient issue of the moment, I'd say…
Passion for the subject is essential.
Don't drift off course.
It's not especially urgent.
Up, up, and away.
Fair winds.
I won't presume 'til I hear further news.
Don't let this miserable place put you off.
Going about it with due rigour, I hope?
Don't let it drag on forever.
The sun may not go down, but time still passes.
It's like dealing with undergraduates.
Went down like a lead balloon.
Just needed the bare minimum of application.
Deferred it is.
Do make up your mind.
I see you've abandoned the idea.
Greater priorities, perhaps.
Rather an extreme reaction isn't it?
Got something?

Progress?
Results?
A discovery?
A solution?
New finds?
What?
A well-argued conclusion.

A rigorous examination of the topic.
Top marks.
Painstaking.
Hmm, curious.
Now we're getting somewhere.
Now there's something substantial.

Some rather gruesome remains.
Onwards?
Ready?
All set?
Confident?
Are we go?
Always willing to share the plaudits.

You're quite welcome.
Prego.

Notice a certain frostiness?
Don't you wind chill me!

We're absoutely nithering.

Out of ten? Absolute Zero.

More or less hypothermic.
We're cold.

I'm feeling a little icy.

Mumbles inaudibly.
Not to be a hyperbore, but it's flipping cold!

I'm ill.

Poorly, very poorly.

Get me on the first boat home.

There's no road(!)

Roadless and fading fast.
Roads!

For demonstrations, we really should have advanced notice.
Don't touch any knobs or levers.

I insist you don a hard hat.

No-one comes close to me in my area.

Alarm! Alarm!

Achoo! Eugh…

I want my picture taken so that I receive due credit for this earth-shattering discovery.
I'm no mere hobby mountaineer, I want a proper photograph of me conquering the summit.
We should dissect and scrutinise every furry beastie we can snare.
If I tried to explain the formation of glacial serac, you probably wouldn't have the foggiest notion…
We need less brain freeze, mentioning no Explorer in particular, have you anyone with an actual specialism?
We've found something utterly fascinating, and we want you to construct a field station for us to investigate it.
We've not heard a peep from the field station in ages, I do hope nothing is amiss.
Oh dear they're all dead, but the journal is scintillating reading…
One survived! They seem to be mute however— must have had a fright.
How and why has this creature materialised? Utterly bizarre.
Signs of a struggle, but no gore. Explanation defies me.
I'm on the trail of the woolly mammoth.
Bones more and more numerous leading towards something.
Some sort of mammoth graveyard.
Our woolly mammoth more or less demands to be reconstituted, stuffed and exhibited!
Gadzooks, a major discovery! An early hominid— we must recover the little character for examination!
Now that you have a solid outpost there, you wouldn't mind supplying my polar expeditions, would you?
You would be doing a great service to the crown, one that will be dutifully repaid.
Your item has been sold!
No-one bought your item.
Your online contraband has been confiscated and destroyed!
Old Nate is coming back!
Old Nate is leaving!
Imperial event started!
New event stage reached!
New rewards are here!
There is a new event quest.
An event stage is nearly over!
The Imperial Event is about to end.
Ready.
Props a-spinning.
Hovering.
Altitude stable.
Airship.
Awaiting course.
By the seat of our pants, Admiral.
Our balloon has a leak!
Superstructure compromised!
Flight path plotted.
Manouvering.
Dirigibling.
Heading set.
On course.
Fire!
Strafe them!
Open fire!
Commence bombardment!
To the parachutes!
Her nose is diving!
Ready for her maiden voyage.
Airship on patrol.
Conducting escort.
En route to drop.
Readying cargo ropes.
Preparing the hold.
Airship embarking on expedition!
Flying to a new region.
Entangle the gondolas!
Pirates of the sky!
The refit is complete.
Phew. Safe again.
Ooo, smells a tad like goose fat.
I befriended a naughty little snowfox.
...majestic antlers sticking from its head.
...a sharp piece of iron they all agreed useful…
…the aurora, a livid green on the night.
…and breath like a walrus besides…
…three-hundred years, still no northwest passage.
Yes! Frozen fish as runners for the sleds.
...the kayak was especially hardy, rough to the touch.
...rows of caribou-skin drums all beat in time.
I don't know why the Inuit tolerate us.
Ah see the picktarnies are circling.
oh, I managed a little bartering with the locals…
I had no idea there were Wagtails so far north.
and I posit that the Romans were in contact with the Thule…
The mines do rather spoil it all.
What would happen if all the ice melted?
Did you hear a growl?
The husky tried to bite me!
It's so frightfully exposed up here.
…fatally ignoring the seal hole.
At last I caught a duck with my bola.
Something to warm the cockles?
…it was warmer down on the sedge-strewn tundra.
Cecil, look at the thermometer!
...we dived under a local Quinzhee 'til the blizzard passed.
I sometimes feel we may be encroaching here.
It's not even winter yet.
Far harsher up here.
1,2,3,4….yes, I still have ten toes.

You and your old pal Aarhant were living it easy, but a fateful letter from your sister Hannah means a sudden return to the old world. Since you are too poor to afford your passage, you must earn it by fishing.

Fetch [AssetData(102487) Text] from:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition ItemPlace]) Text]

Use [AssetData(102487) Text] on:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]

Collect:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Aarhant can't believe you want to pay the passage home by dynamite fishing.
Aarhant says the dynamite you need is in the derelict lighthouse.
Aarhant hands you the dynamite nervously.
Aarhant thinks you have enough fish to pay for a ticket home.
Aarhant points you to the shack in the harbour for your ticket.
Aarhant is unimpressed with your aim.
Aarhant is impressed with your aim.
Aarhant reminds you to catch some fish so you can buy your passage back home.
Select the dynamite from your ship, and try to hit the fish shoal floating nearby. To get a direct hit, you'll need to anticipate the shoal's speed and direction.
Once you have the fish on your ship, move your ship close to the coastal harbour to exchange them for a travel ticket to the Old World.
Your friend Aarhant is thinking about the past and the present.
Aarhant wonders what else you may have hidden about your past.
It's hard to read because of all the tear stains.
The grumpy ticket agent agrees to take your fish.
The man gives you the ticket you need to return home in exchange.
The grumpy ticket agent wishes you'd hurry up and leave.
Bring [Conditions QuestCondition Amount(ObjectiveIndex)] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition DeliveryObject(ObjectiveIndex)]) Text] to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition ExecutionObject]) Text]
The grumpy ticket agent jumps in his seat at the loud explosion.
The grumpy ticket agent wonders what you're going to try and sell him this time.
Sell more of your sensational schooners:
It may seem odd, but our next step is to sell this ship - it will show we mean to run an enterprise just as influential as father's.
Sail schooner to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text], select it and sell it

In the wake of your father's alleged treason and death, your uncle Edvard seized control of Goode and Sons, leaving you and your sister Hannah to fend for yourselves. Hannah put everything she had into purchasing a small island, but it's in a bad state. Ruins from the tin rush litter the place, and before you can start afresh, you'll need to demolish them.

Clear:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Hannah encourages you to get to work on your new island.
Hannah asks you to clear the first ruin, in order to discover the island's potential.
Hannah is pleased with your work and encourages you to continue.
Hannah reminds you there is forestry work to be done on your island.
Hannah mentions there are small ruins on the island which you can get timber from.
Clear any small ruin for Timber
Remove the old ruins to clear the area for the new buildings.
You can also remove smaller ruins to get additional timber.

Hannah noticed that you're running low on timber, but she knows a quick way to stock up on it. It just so happens that there are still several ruins scattered around Ditchwater that you could demolish for materials.

The island Hannah bought for the both of you. Ditchwater is still a diamond in the rough; the ruins of a tin rush town must be demolished and cleared before the potential Hannah saw in this place can be realised.
Hannah prompts you to keep on cleaning the island.
Remove the old market ruins to have more space for your village to grow.
You can also remove smaller ruins to get additional timber.
Ditchwater has almost become what Hannah once dreamed it could be for the pair of you. Only a few more ruins now stand in the way of building a shipping company worthy of your father's legacy.
Hannah advises you to demolish the next set of ruins, which are blocking your expansion.
Remove the ruined church to have more space for your village to grow.
Edvard is baffled that you would remain beyond the funeral proceedings.
Hannah feels this island has potential.

In the wake of your father's alleged treason and death, your uncle Edvard seized control of Goode and Sons, leaving you and your sister Hannah to fend for yourselves. You have your own company now, but there's plenty to do before you can think of building ships and a shipyard. First, you'll need to build a small settlement to house the loyal people who followed you and Hannah to Ditchwater.
Hannah asks that as a first step, you provide housing for your loyal followers.
Hannah emphasises the importance of having more people to clear the island.
Hannah reminds you to provide housing for your followers.
Hannah is glad you are managing to produce timber already.
To attract farmers you need to build farmer residences.
You farmers need to live close to a marketplace. Build one near their residences.

Uncle Edvard seized control of Goode and Sons and left you and your sister Hannah fending for yourselves. But you have your own company now, keeping your father's dreams alive. Still, there is plenty to do, before you can think of ships and a shipyard. Producing timber, for example.
Hannah wants you to start producing timber.
Hannah reminds you to start producing timber.

Now that Uncle Edvard has seized control of Goode and Sons, you have to start your own company from scratch. Still, there's plenty to do before you can think of building ships and a shipyard. Clearing the ruins on Ditchwater took a lot of effort, and your people are hungry! The town needs a stable supply of food!
Hannah urges you to supply food to your farmers, who are tired from the demolition.
Hannah urges you to feed your farmers.
Aside from building residences for them, you need to provide for your residents' needs in order to attract more citizens.
Build a fishery close to your Trading Post to provide fish to your farmers.
You're keeping your father’s dream alive, as he always hoped you would. Still, there's plenty to do before you can think of building ships and a shipyard. Housing your people, for example.
Hannah asks that you support the influx of settlers with housing and amenities.
Hannah reminds you to give your people the houses and amenities they need.
Hannah congratulates you on building a settlement that may soon attract workers.

One of your cousins writes from Bright Sands, the island now owned by your Uncle. He speaks of a climate of instability surrounding Edvard's administration. Find him in the vicinity of the Great Exhibition foundations, and he may be able to help you gather some followers among the rioters.
Find your Cousin leading a mob in the vicinity of Edvard's Great Exhibition construction site
Your cousin informs you that workers are rioting in Bright Sands.
Hannah says people in Bright Sands are unhappy with Edvard, and urges you to seek out your cousin.
Hannah urges you to contact your cousin about the worker riots in Bright Sands.
Go to Edvard's harbour south-west of your island. You can also click on the quest in quest tracker to move the camera to Edvard’s harbour.
Find Edvard's church in the harbour district. It has a high bell tower. Your sister also remembers that your cousin's house has a purple roof and a campfire in the backyard.

Having saved the unhappy workers from your Uncle Edvard’s regime, your town must grow to accommodate them. With suitable housing, more workers will soon flood into your settlement, giving you the manpower to build your first shipyard.

Upgrade to:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Hannah asks that you upgrade your houses to accommodate workers.
Hannah reminds you to upgrade your houses for workers.
Fulfill all the basic needs of a farmers' residence to reach the maximum number of inhabitants.
Fully populated residences can be upgraded to the next level by using the upgrade button.

You finally have the workers on your side, but you'll need many more of them before a shipyard can be built! Your city needs to grow if you want your company to become an attractive choice for workers.
Hannah says you must have more workers before you can build a shipyard.
Hannah reminds you to expand your city and workers.
Hannah is pleased that you have enough people to build a shipyard.
Get more Workers by upgrading more residences or by fulfilling more needs.

You've cleared most of the island, but a few stubborn ruins remain. Luckily, you now have workers living in your city. They're skilled enough to take care of them for you, and aid in the final phases of making Ditchwater the perfect place to grow your new company.
Hannah advises you to remove the more robust ruins on the island.
Clear Worker Ruins

With your Uncle's debt finally behind you, you are now free to start your shipping company. Your first shipyard and ships will take you and your sister to the bright future that your father would have wanted for you.
Hannah is excited to see your first shipyard built.
Hannah is desperate to see the shipyard you have worked so hard for.
There is a whiff of salt on the breeze. With your first shipyard and ships, it will surely be a matter of time before you eclipse your ghastly Uncle.
Hannah is keen to see sails manufactured.
Hannah thinks you should make sails a priority.
Hannah discourages you from opening your Uncle’s private letter.
Hannah is shocked by Uncle Edvard’s letter and suggests you take it to Sir Archibald.

Hannah has recognised Edvard's prisoners as your father's most trusted associates, and the documents make it clear they may have been wrongfully accused! Your sister believes a higher authority like Sir Archibald Blake ought to intervene in the matter.
Hannah urges you go to Sir Archibald and show him Edvard’s devious letter.

OR:
Bring Edvard's Political Prisoners to Sir Archibald Blake
If you decide to take the political prisoners to Archibald Blake, move your ship close to his lighthouse.
Workers will migrate into a city, not into a village. You need to expand your small town.
Hannah asks you to build housing for migrants.
Hannah reminds you that new farmers need proper housing.

Since your Uncle Edvard doesn’t trust your father’s former newspaper editor, perhaps it is an opportunity for you to employ his services instead. Rumour has it he is a loyal fellow, even a little too loyal...
Aarhant wonders if your father’s former newspaper editor would be willing to work with you.
Aarhant reminds you to find the Editor in your Harbour.

Aarhant reminds you that people need a place to drink, rest and celebrate to recover from all their hard work after clearing Ditchwater's ruins. A bit of schnapps and a local pub should keep their spirits up.
Aarhant thinks Schnapps can motivate your people to keep going.
Aarhant reminds you to schnapp to it.

Provide your farmers with schnapps to keep them happy! In order to produce schnapps, build a potato farm and a schnapps distillery close to each other, then connect them to a nearby trading post or warehouse with a road. Finally, build a pub close to your farmers' residences, and put a smile on your farmers' faces!
You can also build more schnapps facilities to satisfy your farmers' needs faster.
Aarhant alerts you to an emergency lifeboat in your harbour. The survivors aboard are dressed in prison uniform, and no doubt have some tale to tell.
Aarhant alerts you to the arrival of an emergency lifeboat in your harbour.
Aarhant is sure the lifeboat survivors in your harbour are of interest.

Talk to:
Survivors on [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Object]) Text]

You rescued your Uncle's prisoners as they were being transported to Eli Bleakworth's prison, but they claim that Edvard has forged the charges against them. Aarhant has found some sealed documents amidst the wreckage that may prove this, if you dare open them...
Aarhant dares you to open your Uncle’s sealed letter.
Aarhant encourages you to oppose your uncle Edvard.

OR:
Open Sealed Document on your ship
If you decide to open the letter, you'll find it in your ship.
Eli wants Alwin, a former prisoner, found, so his investigation into your father's death can proceed.
Eli Bleakworth invites you to investigate the circumstances of your father's death.
Alwin admits it was he who killed your father, and made it look like something else.
Eli is concerned the security of his prison is compromised, and will speak to you later.
You delivered a letter to Eli Bleakworth, prison governor. There’s some funny business going on between he and Edvard, of which you now are a part.
The prison governor asks you to transport convicts to your Uncle’s island.
Eli reminds you the delivery to Edvard is urgent.
Eli Bleakworth asks if you're ready to hand over the prisoners.
Although he now controls your father’s assets, Uncle Edvard is insisting you pay for your father’s funeral. Hannah is rightly furious, but hopes a supply of Schnapps will make him go away.
Edvard reminds you of the debt you owe him for your father’s funeral costs.
Edvard forces you to repay him.
Edvard is impatient for the funeral payment.
Edvard is satisfied with your debt repayment, for now.

Have in storage:
[Conditions QuestCondition Amount(ObjectiveIndex)] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition DeliveryObject(ObjectiveIndex)]) Text]
Uncle Edvard's ship is waiting in your harbour to pick up 4 tons of schnapps. You need to have at least 4 tons of schnapps in your island's storage to be able to repay Uncle Edvard's debt.

It might help you repay your debt faster if you stop delivering schnapps to your farmers. You can pause the consumption of schnapps in any farmers' residence building, but do note, they won’t like it.
Edvard asks if you are ready to hand over the schnapps.
Although he now controls your father's assets, Uncle Edvard is insisting you pay for your father's funeral. He is still not nearly satisfied and demands you deliver the next payment in work clothes.
Edvard asks you to deliver Work Clothes as your second debt repayment.
Edvard is impatient for the delivery of Work Clothes.
Edvard is satisfied with your debt repayment, for now.
Uncle Edvard's ship is waiting in your harbour to pick up 4 tons of clothing. You need to have at least 4 tons of clothing in your island's storage to be able to repay Uncle Edvard's debt.
You could also repay your debt faster if you stopped delivering clothes to your farmers. You can pause the consumption of clothes in any farmers' residence building. However, they won’t like it.
Edvard asks if you are ready to hand over the clothes.

Although he now controls your father’s assets, Uncle Edvard is insisting you pay for your father’s funeral. Sir Archibald Blake has informed you that your Uncle has registered this debt officially with the Queen, preventing you from acquiring a shipping license until it's settled. To make things worse, he is asking you pay him in sails, of all things.
Edvard wants a third funeral repayment, this time in sails.
Edvard sizzles with rage over the lateness of your third repayment.
Edvard seems intent on making you his dogsbody.
Uncle Edvard's ship is waiting in your harbour to pick up 4 tons of sails.
Edvard asks if you are ready to hand over the sails.
Edvard demands that you pick up the cargo from his shipwreck.
Edvard's ship has crashed near your shores, and he demands you salvage the wreckage as your next errand in settling your debt to him.

Use a ship to rescue:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] from the prison transport wreck

Use a ship to rescue:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] from the prison transport wreck
The castaways were headed from Bright Sands to Wormways Prison Island. Search the sea to find them.
You can click on the quest in the quest tracker to move the camera to the location of the castaways.
Edvard offers to clear the debt if you deliver the men to prison.

You rescue your Uncle's prisoners from the shipwreck as they were being transported to Eli Bleakworth's prison. They claim to be entirely innocent, but your Uncle has promised to lift your debt if you deliver them to Eli...
Edvard is irritated you haven’t delivered his prisoners yet.

EITHER:
Bring Edvard's Political Prisoners to Eli Bleakworth
If you decide to do what Uncle Edvard told you, instead of opening his private letter, you should take the political prisoners to the prison. Uncle Edvard promised to clear your debt afterwards.
Wormways Prison, on Eli Bleakworth's prison island, is close to the island of Archibald Blake, representative to the Queen.

Sir Archibald Blake has informed you that your Uncle Edvard has officially registered your funeral debt, thereby preventing you from acquiring a shipping license until it's been settled. It is unclear how or when will this be though, since your Uncle seems most reluctant to let you escape his service.
Sir Archibald reminds you that your outstanding debt prevents you from obtaining a shipyard license.
Wait for Edvard to contact you about the debt to get your Shipping License
Sir Archibald Blake is curious to know what brings you here.
Your cousin says Edvard’s workers are willing to jump ship for you.
The people of Bright Sands are not at all happy with your Uncle's oppressive conditions, and are willing to serve a fairer employer. Find the rioters and convince them to join your company.

Find:
Rioting mobs [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] in Edvard's City
Your cousin is wondering how to leave Edvard's island.
The distant camera view (mouse wheel) may provide a better overview.
Mobs have been observed around the foundations of the "World's Fair".
A castaway approaches you.
The Editor would like to use a photo of your shipyard for the newspaper.
The Editor is impressed about the great composition of the photo.

Finally, your first shipyard! Better yet, it's the perfect story for the first issue of your city's newspaper! The editor asks that you take a great picture of the new shipyard - one that every man and woman in Ditchwater will see.
To take a picture of your sailing shipyard, start photo mode by clicking on the photo button in the quest tracker.
The shipyard has to be within the photography frame. You can use the keyboard arrows to adjust your camera's position.

Edvard's newspaper editor has had enough of having to jeopardise his work in favor of your Uncle's twisted propaganda. He is happy to lend you a ship to take your new followers home, provided you employ him as well.
The newspaper editor wants to leave Edvard as well, offering his ship for the passage.
Select the Editor's ship at Edvard's Harbour
Wait until the Editor arrives at your harbour
Select the Editor and his crew at Edvard's Harbour
It looks like there is someone in front of Edvard’s trading post who desperately wants to get your attention .
Official licence legally enabling you to trade with other parties.
Your father's former associates, who claim to have been wrongfully accused.
An order assigned to Prison Governor Bleakworth to handout a 'delivery'.
Knows how to handle dynamite.
A group of men stranded at sea.
It bears Uncle Edvard's seal. Should you open this private correspondence?
Uncle Edvard wants to send some political prisoners to Prison Governor Eli Bleakworth.
Flotsam found near Edvard's wrecked prisoner transport ship.
This ticket will get you home.
Edvard thinks you are trying to undermine his business, and is embarrassed for you.
Edvard informs you that as Samuel’s heir, you must pay for his funeral.
Hannah is angry that Goode and Sons has not offered to foot the funeral bill.
Hannah wants to show you the news from Bright Sands.
Hannah is shocked at Edvard's news and impact on your reputation.
The editor congratulates you on the publication of your newspaper's first edition.
The Editor starts to work on your newspaper.
The Editor continues the work on your newspaper.
Hannah is outraged at your Uncle's abusive demands.
Hannah is shocked that Edvard is asking for so much to pay for the funeral.
Hannah doesn’t think Uncle Edvard will ever write off your debt.
Mr. Sterling thanks you but seeks further guarantees of protection.
Mr. Sterling accuses Edvard of falsely condemning innocents to prison.
Aarhant has discovered a sealed document from Uncle Edvard.
Hannah is delighted you now have clearance to build a shipyard.
Eli Bleakworth thanks you for delivering Edvard’s prisoners.
Edvard condescends to relieve you of your debt.
Sir Archibald duly awards you your long-awaited shipping licence.

Dear Governor Bleakworth,

More of the traitor Samuel’s conspirators. Crimes and sentences as follows;

Ernest Sterling – Use of foul language – 16 years with hard labour.
Verity Goodheart – Impersonation – Transportation to the Antipodes.
Elias Noble – Writing a threatening letter – Life imprisonment
Honora Decent – Character assassination – Life imprisonment
The judge saw very well my view, that any lack of proof they conspired with a traitor was, in itself, evidence they hide something. All things considered, his verdict could have been far worse. While I am under no obligation to explain such details, I thought that as a fellow dispenser of justice, the facts of the case may be of interest to you.

Sincerely
Edvard Goode
(Edvard) Goode and Sons Ltd.
Hannah recognises the prisoners to be your father’s most trusted associates.
Aarhant thinks it obvious Uncle Edvard is trying to get rid of his critics.
The Decision
Do you really want to open the sealed document?

Dear Governor Bleakworth,

More of the traitor Samuel’s conspirators. Crimes and sentences as follows;

Ernest Sterling
Use of foul language – 16 years with hard labour

Verity Goodheart
Impersonation – Transportation to the Antipodes

Elias Noble
Writing a threatening letter – Life imprisonment

Honora Decent
Character assassination – Life imprisonment

The judge saw very well my view that any lack of proof that they conspired with a traitor was, in itself, evidence that they're hiding something. All things considered, his verdict could have been far worse. While I am under no obligation to explain such details, I thought that as a fellow dispenser of justice, the facts of the case may be of interest to you.

Sincerely,
Sir Archibald is disturbed to hear about Edvard's judicial practices and lifts your debt to him.
Sir Archibald writes off your debt and hands you your shipping licence.
Edvard is furious that you snitched on him and Sir Archibald has written off your debt.
Mr. Sterling thanks you for all you have done for him and the others.
I'm sure people would take more of our ships if they could. There can be little harm in trying!'

Industrialisation goes hand-in-hand with the production of steel, and the ships of Sir Archibald Blake have asked for new steel weapons. Hannah thinks the island she purchased has some iron deposits, although they may be hard to reach. Your first task is to find them.
Hannah asks you to find an iron mine so you can produce steel.
Hannah reminds you to find an iron mine to build the warships you need.
Hannah regrets that the iron mine lies out of reach, and wonders if there is a solution.
Contact the Prison Governor Eli Bleakworth
Iron deposits have been located to the north-west of Ditchwater.
Constructing a tunnel with the help of an expert is the only way for you to access iron mines.
Hannah wants you to bail out a demolitions expert from prison and bring him home.
Hannah reminds you about the importance of getting the demolitions expert.
Hannah wants you to start the tunnel construction soon.
Hannah congratulates you on enabling the industrialisation of your settlement.
Pay the bail for the following specialist and bring him home:
Equip the demolitions expert at the headquarters to unlock an iron mine:

You have found a suitable weak spot in the mountain. But Hannah will not allow you to fool around with dynamite yourself. While you and the workers prepare the scaffolding on the mountain, your sister wants you to find your father's acquaintance specialized in demolitions. He is still living on Edvard’s island.
Hannah is furious at Aarhant and you for planning to set up the dynamite yourself.
Hannah insists that you find your father’s demolitions expert in Bright Sands.
Hannah reminds you the demolitions expert lives somewhere in Bright Sands.

Search for:
Demolition expert's explosives shop near Edvard's timber production
The demolition expert's shop is located in the bleak area near Edvard's timber production.
The roof of the shop is as red as the dynamite itself.
The prisoners all look the same, but the demolitions expert is the best educated.

Hannah encourages you to get things moving so the iron deposits can be reached. You should talk to the demolition expert and provide him with all the necessary details to get the job done. The demolitions expert didn't seem to take a liking to you and your sister. It makes Hannah wonder why, but she's glad he's at least willing to help us out.
Hannah wants you give the newly-arrived demolitions expert a warm welcome.
Hannah reminds you to brief the newly-arrived demolitions expert.
Talk to the demolitions expert, who's waiting at your harbour
The demolition expert, Thomas N. Ticker, questions the difference between working for you, or working for Eli Bleakworth.
Thomas N. Ticker disapproves of you trying to build a second Bright Sands.

Your business partner, Sir Archibald Blake, has emphasised the importance of military ships to Her Majesty, advising that building merchant ships alone won't get you very far. You should begin steel production now, so that you'll be fully prepared to manufacture weapons in the near future.
Hannah wants you to start producing steel to forge weapons for Archibald's commission.
Hannah reminds you to start producing steel.
Establish steel production on your island.

Sir Archibald Blake has asked you to talk to Isabel Sarmento in the New World. To get there, Hannah believes you need a frigate — a ship better equipped to take on such a perilous expedition. Your people lack the knowledge required to build such a ship — but if you were to attract artisans to your city, you'd have one built in no time.
Hannah insists you build a frigate fit for the dangerous mission to the new world.
Hannah reminds you a frigate is needed for your mission to the new world.
Attract Artisans to your city:
Build a Frigate:

Hannah asserts the importance of producing ships for Sir Archibald Blake, now that you've regained access to the iron deposits and can start producing steel. Making the Queen’s advisor a satisfied customer could be crucial in establishing a successful shipping company.
Hannah reminds you to produce weapons for the military ships that were ordered.
Hannah is motivated to start constructing the military ships for Sir Archibald Blake.

Hannah is eager to look through father’s diary. Father was an astute man, and Hannah is convinced that by going over his notes, you'll be able to learn something regarding the false accusations, and figure out where to look next.
Hannah is certain your father’s diary will explain everything.
Hannah can hardly believe you would delay examining your father’s diary.
Open Father's Diary on your ship
Hannah is shocked and relieved to know that your father might have been manipulated.

By reading his diary, you learned that your father was being threatened by a cult, who were behind the mysterious symbol. Hannah believes this symbol could be key to unravelling the mystery, and proposes taking the diary to a longtime friend of your father, Madame Kahina. Her extensive travels and social connections may finally yield some answers.
Deliver Your Father's Diary to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition ExecutionObject]) Text]
Hannah wonders if your father's diary might contain any crucial information to help unravel the mystery.
Hannah reminds you to look into your father's diary.
The New World and all its mysteries await you.
Hannah advises you to start your journey to the New World.
Hannah reminds you to go to the New World.

Sir Archibald Blake explained that your father's island, Prosperity, was sold to a rebel leader in the New World named Isabel Sarmento. However, since the deal was signed, Isabel has been in hiding. If you want to et to the bottom of your father's case, you'll need to find her. Hannah is excited to be going on such an exciting expedition with you.
Hannah wants you to carefully plan the expedition to find Isabel Sarmento.
Hannah hopes Isabel will be worth the effort it took to find her.
Complete Expedition [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
To start the expedition, go to the World Map and select the New World Expedition.
You'll only get your demolitions expert for the tunnel once you've helped Eli investigate Edvard.
The Prison Governor wants you to investigate the living conditions on Edvard's island.
The Prison Governor reminds you about the investigation.
The prison governor is surprised by Edvard's behavior, and agrees to release your demolitions expert on bail.
Take pictures (select banners) of the current situation on Edvard's island:
Only a demolitions expert will enable you to complete the mountain excavation, and establish a safe connection to the iron mine.
Eli Bleakworth doesn’t mind you taking this prisoner off his hands.
Eli Bleakworth suggests you hurry and take your prisoner away.
Command the Prison Governor’s ship to your island
Wait until the Demolition Expert arrives at your harbour
Eli Bleakworth asks if you can pay the bail of $5,000.
Eli Bleakworth asks if you're ready to send a ship to collect the demolitions expert.
Aarhant suggests you could use the leftover dynamite to blow a hole in the mountain, thereby gaining access to those precious iron deposits. Look for a weak spot in the mountain.
Aarhant proposes blowing a way through to the iron deposit.
Aarhant reminds you the mountain must have a weak spot.
Aarhant thinks this abandoned mine entrance is a good starting point.
Aarhant compliments you on your progress.
Aarhant is looking forward to the explosion.

Select:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Object]) Text]
Complete the first phase of the excavation site
Finish the last phase with the help of a demolitions expert
The explosion impresses Aarhant.
Link the excavation site to a warehouse to supply it with resources.

By following the lead of Thomas Ticker, Aarhant found that your father’s murderer was hiding in a cave to the west. Aarhant wants you to attack the murderer’s ship and confront him, in an attempt to reveal the truth about what really happened to your father. Aarhant stresses that you can't let the murderer get away!
Aarhant urges you to attack the ship.
Aarhant presses you to act quickly if you are to avenge your father.
Sink the ship of your father's killer
Keep moving to avoid damage from the flame thrower.

Aarhant is frustrated to have seemingly hit a dead end, but urges you stay hopeful, and look through the pieces of wreckage for anything that might prove your father’s innocence. There has to be something...
Aarhant recommends searching the wreckage for clues.
Aarhant urges you to extract whatever you can from the wreckage.

Find:
Useful flotsam [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Aarhant didn't find anything useful in this barrel.

After Mr. Ticker learned of your honest and upright intentions, he was more than willing to share some important information with you. Your father was murdered. Mr. Ticker says the murderer fled the prison not long before you came to rescue him. The murderer is said to deal with smugglers, and is trading near Madame Kahina's harbour — that's your only lead.
Aarhant advises you to follow the smuggler's ship.
Aarhant urges you to extract whatever you can from the wreckage.
Sail to Madame Kahina's lighthouse.
Follow the smuggler ship undetected to your father's murderer.
Aarhant asks if you're ready to follow the smuggler's ship.
Maintaining the right distance is the key to success. Stay close, but not too close!
Items and cargo can affect your ship's speed.
Extending your customer network is the best way to increase your reputation and your opportunities.
Madame Kahina promises to trade with you if you provide her with ship repair materials.
Madame Kahina reminds you about the steel beam delivery.
Madame Kahina is happy about your delivery and predicts a long, fruitful partnership with you.
Deliver the following goods to Madame Kahina:
Hannah asks you to bring the diary to Madame Kahina to decipher the symbols.
Hannah reminds you to go and see Kahina.
Madame Kahina warns you the symbol belongs to a dangerous sect known as the Pyrphorians.
Madame Kahina asks what you want to show her.

Sir Archibald Blake saw the news of your first shipyard in the newspaper, and has asked for a bulk order of ships for the Queen. The Queen apparently needs a fleet with which to sail to the New World, where she intends to take back the island Prosperity, which your father allegedly sold.
Sir Archibald Blake read your newspaper and issues a bulk order of ships for the Queen.
He says supporting the Queen will greatly benefit your relationship.
Sir Archibald Blake thanks you kindly for delivering the ships.
Sell to Archibald Blake:
Schooner [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Gunboat [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Frigate [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]
Sir Archibald Blake confirms the exchange.
Sell a ship by sailing it to Archibald's harbour, then select the ship, and click the "Sell" button in the bottom right.

It turns out Hannah’s gut feeling was right. Madame Kahina was able to identify the symbol and link it to a dangerous New World organisation known as The Pyrphorians. Since the diary also states that your father did not unlawfully sell Prosperity island, Hannah wants you to take the diary to Sir Archibald Blake immediately. This might reverse the Queen's accusation of treason towards your father.
Hannah asks that you take the diary to Sir Archibald at once.
Hannah urges you to take the diary to Sir Archibald.
Deliver Father's Diary to Sir Archibald Blake
Sir Archibald Blake asks what you're bringing him.
Archibald Blake promised to recommend a specialist to you in return for the schooner ship you traded with him. He's waiting for you at your harbour.
Sir Archibald Blake has placed a crate containing a gift on his harbour pier.
Sir Archibald is pleased with the exchange, but would have preferred a gunboat for the Queen's fleet.
Pick up the crate at Sir Archibald Blake's harbour.
You decided to help the escapist escape, while not knowing exactly what scares him.
Aarhant wants you to escort the ship of the escapist.
Aarhant prefers to remain vigilant until the escapist's ship reaches its objective.
The escapist thanks you for saving him from his assailants and gifts you your father's diary.
Confront Archibald.
Only a demolitions expert will enable you to complete the mountain excavation, and establish a connection to the iron mine.
Eli Bleakworth doesn't think you'll find anyone of worth here, but he won't try to stop you.
The Expert’s wife reminds you to look for her husband in the prison.
Search for the Demolitions Expert in the stone pit at Prison Governor's island
Pay 5,000 coin bail at the Prison Governor's lighthouse
Hannah is excited to receive such a large order for ships.
The demolition expert wonders if you might be able to change things for the better.
The demolition expert, Thomas, wonders whether you can bring back Samuel's spirit.
Thomas admits you have your father's eyes.
Mr. Ticker is impressed by your efforts and achievements, which he says would honour your father.
Thomas is starting to see the good in you.
Hannah says your next goal should be to gain access to an iron mine.
Hannah wants you to find a specialist to help dig a tunnel to the iron mine.
Madame Kahina warns you the symbol belongs to a dangerous sect known as the Pyrphorians.
Madame Kahina didn't know your father was in contact with the Pyrphorians.
Madame Kahina urges you not to go to the New World, where the Pyrphorian sect run wild.
Sir Archibald reveals that the Pyrphorians are also a danger to the Queen.
He admits it is not clear how your father is involved in this matter.
Sir Archibald explains that your father sold the infamous island Prosperity to a rebel named Isabel Sarmento.
He states that Isabel is in hiding, and that you'll need to find her.
The demolition expert Thomas N. Ticker despises being traded around.
Mr. Ticker disapproves of your naive ambitions.
The hooded man threatens to kill you, just as he killed your father.
Aarhant is surprised the killer would admit his crime so easily.
Mr. Ticker opens up to you, admitting he kept your father's murder secret.
He explains that your father's killer is hiding somewhere.
Mr. Ticker hints at a smuggler bringing supplies to the murderer.
Hannah’s suspicions regarding the circumstances of your father’s death are confirmed.
Aarhant is frustrated that the killer died without giving you any answers.
The killer’s last words appear to be a warning.
Hannah realises your father's troubles all stem from the island sale.
Wormways Prison— A first terrible night!

My island, Prosperity, is sold. That is all I can puzzle of my arrest, and present circumstance, shackled between these cold grey walls. Tomorrow I resolve to make my case again to Mr. Bleakworth, who today so cruelly refused me a proper explanation. Now I must try to sleep, and can think of nothing but my poor Hannah, and the other, so far distant.
Wormways Prison – Light through the bars.

With daybreak comes clarity. Prosperity was sold to the infamous rebel 'Sarmento' – and I must be the last to have heard of it! The Queen, the nation, is up in arms, that the jewel of the new world is lost!

The guards, from whom I heard all, thought me playing some trick! Yet it is I who am tricked; duped of my island by persons unknown! Although it can only be the same persons that came to me one ominous day, masked and embroidered with eldrich symbols. They pressed me towards a sale. But I shut the door hard I tell you, and bid them good-day!
Wormways - A third night, and alas not the last.

I have today begun the process of gathering evidence in my defence. Hannah was here, though they did not let her stay long. She gives me hope that a full and unmitigated pardon is possible. Years of loyalty count in my favour, but the very idea that I may have betrayed my Queen weighs heavily upon me. Even if the dark clouds of scandal pass, they may forever have damaged our family’s prospects.
Thomas N. Ticker sees no purpose in trying to impress your father now he is dead.
Mr. Ticker admires your effort.

Isabel Sarmento claims it was your father, Samuel Goode, who sold Prosperity to her, and that she has the contract of sale to prove it. But since this document is her sole bargaining chip, she will relinquish it to you only if you come to the aid of her people. Admittedly, the situation for the rebels does seem rather desperate...
Isabel Sarmento asks that you secure her people's future if you want the Prosperity contract.
Fulfill Isabel Sarmento's demands to receive Prosperity's contract of sale.

Isabel Sarmento needs your help to shelter her people and hide them away from the Pyrphorian threat. To this end, she has transferred La Isla to you. She asks that you start by providing asylum for her refugees. Maybe then she will be able to trust you with the Prosperity contract.
Isabel agrees to help you once you help them.
Isabel asks that you prove yourself trustworthy.

Shelter:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] on La Isla

The Pyrphorians have Prosperity terrorized and overworked to the brim of exhaustion. Isabel Sarmento asks that you go there to find her debilitated refugees and smuggle them away to La Isla to recover.
Isabel asks that you tend to Prosperity's sickly refugees on La Isla.
Hannah is curious to see what Prosperity looks like.
A jornalero rejoices on leaving Prosperity Island, and the Pyrphorians' yoke.
A jornalero hopes they'll be safer on La Isla.

Collect:
1 group of Prosperity refugees from Prosperity Island

Deliver:
[Conditions QuestCondition Amount(ObjectiveIndex)] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition DeliveryObject(ObjectiveIndex)]) Text] from Prosperity Island to La Isla
Isabel Sarmento asks if the refugees can board your ship.
Isabel Sarmento asks if the sick refugees are ready to disembark on La Isla.
More and more people are suffering every day under the Pyrphorians' clenched fist. Your haven on La Isla must expand if you are to accommodate them all.
Isabel pleads for you to expand, and shelter more people on La Isla.
Isabel is grateful to you for aiding her people.

A sudden outbreak of fires is plaguing La Isla. It all seems a little too much of a coincidence, but before you try and find the cause, you should build a fire station to bring the blazes under control.
Hannah finds the outbreak of so many fires troubling, and asks you to build a fire station.
Put out all the fires on La Isla
Check the whole island, not just the city center, for fires, and build fire stations near burning buildings.
Your officers have uncovered the arsonists, and are ready to apprehend them at your command. Find them around the market and rid La Isla of its firestarters!
Isabel prompts you to capture the Pyrphorian spies with the help of the police.

Find:
[Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] Pyrphorians to stop the arson
Isabel is happy you got rid of the arsonists.
Zoom in to your city center and search people with torches.
The Pyrphorian arsonist taunts you as you arrest him.

Sarmento confirms that the conflagrations on La Isla are likely to be the Pyrphorians' doing. If you build a Police Station, the bobbies can keep their eyes peeled for any masked miscreants in the area.
Isabel encourages you to build a police station to arrest the Pyrphorian arsonists.

The Pyrphorians are a very real threat to La Isla now that they know you're sheltering Isabel's people there. After the wave of conflagrations and attacks on refugee transports, Sarmento is right to be wary that they may strike soon again. She asks that you bring two frigates to their shores to help keep the citizens safe.
Isabel fears her people might be in danger.
She asks you to build up your military defenses to protect them.
Have [Conditions QuestCondition Amount] Frigates in the The New World
Sarmento congratulates you and is looking forward to fighting alongside you.
There is no iron for weapons in the New World. Construct frigates in the Old World to deliver and trade weapons with Isabel in the New World.
You can transfer ships from the Old World to the New World by clicking the worldmap button in the top right of a ship's menu.
The sickly citizens of Prosperity cannot resist much longer. Too weak to continue working at the pace the Pyrphorians demand, they are doomed unless you can smuggle them away to La Isla to recover.
Isabel worries the sick on Prosperity will perish unless you can get them to La Isla.
A jornalero begs you to rescue them from slavery.
A jornalero is very grateful to you.

Collect:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] from Prosperity Island
A masked Pyrphorian commands you to return the people you took.

Pyrphorian assaults have the people of the New World completely terrorised. Isabel will not turn her back on anyone that requests asylum on La Isla, which is why she'd requested that you expand your settlement there, and build a hospital to prepare for any eventualities.
Isabel needs you to expand to shelter all the people running from the Pyrphorians.
Isabel wants to build a hospital to prepare for a potential outbreak.
An obrera thanks you for creating a safe haven for them.
The Pyrphorian threat hovers over the whole region, and Isabel's headquarters are not safe anymore. She begs for your help in evacuating her people to the safety of La Isla.
Sarmento asks for your help in evacuating her people to La Isla.
An obrera thanks you for saving them.
Escort at least 1 of Isabel's Schooners to La Isla
The Pyrphorians might have learned of Isabel's plans. Bring all of your ships to defend the trade convoy.
You can command your ships to escort Isabel's ship automatically by selecting your ship and right-clicking on Isabel's ships.
The Pyrphorians just can't seem to let go - instead, they keep attacking. As a result, Isabel strongly suggests you bring some more military ships to this region so you can defend yourself.
Isabel instructs you to bring even more ships to this region, as the Pyrphorian attacks are intensifying.
Trade [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData(100440) Text] with Isabel Sarmento.
While you're building more ships and delivering them to Isabel, she also wants you to expand the town even further.
Isabel tells you to keep on expanding La Isla for the obreros.

Isabel's comrades were taken hostage to coerce her into working for the Pyrphorians, but she's confident that you'll be able to rescue them from their humid cells on the western archipelago. Evading the Pyrphorian guards, however, will not be easy.
Isabel has received intelligence as to the whereabouts of her abducted comrades, and asks that you free them.
A hostage is deeply grateful for your actions.
The Pyrphorian hostages are ready to come aboard your ship.
Isabel trusts you after bringing her comrades back.
Rescue Pyrphorian hostages from [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition ExecutionObject]) Text]
Deliver [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition CurrentDeliveryObject]) Text] to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition ExecutionObject]) Text]
Deliver [Conditions QuestCondition Amount(ObjectiveIndex)] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition DeliveryObject(ObjectiveIndex)]) Text] to La Isla
Isabel expresses her gratitiude for bringing the missing people back home.
There are Pyrphorian patrol ships inside the island atoll. Don't get into their sight radius, or else they will attack you.

Isabel is under attack! The Pyrphorians have discovered that she's been working with you to save the people of Prosperity, and have sent a fleet to burn her island to the ground! You have to stop them!
Isabel needs your help to fend off the Pyrphorians.

Destroy:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] that attack Isabel
Isabel pleads for your help one last time.

Only Prosperity's contract of sale can prove that it was not your father, but an impostor who sold the island to Sarmento, and that she herself was coerced into make that deal by the Pyrphorians. You must chase the thieves and retrieve the contract to prevent the outbreak of war between the Queen and Isabel...
Isabel realises the Pyrphorians have stolen the Prosperity contract.
Complete Expedition [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
To start the expedition, go to the World Map and click the expedition named "The Contract".
Once the expedition has finished, wait for the ship to return, then select the expedition ship to collect the reward.
Isabel tells you bitterly how your father's actions have harmed the rebels' cause.
Isabel mentions that she somehow still trusted in your father, and believed he meant well.
Isabel suggests that the best way to start your investigation would be to find the contract of sale.
The magistrate tells you that the contract is still in his former house.
Isabel transfers you the magistrate's home island.
Isabel gives you the freedom to govern this island, to encourage the magistrate to come back.
The magistrate oversteps the mark by asking for a zoo.
Hannah waves off his inquiry.
The Queen transfers the island rights to you.
The magistrate officially revokes the island's sale.
La Corona thanks the Queen.
Hannah can't wait to confront your uncle upon your return home.
Isabel thanks you for saving her and her people.
Hannah wonders why Isabel has yet to hand you the Prosperity contract.
Sir Archibald Blake announces that the Queen's fleet is ready to reclaim Prosperity by force.
Hannah believes the Prosperity papers will prove that Isabel is not the Queen's enemy.
Isabel admires your audacity.
Hannah is proud of you for retrieving the contract in time.
Isabel fears the Pyrphorian ships approaching her island.
A Pyrphorian threatens Isabel for contravening their orders.
The Pyrphorian orders an attack on Isabel's island.
Hannah shares a letter she has received from a small boy.
The Pyrphorians threaten you and demand you leave the region at once.
Isabel warns that your presence here has not gone unnoticed.
Progeny of Samuel, you know not with whom you meddle.
Leave, if you value your life, else all shall burn.
The Pyrphorians will not let you meddle in their affairs.
An obrera cries for help.
Isabel alerts you to the danger on Prosperity and of settling other islands.
Isabel believes you have better odds at hiding them from the Pyrphorians.
Please, take us back to a safe place...
The final evidence that uncle Edvard is in fact the guilty one.
A flame-throwing weapon? Really?
Refugees from Prosperity
Hostages of the Pyrphorians, Isabel Sarmento's people
Written by hand
Edvard was the one behind the unlawful sale of the oil-rich Prosperity.
Hannah congratulates you on getting the final proof and wants you to deliver it to the council.
Hannah urges you to bring photographic proof to the council.
The Queen snatches away the photograph.
Bring to the Queen:
The Pyrphorians persist with their schemes. More fires are raging throughout the settlement, spreading fear and danger. You have to arrest the arsonists and stop this madness!
Hannah is frightened that more Pyrphorian arsonists have snuck onto your island.
Hannah is relieved that you apprehended the arsonists.

Having returned from the New World with conclusive evidence that it was your uncle's treason that sealed your father's fate, Hannah is eager to finally confront Edvard in Bright Sands and settle things once and for all.
She cannot wait to arrive at Bright Sands and confront him.

Deliver:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition DeliveryObject(ObjectiveIndex)]) Text] from your Trading Post to Edvard
Edvard asks what your business here is.
Sail a ship to your main island's trading post, and transfer the Prosperity contract to it.

Some people managed to escape the great fire of Bright Sands through the city's sewers! You must come to their rescue! But beware - Pyrphorian patrols have the place heavily guarded. If you're spotted, all of their lives will be at risk…
Hannah begs you to evacuate Bright Sands.
Slip past the Pyrphorian patrols to the Bright Sands Sewer Exit

Deliver:
[Conditions QuestCondition Amount(ObjectiveIndex)] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition DeliveryObject(ObjectiveIndex)]) Text] to your island
Theodora Ticker is thrilled you have come to their rescue.
Hannah is appalled that you could not help the people of Bright Sands.
Hannah asks if the Bright Sands refugees are ready to disembark.
Slip past the Pyrphorian patrols and deliver [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition CurrentDeliveryObject]) Text] to your island
Don't get into the patrols' line of sight, or they'll attack.
The smaller and faster the ship you use for this, the higher your chance of success. Try it with a gunboat.
It is over. The Pyrphorian army has been overcome, but at great expense. Before you can move on, the dead must be mourned. Meet Hannah at the church cemetery in Bright Sands for your Uncle's funeral.
Hannah would like you to be there for your Uncle's funeral.
Select the church with a cemetery in Bright Sands
The Pyrphorians have infiltrated your island, and are causing widespread chaos by setting your buildings alight! Hurry up and catch the arsonists before it's too late!
Hannah asks you to arrest the Pyrphorian arsonists on your island.
Hannah believes in you.
Hannah worries you let the arsonists escape.
Search for hooded figures with a torch in their hand. Zoom in to see them better.

Now that you've finally delivered Bright Sands from the Pyrphorian terror, Hannah hopes you can resurrect the city closest to her heart. It was your father's dream, your childhood home; it will take a lot of work, but you have the power to dream up your own vision of Bright Sands now!
Hannah has something ambitious in mind.
Hannah asks you to rebuild Bright Sands.
Hannah entrusts everything to you from now on.
Demolish the ruins in Bright Sands, or renovate the individual buildings you want to keep.
With the demolish tool selected, hold Shift and drag to demolish all the buildings.

Attract to Bright Sands:
[Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

Her Majesty has placed Edvard under house arrest in Bright Sands, where he awaits his trial for treason. The Queen has appointed you to host his trial on your island, for which you will need to erect a suitably imposing Court of Justice.
Sir Archibald Blake announces you are to build a Court of Justice to hold Edvard's trial.
The Queen admires your Court of Justice.
Finish the first phase of the Court of Justice
Finish the second phase of the Court of Justice
Finish the last phase of the Court of Justice
A Court of Justice that the Queen ordered to be built. The trial against Edvard Goode is due to be held here.
The Queen is impatient to see your Court of Justice.
Sir Archibald Blake reminds you to finish preparations before the Queen's arrival.
Place a warehouse close to the Court of Justice, and produce the required goods for it.

The Pyrphorians have taken over Bright Sands! They were the ones pulling the strings behind your Uncle Edvard's betrayal, and now they threaten to turn the Empire to ashes along with everything you hold dear. No matter how dreadful their army, you have no choice: they must be stopped!
Sir Archibald says protecting the Queen is of the utmost importance.

Destroy:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] at Bright Sands harbour
Take your time to build a large fleet. Equipping powerful items on your ships can make them much more formidable.
Target one enemy ship at a time with your whole fleet to minimize their numbers as quickly as possible.

Sir Archibald wants to support your fight against the Pyrphorians by sending you supplies from the Queen. His shipments will need to be escorted, however, in case they should run into Pyrphorian patrols.
Sir Archibald requests an escort so he can send you supplies.
Sir Archibald is relieved you received his supplies.
Sir Archibald fears you cannot afford to lose his next batch of supplies.

Protect:
Royal supply ship until it reaches The Queen's flagship
Don't underestimate the fervour of the Pyrphorian attackers. Bring strong military ships to flank the royal supply ship.
You will earn important supplies upon completing this quest, which will help you in your progress with the main quest.
Sir Archibald Blake asks if you're ready to receive the royal supplies and munitions.
Sir Archibald announces the launch of the next supply ship, and wants you to protect it.
Aarhant has the feeling a darker threat is looming over the horizon. He asks you to prepare for whatever may happen by improving your harbour defences.
Aarhant feels you must prepare for an eventual attack.
Edvard repents and warns you of a greater enemy.
Hannah is determined not to forgive Uncle Edvard.
The Queen acknowledges your efforts to protect the Empire.
The Queen seems rather ambivalent about the trial.
Aarhant is surprised at the Queen's... assertiveness.
After taking over Bright Sands, the Pyrphorians are coming for you! Prepare to fend off their attacks!
Aarhant alerts you to an incoming Pyrphorian attack.
Hannah asks you to put an end to the Pyrphorians.

Destroy:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] approaching your harbour

Now is the time to blunt the Pyrphorian blade! Aarhant prompts you to attack the Pyrphorian patrols that are roaming the seas, and decimate their numbers. Any cargo they carry might also prove useful if used against them…
Aarhant advises you to cripple the Pyrphorian forces by raiding their patrols.
Isabel encourages you to break the Pyrphorian supply lines.
Aarhant advises you not to lower your guard against the Pyrphorians.
Aarhant advises you remain wary of the Pyrphorian menace.
You will earn strong military items upon completing this quest. These items will help you with the main quest.

The Pyrphorian fleet is huge, and a great and final confrontation seems inevitable. Aarhant has long-since anticipated such a battle, and makes his recommendations on how to counter the Pyrphorian threat with a mighty fleet of your own.
Aarhant suggests which ships you should build for the great battle ahead.
Aarhant believes these ships capable of defeating the Pyrphorians.
Having two shipyards at work at the same time will increase your output of ships. The same goes for weapon factories.
You can also buy weapons at Isabel's island in The Old World.

Your island's defences are sufficient to guarantee the Queen's safety, and the Court of Justice is ready to hold the trial. Her Majesty and Sir Archibald Blake await your welcome at your harbour, before taking their place at the tribunal.
The Queen expects a royal welcome.
Welcome the Queen to your harbour
Preparations for the trial are complete, and it only remains for the defendant to be removed from house arrest and led to court in chains. Sail to Bright Sands and fetch the pitiable Uncle Edvard.
The Queen is ready to see Edvard for the Trial.

Pick up:
Court summons from The Queen's Flagship
Arrest Edvard with the court summons
The Queen wants to hand over the court summons for you to issue to Edvard.
Sail a ship with at least one cargo slot free to within range of the Queen's flagship.
Once your ship draws close to the Queen, accept the request she has for you.
Aarhant is hardly surprised to hear Edvard was behind this all along.
Hannah is furious about Edvard's treason.
Aarhant pities Edvard.
The Queen expects your Court of Justice will serve the Empire well.
Sir Archibald believes Isabel Sarmento will be an important witness at the trial.
Isabel Sarmento agrees to testify at Edvard's trial.
Isabel sympathises with you.
Sir Archibald announces the Queen's arrival.
The Queen waves off Archibald's overly formal introduction.
The Queen is keen to start the trial.
Isabel Sarmento presents herself for the trial.
Isabel Sarmento hopes her testimony will absolve her people.
Aarhant is horrified to see the Pyrphorians take over Bright Sands.
The Pyrphorian Grandmaster threatens your family.
Isabel Sarmento vows to fight with you against the Pyrphorians.
The Queen is determined to end this fighting.
The last Pyrphorian acolyte dies.
The Pyrphorian Grandmaster threatens and ridicules you.
The Pyrphorian Grandmaster belittles you.
The Pyrphorian Grandmaster refuses to accept defeat.
The Pyrphorian Grandmaster vows to return and get revenge.
Theodora Ticker is finally reunited with her husband.
Thomas Ticker is relieved that his wife is safe and sound.
Aarhant toasts your victory over the Pyrphorians.
Hannah is full of praise for your victory over the Pyrphorians.
Hannah is excited to be welcoming the Queen to Bright Sands.
The signature was forged by your Uncle. Your father is innocent.
A document summoning Edvard Goode's to trial.

Since you managed to settle the potentially catastrophic dispute over Prosperity, the Queen has decided to entrust the island to you. Isabel Sarmento hands over the keys to the golden gates of Prosperity, an island that evokes only bad memories for her and her people.
Isabel dismantled all of her rebel structures on Prosperity. The island is all yours now.
Isabel Sarmento is happy to see you once again.
Isabel Sarmento is travelling to the Old World to be principal witness at the trial against Edvard.

Select in the New World:
Prosperity Trading Post
Bright Sands
Prosperity
Ditchwater
La Isla
Islands vary greatly in their riches. Examine the fertilities and deposits in this overview to help you choose where to settle.
Islands vary greatly in their riches. Examine their fertilities and deposits before you decide where to settle.
Sail to the coast of the island you want to settle, and build a trading post there to claim it officially.
Select the trading post blueprint in the desired location, and give the order to build it.
Sail in any direction to discover new islands to settle.
Select the trading post blueprint once you're ready to place it.
This is your construction menu. You can select your marketplace, residences, roads and everything else you need.
Start with a marketplace. As the heart of your city, it needs to be placed in an open space, so your people can live around it.
Nobody will be able to reach your marketplace until you build a road to connect it to your trading post.
Housing people is essential! Make sure to build their residences near the marketplace, and connect them via roads so people have access to goods.
You can choose to build farmer's residences, marketplaces and roads from the construction menu.
Your people need to live near a marketplace, otherwise they'll not move in.
People will only be able to reach your marketplace if a road connects it to your trading post.
All residences need to have a marketplace nearby, else no-one will move in!
Residences need to be connected to a nearby marketplace by a road.
Residences need a marketplace nearby. You can select it from your construction menu.
Drag and drop to lay down roads after selecting them from the construction menu. You can also click once to set a starting point, and a second time where you want the road to end.
All production buildings need to be connected either to a warehouse, or the next building in their production chain. Make sure they're close enough!
Warehouses can store and deliver all your goods, but they come at a cost. Be sure to lay out your production buildings as efficiently as possible to make best use of them!

Some production buildings require an input of raw materials or intermediate products. These can be sourced either from a warehouse, or directly from the production building itself. The final goods, on the other hand, can only go to a warehouse - so be sure to build the final building of your production chain near to one.
Storage is shared across all warehouses: once your goods have been delivered to a warehouse, they become accessible to the whole island.
Every marketplace, warehouse and public building needs to be accessible from your trading post!
Every marketplace, warehouse and public building needs to be accessible from your trading post!
Your farmers are hungry! Build a fishery by the sea!
Every fish they catch needs to be delivered to a warehouse or a trading post. Be sure to lay a road between them!
Fisheries can only be built by the sea, and must be connected to either a warehouse, or your trading post.
Once delivered to a warehouse, goods become accessible to the general population. Make sure your markets are kept well stocked!
Your population's access to a marketplace, and the amount of stock you own determines their level of satisfaction with their goods.
Your people's demands will grow along with your city. If their needs are not satisfied, they might move out!
Start by opening the timber production chain in the construction menu.
Place a lumberjack's hut in the forest to produce wood.
Place a sawmill near the lumberjack's hut, and connect them with a road. The sawmill will consume wood to produce timber.
Don't forget roads! The sawmill workers need to be able to access wood!
