Canis lupus. Can smell you a mile away.
Vulpes vulpes. Makes dens in back gardens.
Larus argentatus. Eats human refuse.
Cervus elaphus. Majestic forest creatures.
Chelonia mydas. Swims for its life.
Rattus. They're everywhere!
Accipitridae. The definitive birds of prey.
Columba. Tuppence a bag.
Apodidae. These birds are fast.
Ciconiiformes. Nests on telegraph poles.
Felis catus. Saunters around the house.
Bos taurus. Ten thousand years our allies.
Gallus gallus domesticus. It's a chicken.
Canis familiaris. Your best friend.
Equus africanus asinus. They look a bit sad.
Capra aegagrus hircus. A stubborn sort.
Equus ferus caballus. Measured in hands.
Bos primigenius taurus. A domestic draught animal.
Sus scrofa domesticus. Poor little piggies.
Ovis aries. Its memory's a little woolly.
Cygnus. A favourite of the Queen.
Psittaciformes. Colourful and talkative birds.
Medusozoa. Wibble-wobble, wibble-wobble!
Rhopalocera. In all their fascinating cycles of life.
Vulpes zerda. Skips around the desert looking for Jerboas.
Gekkota. A collection of sticky-fingered lizards.
Hippocampoi. Horses who gallop across oceans.
Brachypelma albopilosum. A big old hairy spider.
Pterois miles. Its venomous spikes repel predators!
Manta alfredi. A beautiful and bizarre submariner.
Vultur gryphus. A majestic vulture with a vast wingspan.
Larus pacificus. A very large species of gull.
Larus californicus. A bird drawn to the insects found in cities.
Ursus arctos. A large and overbearing lover of salmon.
Ursus americanus. Smells six times better than a dog.
Axis axis. An unusual deer, known for its spottiness.
Rangifer tarandus. Has antlers, and a very shiny nose.
Ovibos moschatus. A bovine with an alluring scent.
Bison bonasus. The subject of some of our earliest cave paintings.
Vulpes cana. These foxes can climb vertical cliffs.
Pavo muticus. A bird with iridescent plumage.
Vicugna pacos. Not to be confused with llamas, who spit a lot.
Struthionidae. A big bird with a good kick.
Phoenicopterus roseus. Fed carrots to keep their feathers pink.
Crocodylinae. Little birds help clean their giant teeth.
Bubulus arnee. Understandably reluctant to co-habit with tigers...
Ursus maritimus. Could teach humans a thing or two about hunting.
Tursiops truncatus. Loves to laugh and play as much as we do.
Orcinus orca. A predator as intelligent and ruthless as humans.
Gorilla. You may find them gathered on a misty mountainside.
Pandinus imperator. A large stinger that fluoresces a very royal blue.
Alcedinidae. A keen angler, jacketed in azure and orange.
Naja ashei. Only try to handle these if you have spectacles close by!
Tetraodontidae. To attract a mate, males draw geometrical designs in the sand.
Pelicanus thagus. A huge pouch filters its prey from the water it swallows.
Calyptorhynchus lathami. Black, but with teasing sensational red underfeathers.
Pagophila eburnea. Looks like snow, and certainly doesn't mind the cold.
Cervus canadensis. Also a wapiti, though not quite as big as a moose.
Pusa hispida. The smallest and most common Northern seal. A rare find.
Otocyon megalotis. Its giant ears are used for thermoregulation.
Canis lupus arctos. Has a smaller brain, and bigger fangs than other wolves.
Xiphias gladius. A rare slashing-nose duellist of the deep.
Panthera tigris tigris. Perhaps the most beautiful of all creatures.
Puma concolor. A secretive feline, master of all New World terrains.
Panthera onca. Kills prey with no more than a powerful bite to the skull.
Melanosuchus niger. Newborns come with vibrant yellow markings.
Lophiiformes. Highly adaptable, they can rise from the abyssal depths to hunt near the coast.
Panthera onca. A melanic variation of the jaguar, who sometimes even eat crocs.
Inia geoffrensis. Pink! Unfused vertebrae allow them to turn their heads 90 degrees.
Amazona vittata. If the life mate of this parrot is injured, it will look for a new partner.
Paradisaeidae. Males attract mates with colourful displays or complex dancing rituals.
Tremarctos ornatus. This introverted bear reaches fruit by building platforms made from twigs.
Lagenorhynchus obscurus. Known for its mid-air acrobatics, this dolphin is monochromatic!
Stenella frontalis. A rare, yet boisterous dolphin, remarkable for its many white speckles.
Feresa attenuata. Oft mistaken for a killer whale, it's really rather more like a tiny dolphin.
Physeter macrocephalus. A finless whale, with the largest brain of all known animals.
Carcharodon carcharias. A great and toothy hunter, it may rest, but will never sleep.
Pseudorca crassidens. A thick-toothed grampus of a whale that likes to dive deep.
Pongo. The characteristic mating call of the male issues from its bulbous throat pouch.
Gorilla. Hark! The mighty silverback stands on two feet and bashes his chest!
Alligator sinensis. A white-pigmented lizard of the East, very protective of its eggs!
Panthera tigris tigris. What immortal hand or eye decided you needed an extra flourish of white?
Nestor productus. The rasping call of this singular orange parrot is said to resemble the bark of a dog.
Kolponomos clallamensis. Though long thought extinct, an isolated group of these bear-like hunters have somehow lived on!
Megaloceros giganteus. It's giant! Its antlers are giant! And now it's come prancing back from the past!
Vulpes zerda. A crepuscular and fleet-footed desert-dweller, with white fur and very, very long ears.
Canis dirus. Once thought extinct, this wolf's bite is more powerful than any known canine. Don't miss feeding time!
Lipotes vexillifer. The goddess of protection to fishermen along the long river, though she is hardly ever seen.
Phocoena sinus. A small porpoise of such discretion and reserve, some doubt their existence - but here's proof!
Panthera pardus adersi. Feared by farmers, these island-dwellers are thought to be servants of witches.
Pongo tapanuliensis. A rare and bashful orangutan with a disc-like face, who likes to eat caterpillars and pine kernels.
Elephas maximus. Captive elephants of this species die much earlier than their wild counterparts.
Pavo cristatus. Our groom parades his bridal train long before the wedding.
Gorilla gorilla gorilla. Due to albinism, this delightful male looks exceptional, but struggles to see very far.
The centuries have obscured their exact use.
Antique book-keeping was much as it is now.
Seems but a humble necklace now, yet back then...
The bright pigment of its life has faded.
Wise old tales of folk.
Of historical value only.
A semi-precious mineral of transparent beauty.
A dent hints at the fate of its original owner.
All a poor soldier had to defend themselves.
Believed to represent an ancient female deity.
Rust has consumed nearly all of the blade.
The mummy itself isn't here? Then, do you think...? No, surely not!
A profound work of fiction, rather novel for its time.
Illustrations spanning hundreds of metres over pebble.
Pyrite is a mineral of uncannily geometric geology.
Pocket money to a prince.
Sealed in glass to preserve the vivid colour of the fabric.
Intact. Maybe this warrior died of natural causes?
The sliver pendant has done well to survive this long.
The corroded ring of a notable wool merchant, perhaps?
Some monk's tireless work of divine calligraphy.
A protective iron disc found in a warrior's grave.
An elegant statue, that has sadly at some point been defaced.
This sword was among the belongings of a fallen warrior.
This Nazcan monkey god grins away your envy.
Intricate patterns are woven into this fragile, musky fabric.
An as yet unidentified king or queen of the Upper Delta.
Sagas that retell the lives and feats of the old Northern kings.
The soft green radiance of this polished gem conjures up images of the Imperial East.
An ancient treatise on medical practices both anatomical and physiological.
Some went their whole lives without ever seeing one.
A ceremonial silver headpiece of untold beauty, but unknown provenance.
The pinnacle of early Goidelic metalwork, in all its gilt silver filigree.
The fossilised spiral shells of long-lost species of marine molluscs.
An old silver ring inscribed with a script of indiscernible origin.
A ceremonial shield you can see your face in. Just don't fight with it.
A classical statue of the god of the sea, sculpted in Aegean marble.
A ceremonial silver sword, which clearly only ever served a decorative purpose.
The body of a Nazcan girl wrapped in a bundle of clothes, found frozen in ice.
Belonged to Takal of the Sun, a deified monarch that reigned for fifty years.
The skeleton of a king among corsairs, who shall be saluted with cannons before we sail to sea.
Truly an epic! This poem, passed down through oral tradition, recounts the siege of Troy.
The man of many ways, finds many ways to get home to his disbelieving wife and son.
The final resting place of the ancient dwellers of the black desert.
A simple house can be a treasure vault of intriguing details of how we used to live.
The stone tiles of a lost city, adorned with scarcely decipherable hieroglyphs.
Stegosaurus Armatus. Characterised by the triangular plates that stretched along its back.
Early paintings of bisons in charcoal and ochre that are so exquisite, they've been called frauds.
Walking among the reliefs of lapiths and centaurs transports one to the Aegean age.
Part of a gentle sanctuary built to honour a goddess of strategy and warfare.
Concentric patterns of ivy or vine make one feel as dizzy as a guest of the deity.
A T-shaped megalithic tomb, where it is thought purifying funeral rites were held.
Intricately interlaced stone carvings, a hallmark of Goidelic ritual and belief.
The many and varied treasures of Ben Sahid, the greatest pirate of all time.
Claims about its authenticity are suitably flimsy, but if it is what it's said to be...
A particularly large and lustrous specimen of the world's most desirable rock.
A lavish gilt headpiece, engraved with war scenes its wearer had perhaps witnessed.
Those who stumbled upon these fossilised eggs at first mistook them for those of a giant bird.
Fits only the slender finger of the rightful heir to a forgotten kingdom.
A fearsome sword, no doubt wielded by the most dreaded old cove of coves.
These towering standing stones are the gatekeepers to a bygone era.
A fine carving of old vessels led by dragon prows, which once sailed Northern seas.

A fantastical tale of the deep, made plausible by its author's attention to detail and scientific scrupulousness in all matters nautical. May it be the first of many successes in this new and bottomless genre!
A runic fantasy of rings, battles for middle earth, and the enduring friendship between two shovel-footed homunculi.
Its plated wings are reminiscent of the mythological Nordic riders, who lived and died on the battlefield.
Homo neanderthalensis. Found embedded in mud and clay, it is a revelation as to the place of humans in nature.
A fabled collection of epic poems that gives us a window into the lives and mythology of the Nordic peoples.
An ingenious cyclical calendar system of stone, which predicts the world will end in about two-hundred years!
A ring of Nordic legend, said to grant its bearer the power to rule the earth, and set the Old Gods in disarray.
The harbour of an ancient port that may have traded in turquoise and jade with the distant Old World.
The temple of the Great Jaguar. Once an important place of ritual, and a gateway to the underworld.
Tyrannosaurus Rex. The mere sight of its skeleton is enough to leave even the bravest schoolchildren cowering.
Apatosaurus Ajax. One of the largest creatures to ever wander the Earth. How did its frame hold its own weight?
Mosasaurus Hoffmanni. Who'd have thought such a vast creature once roamed the oceans, casually snacking on sharks.
Perfectly preserved cave paintings depicting the many animal companions of our great ancestors.
A remarkably well-preserved monument of the Aegean Golden Age that smacks of dolphins and fish.
The last vestige of the beating heart of the Empire of the Eagle. Senators and emperors wandered these halls.
An epic depiction of East and West meeting in battle, rendered in miniature stone tiles.
Celestial energy resonates between these awesome stones, so go ahead - grab a chisel and take some home!
The sacrificial altar of an ancient Nordic temple, where nine males of every living creature were offered to the gods.
The legendary blade of a generous Goidelic ruler. It is said that, if drawn by one worthy, the blade shall blaze with fire.
Merely opening this occult tome makes those nearby uncomfortable. Apparently, the whole thing came to its author in a waking dream; such is his deep, dark and perturbing talent.
Looks important, and allows you to do things. Useful on expeditions.
The movement entrusts you part of their territory.
The royal supply ship's freight list, to be handed over to the Queen.
She's an early riser.
Smells like the bottom of the sea.
Knows his nightcrawlers from his lobworms.
Are those legs sequinned, or is it actually a tail?
You'll never see this old dog blubbing in the cold.
Perfectly content to breathe his air through a tube.
Her fellow sailors swear once she's underwater, she grows gills.
A man who will pursue his underwater prey to the ends of the earth, even if it costs him his own life.
Has a fair degree of patience.
Hard not to be dazzled by her workshop.
Qualified to identify the most microscopic of imperfections.
No longer a rough diamond, he accepts nothing less than 24 carats.
"Where the crown goes, I follow," was his gem of a quip to the royal council.
A bread-winner.
Believes in fifty-fifty, butter and flour.
You'll never believe what she can do with a piping bag.
If you can stand his infamous temper, his "Crème Pat" is to die for.
"It was like taking a bite out of heaven," wept Sir Archibald, when Antoine left the royal kitchens behind.
Stories stop the rollers dozing off.
A faint parfum of dry leaves follows him.
Can identify cigars of the Old World by aroma alone.
Lucia's exquisite hand-rolled cigars have ended lifelong rivalries.
Always a V-cut for Victor, a man known for treating his employees with the same love as his product.
Sells her rum to hospitals.
His friends are the barrels.
Rum doesn't always have to taste rough.
Accredited member of the sommelier's union.
Her palate has matured through her years as a front-of-house.
Knows every fermented and distilled beverage worth knowing, on every continent.
"The Nose" once tasted for Vicente Silva, but as she will tell you — never judge a wine on tradition alone.
She runs with big buckets.
He only joined so he could slide down a pole.
Every scar tells a tale of rescue and survival.
Mills eats burning coals for breakfast, and washes them down with piping hot tea.
Dubbed "Dragonproof", Doughty once tackled a Pyrphorian blaze bare-chested, having given his vest to an orphan.
He'll sort people out.
Could sell a nut shell for the price of a schooner.
Knows every boat that washes in and out of her jurisdiction.
When Timothy welcomes you into port, you know things will be very taxing indeed.
The ultimate defender of national self-interest, Lady Banes makes sure what comes in, doesn't go out.
"You want your glass rinsed?"
A stew and a brew. Excuse the roaches.
Offers relatively fresh fish pie and a sympathetic ear.
None ever pass from his establishment without supremely contented grins.
If his bewildering selection of beers and broths provide insufficient music, Lewenstein shall summon his musicians!
A learned fellow.
Rarely seen in daylight without a book.
Her stern tone only demonstrates the seriousness of the subject.
Even as an undergraduate, Razzaq's research began to circulate among his fellows.
Ebashi has revealed a reality previously invisible to human eyes, changing physics, chemistry and medicine forever.
Could tell you a couple of good places to spend the night, for the right tip.
With her help, anyone can discover every precious little corner of the city.
She was but eight years old when she led her first tour for visitors.
Thanks to his passion for both sailing and touring, his ferry company became renowned all across the country.
She founded the first travel agency, spreading her love for tourism to every corner of the world.
Swings his machete close to the ground.
Carries it all on her head.
Her picking technique is unsurpassed.
His calves are like the trunks of his trees.
…and yet not unfamiliar with the science of soil, either. His life is dirt!
Gradually climbed the ladder, and now has a good overview.
Mrs. Brown always wears a broad-brimmed hat, and is therefore not as sun-kissed as her crops.
Hermann's favourite tree is the Black Locust, whose long, dark pods fall in autumn.
Fruit-bearing or otherwise, Dr Al-Zahir's trees are living sculptures, each with distinct personalities.
Clings on like a barnacle.
Builds boats beautifully.
Favours iron composite constructions.
Much of his science is trial and error, so it's lucky he's an excellent swimmer.
Bhargava designed the Great Western, which it's claimed is the largest sailing vessel ever built.
Small is as small does. He renounced the black flag, to sell pirate ship knowhow to the highest bidder.
Piracy chose Petra, so she'll make no bones of spilling its secrets - like how they run such fearsome frigates.
His piratical ships-of-the-line were a well-kept secret, until Shih Yang swore allegiance to the Emperor.
Sick of the pirate life, Maria fled to the mountains. If convinced back to shore, she sure knows her monitors...
A Pyrphorian outcast because he whiffed of cheese, Stilton knows exactly how their maleficent monitors are made.
Defecting to save her own skin, Suspicia's plans for a Pyrphorian battle cruiser are both tantalising, and a little chilling.
Sinistra confessed the Pyrphorian warship plans under torture, and must be kept under guard for everyone's safety.
Guscott was given his first ship at the age of five. It was therefore inevitable he would go on to work for the Queen.
Anna's extraordinary sense of community enables her to build vessels both enterprising and festive!
Wears a boiler suit.
Half-blind from years of welding.
Possesses the ardent heart of a stoker.
He made swords when other kids were still playing with them.
His powerful hammer strikes compare to that of a Norse god.
Though she burned her hands as a child, it only made her passion stronger.
Zanchi invented the steel process, so perhaps he has every right to be as ruthless and proud as he appears.
People often mistake him for one of the apes.
Always barefoot.
Even the fiercest beast calms down in her presence.
For months she slept among the wolves, studying their behaviour, to the point where they accepted her as part of the pack.
The brilliant biologist that uncovered the realities of evolution and natural selection, defying all prior beliefs.
His door is always open.
Quick to offer his thoughts and prayers.
Her heavenly voice inspires courage in the community.
His sermons on a life of moderation are sometimes very convincing indeed.
The Pope has redefined the position of the church, so it may safely navigate the confusion of the modern age.
D'Artois appeared as a vision to a poor beggar man, entrusting him with spreading her illuminating wisdom.
Has a gentle bedside manner.
Unafraid to ask embarrassing questions.
Does not flinch at the sight of the lepers.
Whistling while he works, Dr. Salvador always puts his patients at ease.
He will not say why he left the Promise Trust, but Slim's status as a world-renowned surgeon was never in doubt.
An exceptional bacteriologist, Hecate's vaccinations will be saving lives long after he himself has departed.
Do they laugh with him, or at him?
Has perfected the art of knock-knock jokes.
Walks the boards to full houses up and down the country.
She acts as a vessel to the deepest, darkest emotions of the human soul.
Queen of pose and gesture, Sarah's terrific qualities have even been captured in the fledgling art of celluloid.
Prefers trees to people.
Straw man.
Sly as a fox.
Knows the way through the woods.
Can't stop looking into the flames.
Watch your step if you travel in tow!
Don't let him catch you holding a match in the forest.
"Take only what you need, and make sure to waste nothing."
Miss Rodriguez knows deforestation will become a heated topic in the near future.
Smothered in snake skin, he infiltrated their nest and stole all their rattles.
"The continued survival of our forests depends least of all on the trees."
Ploughs on through.
Goes with the grain.
Her feet are purple.
Every seed should have room to grow.
Grows peppers a glossier red.
Favours rocky hillsides, with south-facing aspects.
Somehow produces the most fruitful home-made fertiliser!
Habitually plants using depth probes and measuring tape.
Farming is both a tradition and a science, and Yvonne takes a smattering of both.
His wines have been spat, his peppers probed. The verdict? Outstanding.
Castelli's move from the political field to the muddier fields surprised everyone, until the day he showed off his potatoes.
Certified claustrophobia free.
Desperate to find something.
One of the toughest men on earth - or under it!
She's an especially slick operator.
Detonates his charges only when all precautions have been taken.
Micaela's ambition is really just to save a few lives down there.
Jörg always seems to be first on the scene before the gold rush begins in earnest. Has the heart of cousin Carl.
She can fix anything with a fountain pen and a paper clip.
A bobby on the beat.
Is keeping her eye on you.
Makes sure the police service gets the respect they deserve.
Horace Clifford is a belter of an interrogator, who grabs the bull by the horns.
Kneeling before the Queen, Rafferty said modestly, "I simply did what I thought was right, Your Majesty."
He's pretty sure he knows right from wrong, and he sees wrong every which way he turns.
Wanders off.
Has an uncommon taste for the unknown.
Knows every degree of latitude and longitude.
Has discovered waterfalls and forgotten civilisations.
Flo goes with her name, to whichever land has shown or offered its promise.
Mr. Norris has sailed the terrible triangle, and lived to tell the tale.
Irma dives into the unexpected. Does that make her brave, or simply oblivious?
"Love, though sometimes incompatible with a desire for progress, is the thing we should all be searching for."
"If I be warmly-dressed, and full of rum, I believe I shall have no trouble with the cold whatsoever."
Willhelm was a young romantic until he dug up rumours of a sunken city, and the idea of finding it consumed him.
"I shall take no tribute from these faraway shores, that should spoil our getting along thereafter."
Marell must travel far and wide, in order to know the night sky is the same for all inhabitants of this blue-green ball.
His passion for History has brought him to every corner of the globe.
A clothes moth.
He'll tan your hide.
Ensures they're tightly-knit.
Quickly picks up the thread.

Lord Wainthrop counters that if the populace will voluntarily dull their minds, we may as well milk them for it!
A reduction in visible displays of religion reduces its influence.
Religion is partially separated from daily life.
In Hugo's vision of society, the church and the state are entirely separate.
These pamphlets remind the populace of a greater power.
A reminder of the power of spiritual organisations, even in this modern age.
The Cardinal's terrifying power is resurrected in this document, which may convert even the most stubborn of sinners.
Death and taxes.
Nobody enjoys paying tax, even less now.
Max dwells in a deep vault, and will only converse in the language of nickel on the subject of percentage values.
A bit of leeway for the poor.
When passed, a hundred brows are mopped of sweat.
Beryl made this proposal - but only, of course, because she'd heard the terrible plight of the poor.
A new bank holiday has been declared!
The Queen has given herself yet another birthday!
"I get paid to go on expeditions all the time, so it's only fair that it's the same for everyone else."
Extends working hours, with mild disgruntlement.
Greatly extends working hours, with disgruntlement.
Another of Carl's charitable proposals, this one seeking to keep people in the workplace all day, every day.
There's room for negotiation with protestors now.
There's now a reward for those who will hand themselves in.
George believes that where there's a will, there's a way to negotiate people towards a better world.
The island is advertised as a pleasing destination.
The island is advertised as a top destination.
Madame Kahina knows exactly what aesthetic changes need to be made in order to make people buy into something.
An eighth child? How wonderful.
All should be free to have as many bouncing babies as they wish, or indeed, as they don't wish.
Preventing the natural course is the gravest sin, rules religious leader, and fourteenth child of his family.
An essay to provoke ambitions of a better life for women in your city.
Stresses the importance of a good education for women as well as men in your city.
"All citizens, including women, should be equally able to vote, and take employment on the grounds of individual merit."
An essay suggesting women shouldn't have access to education...
A man argues very loudly that women are inferior, and all the other men believe it.
"Be obedient, docile, and live in the shadow of your husband", appears to be the presiding lesson for the women of this century.
Keeps the doctor away.
Its secret was a mouldy petri dish!
That'll stop them foaming at the mouth!
Foam party!
A cocktail from your kitchen cupboard.
A marvellous and most modern vapouriser!
Puts out fires.
Puts out fires well.
Very good at putting out fires.
Free beer!
Free spirits!
The end of the revolution party!
Free money!
Lots of free money!
Life-changing sums of free money!
An experimental torpedo.
An improvement on earlier versions.
Its path remains true, no matter the weather.
Piercing shells.
Super-duper piercing shells.
Explosive shells.
Super-duper explosive shells.
Granular warfare.
Extra granular warfare.
Traditional fireworks.
Building on a spectacular tradition.
They linger high and vivid in the night sky.
Good for traditional ship repairs.
All your crew needs to repair modern ships in battle.
Good for repairing buildings.
Excellent for repairing buildings.
Yarrrrr!
Yaaaaaarrrrrr!
No-one can touch you!
And it gets you good deals as well...
Quick, get rid of it!
Run! She's going to blow!
A classic.
For twisted firestarters...
Old school projectiles.
A man walks into a bar.... Ouch.
I'm here on business!
I'm here on important business!
I'm here on Her Majesty's business!
Boom!
Boooooooom!
Thunk...
Collateral damage.
1701 vintage.
The milk of human kindness.
Oozes with confidence.
Soup kitchen.
Comes with all the trimmings.
Keeps the wheels rolling.
Encourages household haberdashery.
Food bank.

Bluehead's avant-garde torpedo will revolutionise your naval offensive, with its innovative compressed air underwater propellant system, and precise explosive warhead delivery thanks to gyroscopic course-correction.
Effective as ever, these mortars can be mounted onto your ship to bombard your enemies from above with explosive shells.
These cranes will lift the burden off your shipwrights' shoulders, and greatly hasten the shipbuilding process.
Your shipwrights will have all they need to repair your ship in the midst of battle with this portable set of ship repairing tools.
Nicknamed "Lucky Charm" by the 3rd Brigade, stories of the great victories that followed after he took to the turrets precede him, infusing his comrades with a sense of invincibility.
Spread the battle rage throughout your ranks with the acoustic amplifying power of this megaphone.
A piece of wood, bearing the name of the sunken ship.
Enough for several harvests.
Knows everything about the potato.
Universal eaters, eaten universally.
No painted horses this time.
Tranquil giants with an eternal memory of their home.
Worth the five men it took to catch.
Speak softly and carry a big stick.
One sheep, two sheep, three sheep ...
Notes about a mysterious land far away.
A symbol of luck for the gullible.
TODO
"Look, Dad ! A huge tree trunk!" *banging noise*
The legendary cat, trophy of tribal warriors.
A single beetle amulet was put within mummies to guard their journey.
The verdict is still out on whether cats are pets or gods or both.
Look on my works, ye Mighty, and despair!
The journey of the dead described here is even longer than this books' journey.
Not demanding anymore crackers.
Someone decided this bird should live on forever.
Two of the three heads seem odd…
An illustrious book with golden letters and colorful flourishes.
This god's gem allegedly controls the winds.
The fabled weapon capable of leveling mountains.
A delicate hammer that produced many famous jewellery pieces.
To fish, throw dynamite into the sea with a left-click.
An explosive gift from Aarhant's emergency supplies.
You don't feel much like sampling them...
Someone assiduously fostered this little fella.
Crammed with lively observations and assorted pressed flowers.
The initials BJ have been engraved on these. A gift, perhaps?
A number of question marks curled in graceful handwriting.
A powerful, yet dismal presence emanates from beneath the linen wrappings. No wonder Bente wanted rid of it.
The tip of the drill is smeared with blood, hair and skin.
The word DOOMED is engraved on the forehead...
Shows signs of heavy use.
Strong enough to put a herd of bulls to sleep.
Alonso wanted to use the tooth to carve the word SINNER in capital letters smack bang on your forehead, but you managed to leave just before that.
A disturbingly Oedipal confession on money, guilt, ghosts and motherly love.
Engraved with an emblem of unknown origin. Its legitimate owner, maybe?
"Yum... just like mum's."
It has a false bottom. Maybe it's part of some sort of trick?
Willie was close to tears when he presented this to you. Actually, he was sobbing his heart out.
Looks expensive. Charity lady-like.
Sharp enough to chop branches.. or the fingers of ragamuffins.
"Hey, listen! Is that scratching coming from inside?"
"Come on dearie, come and have a chat with old Beryl..."
After steering clear of an unwanted marriage, Beryl's fosterling joined your ranks. She seems to be surprisingly resourceful.
So, this is the source of Carl's peculiar smell...
Somebody has deformed this with a heavy hammer.
It bears the emblem of the Von Malching Family. It appears as if someone might have tampered with it...
There is an engraving. It reads: "For Bente, found at the end of the rainbow. Your darling Carl."
Being a newly-instated Baron, Carl doesn't need this tattered old rag anymore.
A toast to the self-proclaimed greatest architect of all time.
It's Gasparovesque.
Someone's been desperately searching for 'inspiration'.
It's nothing to look at, but the mind of a genius wanders these pages. Quite, quite alone.
Hidden amongst the scrapped blueprints and sketches are the hideous pottered prototypes of that final statue. Artur asks that you sink the chest wherever the water is deepest.
Artur really wanted to have his portrait made, but quickly changed his mind when he saw how much grey the artist was using.
The kind of useless keepsake an Emperor gifts his daughter.
To celebrate an Empress's impending victory over the West.
Standard issue for imperial spies.
Nothing less than breathtaking. You feel ashamed for reading it.
Princess Qing gave it to you, since it didn't please Her Majesty. Though it's true the Queen may not have given it her undivided attention.
Taken from Benjamin's stiff finger as she wept.
"There will be a reckoning! The guilty belong at the bottom of the sea."
"One day she will hang, as her father hung Benjamin."
Manufactured by the Promise Trust. It looks better for you than it actually is...
Though it's held in an unspectacular flask, there is something terrifically odd about Margaret Hunt's cure.
The last of La Corona's jewels, to be traded for weapons...
"Bahh, why must I always eat local food!"
As majestic and superior looking as in the past.
Vicente's plan was to use it against Sarmento... If only it was working!
To fight revolutionary thoughts, you have to understand what provokes them. Vicente's insider will be sure to find out.
He's deaf without the stupid thing.
Seems strange, but George doesn't dare throw this away. Memories, you know.
Back from the days when he was a chief inspector.
Unsurprisingly, George turns out to be an expert tailor.
A toy horse, likely crafted for a little child — though someone must have played rough with it, if the crack is anything to go by...
Anne found this chap below deck and thought he was funny, so she placed him in her cabin.
The skull symbolises her death wish; the daggers, revenge.
Still recites the old tunes daddy played before they hung him.
It says: 'Whatever bluecoat reads this, arm yourself, board a ship, and kill me if you can.'
A pendant her father, Benjamin, wore. It means more to Anne than she would ever admit, so you must be special if she gave it to you.
Jean is a practical man most of the time, but nothing matches the power of Voodoo.
Jean's reminder of what happens when you ask La Corona for safe conduct.
"Please papa, come home safe and sound!"
There is nothing on a ship that an extra ration of rum won't fix.
It is overwhelming to see the scale of injustice contained within. The name 'La Fortune' appears more than once.
A farmer's gift. "Foster it the way you foster us farmers, and its branches will reach up to the heavens!"
A farmer's gift. "She has a very rare pattern of spots on her hindquarters, and the most cheerful disposition you can imagine!"
A farmer's gift. "When I baked this, I thought of your proven kindness and good leadership!"
A farmer's gift. "You have to try this! Rosetta's been giving me much more, and much richer milk since we settled on this island!"
A farmer's gift. "Straight from the pot. All you have to do is peel 'em!"
A farmer's gift. "This beauty was vital for many a harvest. I hope it will serve your busyness just as well!"
A worker's gift. "I drowned all my sorrows with that. Maybe you could do the same, boss - if you know feelings like sorrow, that is..."
A worker's gift. "It's me personal collection. Helps you to fix stuff. Y'know, just in case..."
A worker's gift. "I was told this fella is able to talk, but he's not. Maybe he doesn't like my loose tongue. Why don't you give it a try, boss?"
A worker's gift. "In the mines, they said this was like gold to you, boss. I don't have any real gold, so I thought I'd offer my thanks with this instead."
A worker's gift. "I don't want to go above me station 'ere, boss, but it would be a right pleasure to raise a glass with you!"
A worker's gift. "Just in case you have to wake us up, boss. We can be bunch of sleepyheads sometimes..."
An artisan's gift. "If you ever forget time the way I do, this beauty will set you back on course - I guarantee it!"
An artisan's gift. "Take this. If even I, a lowly craftsman, suffer insomnia, goodness knows what it must be like to preside over an empire!"
An artisan's gift. "Just in case you want to make yourself heard. I sometimes get the feeling people aren't listening - at least not to me!"
An artisan's gift. "If ever you wish to get down to the nitty-gritty, as I do, this will help you out."
An artisan's gift. "This is Sourpuss, my goat. Please, take it. Just in case you feel like shouting at someone, but you don't want to shout at people like, well... us."
An artisan's gift. "I found this in the attic. I think it's a really fine example of craftsmanship. When you look at it, think of us!"
An engineer's gift. "Look at the way it's been structured. How the materials support each other. The beauty of functionality!"
An engineer's gift. "I invented the breakthrough stainless ink with this! I can't think of a better present for someone like you!"
An engineer's gift. "I wrote down everything that should be done, but which is always forgotten. Use it wisely."
An engineer's gift. "Even in its broken state, this, the very first generator I built, still means the world to me."
An engineer's gift. "It may not be working quite as intended, but there's so much potential. Study with care, and draw your own conclusions."
An engineer's gift. "I know, it doesn't look spectacular - but I thought a lot about this one, and I think it may work."
An investor's gift. "Ever since I placed this beauty in my front garden, the burglars have stayed away."
An investor's gift. "Too many subjects envy hard-working business people like us." Immediately calls the guards.
An investor's gift. "Your wise leadership is beneficial to all of us. Let's celebrate with a small bottle of bubbly!"
An investor's gift. "It took me to the top - it's a sure thing it'll do the same for you!"
An investor's gift. "Just in case you want to take a nice picture of your many material possessions."
An investor's gift. "A biologist once gave them to me as a present, after I financed his first jungle expedition."
A jornalero's gift. "It's just a donkey, jefe. But he was the brother I never had."
A jornalero's gift. "Without this fella, my brain would have been roasted by the sun. Maybe it will protect you from going crazy, too..."
A jornalero's gift. "When you have to chew on something, these are pretty good, jefe!"
A jornalero's gift. "Don't listen to what he says, jefe. He's just a parrot!"
A jornalero's gift. "Look at this beauty, jefe. Never seen a bird like this. Love her, even though she's just ranting and raving."
An obrero's gift. "I don't have any money or treasures to thank you, but this is my favourite novel. I must have read it a thousand times."
An obrero's gift. "He's such a cutie. If you're ever lonely, Jose will make you smile again."
An obrero's gift. "They may look ordinary, but after you've tasted them you'll think differently!"
An obrero's gift. "Look, this is how my grandma worked. And thanks to you, I go to a factory now and make this my own life."
An obrero's gift. "I found this beautiful stone. Think it might be precious, don't you think?"

Originating in the high peaks of the New World, these animals are well adapted to rocky cliffs and cloudy forests. The alpaca and their cousins have become loyal companions to the human inhabitants of the region, with whom they have worked as pack animals for centuries.

The forest creatures of the taiga — a cold, northern coniferous forest. Understanding the lives of animals that are able to survive the long harsh winters on very little encourages your people to show restraint in their own consumption.

Not only do these fabled creatures exist, but in your hospitality they have a chance at avoiding permanent extinction! That the tales were true will surely appeal to the romantic notions of writers in your city.
Creatures of the abyss, these are ocean killers you wouldn't want to come face to face with. Your aquaria of marine predators can educate your people about life under the sea.

Originating from the rainforest basin, the vivid colours of these animals are without equivalent in the Old World. Your city's fashionistas will no doubt take inspiration from their flamboyant markings.

An array of exotic fauna endemic to the eastern subcontinent, as encountered through the ages by merchants on the Silk Road. This display will no doubt attract similarly wealthy visitors from afar, and perhaps even their exotic gifts!
While these farm animals may seem nothing special to most visitors, there still remains a lot to learned about breeding and caring for our domestic species.
To see the variety of animals that live along the Great Coral Reef is extremely educational for young children. Amused by the dolphins, they'll better understand the complexities of life.
Depigmentation, mutation or natural adaptation — what does it matter? These powder-white ghosts are a rare and wondrous sight when by chance they descend on a heavenly cloud.

Trench-scudding monstrosities of nightmare, these freakish denizens of the deep, formerly believed to have "accidentally fallen from the surface", will provoke gasps of horror and fascination from the public, while enriching your scientists' knowledge about the fauna of the abysses.

Fireflies of the deep, these bizarre organisms bioluminesce with such variety that those unacquainted with their existence are likely to be left feeling dazzled. The discovery and understanding of their luminescence can encourage your people to better beautify their interiors.

In the inhospitable landscape of the Polar Circle, a handful of incredible creatures have evolved to adapt to unfathomably cold temperatures. Their thick coats of skin, fur and feathers keep them warm even under frozen seas and unending blizzards.
The Arctic tundra reminds your visitors of the challenging conditions those lost on Arctic expeditions have had to endure, a popular hot — or rather, very cold — topic at the moment.

The full splendour of the ancient southern empire, known for their buildings and infrastructure that were far ahead of their time. Discovering their history can better inform modern construction, and encourage your people to contribute more towards their city.
The haunting funereal remains of a mysterious New World civilisation, unearthed for the public. A go-to destination for any leading figure hoping to be enchanted.
The first steps our ancestors took through the wilderness of prehistory, on display to the public. Likely to help your citizens develop a basic understanding of resource-gathering for survival.
The golden age of piracy, and all the adventures that came with it. The romance of that fading age is likely to win the hearts of your sailors.

The distinctive religious architecture and mythological inscriptions left behind by the ancient city states of the Aegean. Your people will soon want their famous tragedies to play in your theatres and museums.
The colossal ruined cities of stone that lie hidden beneath the canopy of the New World jungle. Learning more about these civilisations may help you discover the long lost Golden City.
Ceremonial objects of the Nordic culture that once spread fear and destruction along the shores of the Old World. Their skill at war, and their famous fearlessness may inspire your own forces.
Ground-breaking geological discoveries that put into question our very origins! Serving as an open university, your museum's revelations may result in reduced attendances at church.

A protohistorical civilization from the north west of the Old World, known for its stone circles and magical forests. The inherent beauty of your quarries and forests may now finally sink in for visitors to the exhibition.

So, the stories were true! After all, what else could possibly explain these drowned memories of a forgotten time - fragments of those who lived on that great continent that once lay beyond the narrow strait. As the (highly questionable) origin of earthly civilisation, knowledge gathered from atlantean ruins may help your archaeologists determine the location of other lost cities.

Remnants of the day two vast empires clashed at the cape of Trelawney. Each sunken object a cenotaph to those who died on both sides; the servants of patriotism and duty, bound eternally with the sea. Reminders of the glory days may boost your own citizens' patriotism, even in the harshest times.
A greater insight into the Inuit and pre-Inuit cultures that inspires a sense of wonder and civic peace. An eye-opening exhibition that breaches the distance between two very different people.
From cubs to mastodons, all are powerless against the Arctic's freezing temperatures. Ice has preserved the pieces of this exhibition in a near-perfect state.
A collection of gigantic, colourful and sometimes edible plants that originated in the New World. This eclectic collection may stimulate an interest in fruit production among your people.
The calypso palms and bright corals of the westward isles. Visitors will enjoy tranquil walks in the azure seascape, hardly noticing the time pass. It may convince them to holiday for longer.
Some plants commonly found in marshes. Marsh plants can be poisonous and house mosquitoes and other creatures humans consider pests. Your people may begin to take more care in regard to hygiene.
Plants both beautiful and demure from the Near East. The wild, understated beauty of this display may provoke your people to have dreams of the exotic.
The divine and revered plants of eastern jungles. This sanctuary of sacred plants from afar may attract pilgrims who'll want to make offerings to these living deities.
The most common plants found in the icy north. Studying boreal flora may help your people better understand forest biomes.

A small collection of plants surviving in the arid mountains of the New World. The plants of the Andes have strong powers of water retention. Studying them may help your people to perfect agricultural processes.

The essential plants of medicinal gardens, as grown by monks in past times. Traditional medicinal plants have value even in a time of rapid scientific disovery. Studying them may turn up new cures and help people recover faster.

A fascinating collection of plants with darkly mysterious properties. The rediscovery of these witchy plants, and their use by humans, may rejuvenate the production of more socially acceptable vices in the city.

"A stranger may ask you to bear a heavy burden. Refuse."
"Never kneel behind a donkey."
"Share all your secrets with your best friend. (P.S. his initials are W.W.)"
"Always respect your elders, especially your mum."
"Reconsider that love letter... She won't be interested..."
"You will come into some money very soon, but beware! You will also lose some..."
"Sometimes it's better to do the opposite of what you had planned."
"Death! At some point in the near, or distant, future..."
"When you don't understand something, always pretend you do..."
"Seek guidance from either a man or a woman in the coming days..."
"If the opportunity to absorb celestial radiations presents itself, take it with open arms!"
"Why not come to the aid of a close friend? Especially one who appears in a state of deep spiritual torment..."
"Stop ignoring my predictions, or you are going to miss out!"
Willie's Latest Tarot Reading:
Ancient Theatre Performances
Another fertility can be enabled if built in the other region.
Activates fur fertility if built in the Old World.
Activates grapes fertility if built in the Old World.
Activates wheat fertility if built in the Old World.
Activates hops fertility if built in the Old World.
Activates paprika fertility if built in the Old World.
Activates caoutchouc fertility if built in the New World.
Activates banana fertility if built in the New World.
Activates coffee fertility if built in the New World.
Activates tobacco fertility if built in the New World.
Activates sugar fertility if built in the New World.
Activates cocoa fertility if built in the New World.
The Cordillera Park in your zoo inspires your farmers and jornaleros to use alpacas in their daily work.
The Taiga Forest Park in your zoo encourages your people to show moderation in their food consumption.
The Extinct Species Park in your zoo inspires creative writers in your city. They will regularly ask for your help.
The Ocean Predators Park in your zoo teaches your people a lot about the behaviour of marine life.
The Rainforest Park animals in your zoo inspire new colorful decorative patterns for your city.
The Eastern Jungle Park in your zoo attracts rich merchants from afar.
The Farm Animal Park teaches your people domestic animal care and breeding.
The Great Coral Reef Park in your zoo educates children, and increases the happiness of workers and artisans.
The Albino Park encourages many more visitors, keen to donate and preserve these pale peculiarities.
The Abyssal Depths Park delivered precious knowledge about the long-unknown deep abysses and their fauna. Your zoological searches during diving sessions now have a greater chance of success.
The Luminaries Park in your zoo inspires your people to use better lighting at their venues, resulting in astonishing phosphorescent displays for the viewing pleasure of their customers.
The animals that live in the Arctic Polar Circle are perfectly prepared to endure sub-zero temperatures. Your clothing production buildings are inspired by their naturally engineered coats.
The Arctic Tundra Park attracts plenty of curious visitors, eager to learn more about the conditions those lost in the Arctic have had to endure.
The Empire of the Eagle Exhibition in your museum inspires your people to build safer architecture and pay higher taxes.
The New World Huaca Exhibition in your museum attracts the leading figures of the esotericism world to your city.
The Origin of Mankind Exhibition in your museum reminds your people of ancestral techniques for resource gathering.
The Skull and Bones Exhibition in your museum converted your sailors to piracy.
The Aegean Culture Exhibition in your museum promoted classical literature. As such, your theatres now perform ancient tragedies, making your city more attractive.
The Lost Cities Exhibition in your museum contains clues about a legendary city of gold. Merchants will sometimes return from said legendary city, with gold.
The Northern Sagas Exhibition in your museum fills your people with a warlike spirit, which empowers your military.
The Jurassic Exhibition in your museum abandons creationism in favour of evolutionary theory, with life-sized specimens!
The Bronze Age Exhibition reminds both your people, and any visitors, of the beauty of natural landscapes like quarries and forests.

The Atlantis Exhibition has been studied by your historians; the cryptic messages and shapes of the lost civilization spawning theories about other lost cities. Your archaeological searches during diving sessions now have a greater chance of success.
The Battle of Trelawney exhibition fills your people with a deep sense of patriotism, defending their nation during naval battles whatever the cost.
Inspired by the Thule Relics Exhibition, your people become more curious and respectful of the Arctic and everything related to it.
In awe at the perfect state of conservation of the Icebound Exhibition, your food and drinks producers have learned a thing or two about preservation.
By studying the Amazon Garden, your people are now able to seed their own local plantations of fruit trees that were previously impossible to grow.
Visitors exploring your Sargasso Sea Garden now have an overwhelming thirst for vacation and island life. Some of them will stay forever.
By observing the stagnant ponds of your Marshland Garden, your people have become acutely aware of the need for a proper water treatment system. Your overall city illness risk has decreased.
Inspired by the Near East Garden, your people have decided to adopt some Near East culture in their daily life. They can now develop and expand the production of spices.
Pilgrims are arriving from everywhere to experience the meditative splendour of your Sacred Garden, leaving offerings behind when they leave.

Learning more about northern forests in your Subalpine Garden has taught your people more about forest biomes, extending their knowledge of arboriculture and increasing their ability to hunt in those environments.
Studying your rocky Andean Garden has taught your people how to help different plants grow, flourish and expand, even during droughts.
Studying your Herb Garden has enabled your doctors and chemists to develop new cures, letting them heal your people faster.

While they may find the properties of the plants in the Enchanted Garden a little too far out, your people have been inspired to improve and refine production of more traditional plant-based stimulants.
Rumour has it that hostile ships are on the route this expedition will take.
I hear strange stories about even stranger things happening in this part of the world.
It seems likely we will encounter diplomatic challenges on the expedition ahead.
I overheard some old seamen regaling each other with stories of flourishing wildlife on the route of the expedition ahead.
The Admiralty advise that we prepare for diseases on this expedition.
We ought to make sure to have plenty of manpower, if reports of the expedition ahead are to be believed.
This area of the world is completely unknown to our sailors. We should prepare for some difficult navigation.
I recommend stocking up on crafting materials, or hiring craftsmen for this one.
Rations are vital for your crew's morale.

Will you be bold enough?
Will you take the safe road?
A whimsical excursion into the unknown. Anything is possible!
There are historical artefacts out there just dying to be unearthed!
A voyage based on the rumoured whereabouts of a rare animal!
Rumours about unclaimed territories have spread. We should investigate this ahead of our competitors.

The island Prosperity appears to be the cause of your father's troubles. He was accused of selling it to Isabel Sarmento, the leader of an independence movement. Despite her opposition to Queen and Empire, Sir Archibald believes that if her hideout can be found, it's possible she may be willing to co-operate.
We received news of a maritime accident, it is our duty to rescue who and what we can!
The Admiralty has exposed the whereabouts of some pesky pirates who terrorize the area.
Crazy Description of Test Expedition containing unresistable teasers
This expedition is used to test a specific event.
Finding the contract for the sale of Prosperity Island is crucial if you're to prove that your father had no part in it.
The Queen has vanished! Sir Archibald has asked you to chase her over land and sea, and find out what on earth she is playing at!
The New World may have been discovered long ago, but there are rumours of an uninhabited and bounteous new archipelago!
An expedition to Cape Trelawney! A giant island in the temperate south, with seas full of long-lost treasure!

Prosperity Contract

Crackerjack! The perfect shot. Though a slender target, the mast snaps through, burying its operators in debris and leaving the boat dead in the water. With the freedom of their ship, your crew find an ingenious-looking machine, but no sign of the Prosperity contract. Nevertheless, you are now certain it must have changed hands in nearby Montoya, and make a beeline for the port.

Woomph! Your brutes descend like gibbons on lianas. What few cultists are aboard the ship are ruthlessly dispatched. With the freedom of their ship, your crew find some arcane Pyrphorian devices, but no sign of the Prosperity contract. Nevertheless, you are now certain it must have changed hands in nearby Montoya, and make a beeline for the port.

It works this time. Firing from a closer range, your competent cannoneers have no trouble picking out the mast. It buries the enemy in debris, and leaves the sail-less boat adrift. With the freedom of their ship, your crew find some arcane Pyrphorian devices, but no sign of the Prosperity contract. Now knowing it can only have changed hands in nearby Montoya, you make a beeline for the port.

Your crew lick their lips. You thought they seemed the types to enjoy tussles at close quarters, and so it proves. Cloaks drop all around, and with the cultists dead, the ship is yours. Your crew find an ingenious-looking machine aboard, but no sign of the Prosperity contract. Now knowing it can only have changed hands in nearby Montoya, you make a beeline for port.

The cowled figures fall like beetles swept from a window ledge. Your marksmen pause to survey the scene. "A fearful desire these Pyrphorians have to die for their cause...", says one wistfully. Picking through their ship reveals some arcane Pyrphorian devices, but no sign of the Prosperity contract. Now knowing it can only have changed hands in nearby Montoya, you make a beeline for the port.

Destructive, but effective. Shots explode onto the Pyrphorian deck, and the weighty flame cannons drop through the boards. With the freedom of the ship, your crew find some arcane Pyrphorian devices, but no sign of the Prosperity contract. Now knowing it can only have changed hands in nearby Montoya, you make a beeline for the port.

You emerge right on top of them! Swinging masterfully through the stone jaws that gate the inlet, your navigators traverse a fantasy lagoon. Bursting beyond it into the bay, their ambush is received with complete surprise. With the freedom of the Pyrphorian ship, your crew find an ingenious-looking machine, but no sign of the Prosperity contract. Nevertheless, you are now certain it must have changed hands in nearby Montoya, and make a beeline for the port.

Captain's Recommendations
Potential Rewards
This mistake is the last straw. Your crew don't have a grain of trust in their superiors, and decide to take their chances alone. It's all-out mutiny. Your expedition is lost.
NEW ARTICLE!
This article still needs a headline and text.
FIRST FARMERS LAND

Farmers flock to join [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], hoping to prosper from the earth as they always have done. At least at first, there will be little time for naps behind the haystack as the new settlement begins to find its feet...
FIRST WORKERS CLOCK IN

First workers bustle into [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], trading in sleepy ploughs for a bright industrial future. A bold new era begins as the furnaces are lit, plumes of smoke issue from chimney stacks, and workers don the grim and gritty garb of the factories.
FIRST ARTISANS DRIFT IN

New Artisan arrivals add culture and sophistication to [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], exhibiting much-needed flair and flourish. Gauzy fabrics and perfume enswathe this troupe of motley individualists. See the special pull-out within entitled "Herding Cats."
FIRST ENGINEERS ENGAGED

First Engineers bring discovery to the city! Books, telescopes and chemicals under their arms, they arrive in uniformed rows, peering over spectacles at their new habitat. Their welcome rationality is sure to trigger a sharp upturn in efficiency and advancement.
FIRST INVESTORS BREEZE IN

First Investors arrive! Umbrellas tap on the pavement and capacious top hats devour hatstands – the elite are finally here! The markets are expected to see major growth in the coming weeks, with share prices already soaring. For a list of potential investments, see finance pp. 14-17.
NEW COMPANY TAKES ROOT!

[Participants Current Profile CompanyName] settles first island! Hopes abound that this seed will germinate into a great leafy tree, boughs heavy with golden fruit! In historic edition, we profile company pioneer, and enjoy the positivity – who knows if we shall see its like again!
COMPANY SETTLES IN TROPICS

[Participants Current Profile CompanyName] settles first island in the new world. Sticky financial climate at first, but refreshing cloudbursts forecast! Previously uninhabited island to act as initial HQ for overseas business in waters hitherto uncharted!
DARING EXPANSION!

[Participants Current Profile CompanyName] incorporates new territory in bold move! Hopes for splendid new settlement arise! Uninhabited island meets with humankind for the first time, as company brings this secluded idyll into the fold.
COMPETITOR SETTLES ISLAND

One of our competitors has settled a new island in the region, according to reports. It is hard to determine whether this will spur on our own enterprise, but at the least it serves as a reminder of the challenge for resources our people face.
ISLAND OF OPPORTUNITY?

Previously uncharted island found! The uninhabited spot is full of promise, say surveyors, who were among the first to wade up the beach this morning alongside excited cartographers, botanists and investors keen to sniff the place out.
FRIEND OR FOE?

New competitors appearing from beyond our borders have us brimming with anticipation. Will they be naughty, will they be nice? Will they bring us fish tails, bird eggs or mice? Our foreign correspondent digs up more juicy morsels concerning our new neighbours pp.17-18.
NEW TERRITORY DISCOVERED!

[Participants Current Profile CompanyName] has discovered a new region overseas, and is already going about the business of gathering the necessary resources to establish an outpost there. For those wishing to see the world, there has never been such a time as now - apply at once within!
NEW HAVEN!

[Participants Current Profile CompanyName] has discovered a new clutch of islands overseas; rumour has it they're considering investing substantial time and resources there. Keen to seek your fortune in faraway places? Speculative applications welcome!
NEW ARCHIPELAGO!

[Participants Current Profile CompanyName] has discovered a new clutch of islands overseas; rumour has it they're considering investing substantial time and resources there. Keen to seek your fortune in faraway places? Speculative applications welcome!
ANOTHER LEVEL!

[Participants Current Profile CompanyName] is soaring high, as recently published estimations rank our people more advanced than ever before. "I have faith our governor will sustain this exponential growth," declares monocle-wielder, "we leap like young salmon!"
RIVAL COMPANY STEPS UP
With recent key advance for our rival, we cast our eyes over the strengths and weaknesses of their company, asking whether they might pose a threat to us. Full and frank analysis, pages 3-5.
LEFT IN THE DUST!

Our rival is striding away! While we, like a spotty bottom, are eclipsed! Let us dwell on our inferiority, carefully inspect our failings, and wonder how we might possibly catch them back up before the great race is over!
TRADE VESSEL LEAVES DRY DOCK!

Worthy trade boat leaves [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] ready for maiden voyage! Capacious hold asking to be filled to brim with riches, which naturally will be shared among loyal populace!
WARSHIP LEAVES DRY DOCK!
Proud new warship [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] on first patrol! Brave crew wished luck by loved ones, and revelling in the romance of not knowing if they'll ever come back!
VAST FLEET CONSTRUCTED!
[Participants Current Profile CompanyName] spawns armada! For what purpose, we can only hazard a guess, but whether for naval victory or merchant profit, a larger fleet must always be better!
SHIP PRODUCTION SLOWS
A lack of manpower is holding back our shipbuilding! There are plenty of jobs to be done down at the dock, but no-one seems suitable or interested enough to take up these positions.
TRADE FLEET ASSEMBLED!

[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] spawns merchant navy! Trade will surely flourish, now this bright and colourful selection have been dispatched with their ample tonnages, perhaps to meet with new and exotic trade partners!
NAVAL ARMADA ASSEMBLED!

[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] spawns awe-inspiring naval armada! Of what noble victories and conquests may we now dream?! Let us rejoice, and blissfully ignore any possibility they may be used to serve unjust causes!
A REAL STEAMER!

First ever steam vessel christened for [Participants Current Profile CompanyName]! Never more shall bad winds addle our business, or put our navy off their stride! No! Steamed, stoked and screw-propellered ships shall surge us ever more into contention!
THE PROMISED LAND!

Settlers arrive in numbers to [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], its illustrious doors opening to reveal a shimmering utopia! Of course, if they lived here, they'd know not to expect that, but still, growth is good!
MURDEROUS EXODUS!

For masses desperately fleeing dastardly [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], life couldn't possibly be worse! That people would pack their worldly possessions and run only goes to show what dire straits the town finds itself in.
EARTHLY PARADISE!

We are as joyful as we can possibly be!' the hysterical people squeal, as they dance in the euphoric streets of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! If there is indeed a secret recipe for happiness, our fair city must contain all of the necessary ingredients!
HAPPINESS AND LIGHT

[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is quite full of mirth! "Eight and three-fifths from ten is how I score my present feeling," one resident remarked during recent census, "yet I am not completely delirious..."
PEOPLE JUST ABOUT CONTENT

[Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is a dull, occasionally satisfactory place to live, according to residents. Why is this town so run-of-the-mill, when it could be so very much more? We detail in full pp. 3-7 exactly what makes life here so bland...
UNHAPPY HOME!

Local hearts filled with woe in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Streets wet with tears, as residents weep for the neglect! "I still want to believe in this place," says one we met, "But the dream is dying!"
PEOPLE ARE FURIOUS!

Anger at living conditions in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Residents on verge of drastic action to end hardship! Our newspaper maintains responsibility to report the grievous situation of the people, though our livelihoods may suffer for it!
GENERAL MOOD IMPROVES!

Happier days return to [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Either people have learned to cope better, or indeed as this paper believes, living conditions have demonstrably improved in recent times. More grounds for domestic optimism pp. 5 and 6.
GENERAL MOOD DETERIORATES!

Mood slumps in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] as reality of living conditions hit home. Something must be done to recover this city to its former glory! With the assistance of local residents, we have compiled a long list of the most urgent improvements...
STILL NO MARKET!

The lack of fresh produce available in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is thoroughly depressing! When will the city council see sense and provide the people the variety and bounty of a proper market?
FISH SHORTAGE!

Scarcity of fish in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to shameful mismanagement, leaves town in a flap. Many will have a bone to pick with the governor, unless net quantities soon improve.
SCHNAPPS SHORTAGE!

Scarcity of Schnapps in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to shameful mismanagement, means very essence of society may soon evaporate! Locals not sure where to turn after bottle taken away!
LACK OF DECENT CLOTHING!

Scarcity of Basic Clothes in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to shameful mismanagement, means very fabric of society may soon disintegrate! Many left with nothing to wear in the week, let alone Sunday best!
STILL NO PUB!

Lack of pub in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is a jolly poor show. If there's one thing that could bring this disparate community together, it is ale, a roaring fire, and a trio of fiddlers!
WURST CASE SCENARIO!

Scarcity of sausage in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to shameful mismanagement leaves locals feeling raw. Worries salivating carnivores may start eyeing each other for the butcher's slab!
BREAD SHORTAGE!

Scarcity of bread in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to half-baked management means society may collapse in on itself. We're yet to see a single crumb of evidence in respect to a solution...
GODLESS PLACE!

With no church in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], gossip grows elsewhere that the town is cauldron of devil worship. Of course nothing could be further from the truth! But while there is no church, we shall continue to be branded with the hoof.
THE GREAT UNWASHED!

Scarcity of soap in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to shameful mismanagement leaves locals smelling appalling! The merest smidge of lavender and camphor would be enough for us to unclasp the clothes pegs from our probosces!
UTTERLY HOPLESS!
Scarcity of beer in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to shameful mismanagement means soul of society is draining away!
A TOWN OF DUNCES!

Lack of a school in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] means locals are really thick. We can but hope some sentience may emerge from this pool of ignorance, and put things to right by building one.
CANNED FOOD SHORTAGE!
Scarcity of canned food in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] due to tin-pot mismanagement leaves society feeling crushed.
SEWING MACHINES RUN OUT!
Scarcity of sewing machines in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] has town in a tangle! Settlement hoping the loose ends will be tied up soon.
LACK OF VARIETY!
Still no Variety Theatre in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Local poets spew bitter verse attacking the powers-that-be who would deny them even the smallest of freedoms.
RUM SHORTAGE!

Shortage of rum in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] very rum indeed! Rocky patch for rum sees locals fall from hammocks, and grey clouds fill in the sky. We petition governor to bring the sunshine back!
FUR COAT SHORTAGE!
Fur coats go missing in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Animal retaliation theory disproven, as town council shoulders all responsibility.
LACK OF UNIVERSITY SMARTS

Absence of University in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] makes town "provincial backwater", say scholars hoping to be institutionalised. "Without it, none of us will ever amount to anything!"
SPECTACLES!
No sign of Spectacles in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Locals want transparency with regard to the recent shortages, mystified by town's lack of vision.
PENNY FARTHINGS RUN OUT!
Penny Farthings disappear in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as last few models cycle out of stock. We ask why no-one is stepping up to steer things back in the right direction.
COFFEE SHORTAGE!

What sane working person can be expected to work without coffee? Is the question we put to [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] local council, in the hope they will grind out a solution.
POCKET WATCHES RUN OUT!
Shortage of Pocket Watches in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] damaging efficiency! With time ticking on, officials are under pressure to solve the matter post-haste!
POWER CUTS!
Lack of Electricity supply throttling [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] production! Authorities charged with ensuring supply resumes quick as a flash.
LIGHT BULB SHORTAGE!
Lifespan of Light Bulbs questioned in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as supplies run low. People hoping local council will have some bright ideas for a change.
TOWN STILL HAS NO BANK!
Continuing lack of Bank in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] has moneymen drawing on new reserves of patience, as cash spills out of bedsprings everywhere.
CHAMPAGNE RUNS DRY!
Champagne shortage in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] takes the fizz out of life. Trust in authorities put on ice, as supply continues to falter.
CIGARS STUBBED OUT!
Shortage of Cigars in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is nothing but a headache for wealthy investors hoping to get their circulation back.
WHAT ABOUT MY MEMBERSHIP?!

Lack of a decent Members Club in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] disappoints work hard, play hard crowd, who want somewhere to crash when the financial markets do. Ties and cufflinks expected in the post pronto, or there'll be trouble!
CHOCOLATE GOBBLED UP!

Chocolate shortage in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] sends place into meltdown. Grandfathers disappoint grandchildren by hoarding it all to themselves, and licorice substitutes failing to meet with same degree of enthusiasm.
QUALITY JEWELLERY SHORTAGE

Absence of Jewellery in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is destroying the status of the town, wealthy residents are complaining. "For lack of alternatives, I have been forced to wear family heirlooms on stage," sighed local diva.
MUSIC FADING OUT!

Gramophone shortage in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] as machines prove too popular. "Music shouldn't be this popular," rants frustrated snob, "Only those who truly know how to listen should be allowed them!"
STEAM CARRIAGE SHORTAGE!

Shortage of Steam Carriages in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is driving everybody quite mad! Authorities need to get a grip on the wheel soon, or stymied local motorists may combust!
FRIED PLANTAIN SHORTAGE
Fried Plantains run out in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. Cross local remarks "If I don't get my plantains fried in fish oil, I don't know what I'll do!"
PAUCITY OF PONCHOS!

Scarcity of Ponchos in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] leaves hill-dwelling locals envious of smug Alpaca. Outrage over missing supply means there is little in the way of warm fuzzy feelings.
TORTILLAS RUN OUT!

Tortillas extremely thin on the ground in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], leaving city feeling flat. "They better scoop us out of this soon, or the whole thing will leave a very bad taste in the mouth."
LACK OF PUNCH
Still no Boxing Ring in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Worries locals may start unregulated fight club of their own if no official venue is organised soon.
BOMBINS RUN OUT!

Scarcity of Bombins in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] highly unprofessional! "Without comfortable headwear we are lost!" says sartorial snob, his shining bald patch exposed to the elements.
BANKRUPTCY!?

[Participants Current Profile CompanyName] is in the red, and it can only be 'a matter of time before the bailiffs come' to reclaim furniture and wallpaper! This will mean the end if this disastrous venture is not turned around soon!
FINANCIAL POWERHOUSE

As positive credit balance hastens era of untold prosperity, [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] said to have Midas touch! Yes, that didn't end too well for poor old Midas, but let's not dwell on the negatives!
A POSITIVE ACCOUNT

Income is no longer in the negative for [Participants Current Profile CompanyName] according to financial analysis. "We're headed back in the right direction at least!" concedes backer, forced to come down off high horse.
BACK FROM THE RED!

[Participants Current Profile CompanyName] bounces back from bankruptcy! Accounts no longer overdrawn! "A miraculous turnaround!" prate fickle and useless advisors that likely precipitated the crisis in the first place.
STONY BROKE!

[Participants Current Profile CompanyName] plagued by prospect of bankruptcy! Accounts overdrawn! "A miraculous turnaround" required, according to fickle and useless advisors that likely precipitated the crisis in the first place.
WE ARE RICH!

We're really raking in the money, according to our small-fingered coin counters! Or rather, our proud company management is. Always a chance they may spend it on you, though, if you smile and congratulate them. Trust me, I know...
HELL'S ETERNAL SLAVES!

Brutally driven from dawn 'til dusk, the tyrannised population of [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] suffer like the yoked beasts of Lucifer. City cries out for someone to rise up and put an end to its medieval overlords!
FARMERS EXPLOITED!

Dreadful working conditions persist for farmers of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have remained chained to the grindstone for this underhanded and unprincipled state, it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!
WORKERS EXPLOITED!

Dreadful working conditions persist for workers of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have held their faces to the furnace for this underhanded and unprincipled state, it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!
ARTISANS EXPLOITED!

Dreadful working conditions persist for artisans of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have remained chained to their trestles for this underhanded and unprincipled state, it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!
ENGINEERS EXPLOITED!

Dreadful working conditions persist for engineers of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have remained fused to their flasks for this underhanded and unprincipled state, it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!
JORNALEROS EXPLOITED

Dreadful working conditions persist for jornaleros of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have run themselves into the ground for this underhanded and unprincipled state, it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!
OBREROS EXPLOITED

Dreadful working conditions persist for obreros of [Participants Current Profile CompanyName], who have had to work their hands to dust for this underhanded and unprincipled state, it seems, forever and a day. We can only hope change will come, and soon! Sign the petition!
ETHICAL BUSINESS

With many on generous working terms in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], liberals and employess alike heap praise upon altruistic visionaries in charge of this most progressive city.
FARM LABOUR SHORTAGE

Lack of farmers in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] mean problems for local produce. "We need all the help we can get if the harvest is not to be a disaster," says one disgruntled local, left in the lurch.
FACTORY WORKER SHORTFALL

Lack of able workers causing problems for industry in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. "I told the guv, I don't have the experience to work in this section alone," said one chagrined employee, wishing to remain anonymous.
LACK OF ARTISANSHIP

Too few Artisans in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] means local craft will suffer. "When I said I enjoyed the isolation, I didn't imagine being forever alone..." weeps beleaguered local dandy, hand upon brow.
SHORTAGE OF RELIABLE ENGINEERS

Not enough Engineers in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] to keep city in good working order, says survey. "It's terrible, the lack of investment in further research," pencil-chewing curiosity remarks. More bad science, pp. 19-20.
TOO FEW INVESTORS!

A lack of investment in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is extremely damaging for the local economy, financial report shows. "It's a damned farce," was the only comment we could extract from those who had already given their backing in the region.
JORNALEROS TOO FEW

Jornaleros workforce dwindles in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], with even the old guard admitting they need some fresh blood. "Alpaca will not do all this work, she'll give up, run back to the foothills," fears overburdened local.
SHORTAGE OF OBREROS

Obreros are too few in number to keep their visioon of the future alive in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. "This place, is too much in the past. When will we grow and move on?" says earnest and principled resident.
EAGER FIRST VISITORS ARRIVE!
