Put a coin in and see what comes out? Non, you'll get no change from me.
Might as well give up? We don't have to listen to this.
Mock all you want, but we will come through this a free people.
A coward?! Now I'm insulted.
There's only one side I'm fighting for; the one my wife and child are on.
I don't know if I'm a good father, but she and mama are safe, that's what's important.
I pride myself on that good grace, no matter the...circumstances.
A good sport? I am always that - lucky for you!
A champion of civil rights? I hope so, I hope so.
You could be the joker in this pack.
When it's down to me and you, let's not fight!
I don't need a quarrel with you.
If I had to back a cockerel, it might be you.
We don't have to live at odds.
I'm not going to say I trust you.
Do I really have conviction in you?
Something about you still gives my people hope.
Dealing with you could be a lottery.
Little fish are careful who they swim with.
Don't trust me?! It's the other way around.
I have to think what's best for us.
I have you down as a worry.
We like to think independently.
I better watch what I say.
Experience can teach a person a lot.
There are not many I can call friends.
If we people of principle don't support each other…
Hypocrisy is the only language the privileged speak.
Are you done kissing their feet?
Do you need a lesson in manners from a pirate?
Well, that was rude.
I bet that will sting for days.
Wish I could have seen their face.
Hey, I'll play the trickster around here…
At least try to keep your cards close to your chest!
Now that is a very clever thing indeed!
Please, don't let me stop you!
Sorry but we're desperate.
My rules now.
Let's play dice.
It's easier if you don’t fight!
My people need this.
So, it's come to this.
I will protect my family.
You didn't have to do this.
We've survived worse.
Why us?
Someone had to take the fall.
Could have been anyone...
Your luck's not in.
Not the first gamble that didn't pay.
They are good swimmers.
It was worth a shot!
It was begging to be knocked down.
Can you blame me?
You have to learn to manage your anger!
Come on, that's an inanimate object!
I'm sorry it had to be this way, but fish have to eat if they want to avoid being eaten.
A tragic loss…
They will be missed…
You shield us like a cloak.
You've shaken off quite a hindrance.
Got to keep your options open.
Everybody needs some kind of protection.
We all have something to preserve.
Please - you have a duty to your people.
Raising the stakes, eh?
I see your cards, and you don't have much.
You think I'm worried?
I thought you were above that.
Our whole plan depends on you still being with us.
Will you protect me and my family as you said you would?
We are at war with your ally, let us see your true colours.
Of course friend, whatever you need.
It is a big risk for us, but oui, we will fight for you.
They take up arms for the freedom of their colour.
They pray morning and evening this war will end.
We desire only to defend these properties and the families that inhabit them.
You found one ship, but others are on the move.
War is bad for you, we have allies everywhere.
They'll lay down arms the moment you make a fair peace offer.
We'll only come back stronger.
As old dreams die, new ones take shape.
Don't worry, we'll hide out as long as we need to.
This time, I'm going to get in with the right people.
We've rebuilt before, we can do it again.
The past is the past, the future is ours to protect.
I wouldn't let anyone treat me like that.
You won't keep them down forever.
George supported me, so I support him!
Make him suffer as he made my people suffer.
George is an ally you can rely on.
If you support Silva, you support La Corona.
I can recognise a cruel master.
You do what you have to, to protect your own.
Believe me, I share Isabel's cause, but I already have enough trouble with the Empire.
I beg you, I don't want to live in a world of Pyrphorians. Make them go away.
Phew! That's one less threat to our survival that I have to take care of!
Please— we'll take any help we can get.
Your chance to fight for something worth fighting for.
These people, they need a hero.
Bring us the horizon, where the fire of freedom rises.
We're always looking to those we can trust.
We're counting on you.
Tell no-one.
Go, I trust you.
Without you, I don't know what we would have done.
One step closer to freedom.
You make it look easy!
You have done a beautiful thing this day.
Your brave actions may just have saved us.
Tell me, did they get to you?
Any way the wind blows, eh? We will be better without you.
The hopes of a generation, crushed.
Do you mean to sabotage us?
Not all will last in the struggle.
Do not turn your back on this fight!
There is a time for waiting, it is not now!
Do it now, while the moon lights the river.
This struggle, it is never over.
Still with us?
Freedom is so close, help us push through.
It is in all of us to support the underdog.
Don't be a fool, listen to your heart.
Tell me it's good news?
Did it go as planned?
Every second counts.
What I have would take too long to explain…
I must plan our next move.
Better keep our heads down for a while.
Ride with us, be ready.
Look after my people, they are all I have.
We must protect the vulnerable who cross the seas.
So, you found us. Take a look around. What can the henchmen of the Empire do to us that the Pyrphorians haven't already?
Goode? The man that sold Her Majesty's precious island to me? He is just as guilty as I am!
So you are calling me a liar? Love is blind. Back before they left their fiery mark, the Pyrphorians told me your father would come— to sell me Prosperity.
I knew conspiring against the Empire was a bad idea. Afterwards, when I refused to work with the Pyrphorians, they came to teach us a lesson.
Now our movement drills their oil for nothing, night and day. We have lost the strength to fight.
Still we are afraid. And even though we buried the dead and found a hideaway, I cannot provide shelter for all of them.

So you won't let go? Then let's get to business. Help me shelter and protect the good people that are part of this movement. If I see you can be trusted, I will find you the contract that sealed the deal on Prosperity. Are you in?
Then we too were betrayed. We will leave Prosperity immediately, your Majesty.
They are more than a nuisance! And they will never accept this. You must be careful!
Build us a haven on La Isla, and we can talk about getting you that contract.
We will help you. But first you have to help us.
The Pyrphorians would only exploit us if we tried to resettle ourselves. But with an island under your flag…
This place is more than good enough for us. We are used to living on very little.
They are mostly just civilians, hoping for somewhere they can feel safe.
This can be our fortress. A beautiful garden away from terrible things. We must protect it.
Once this is over I promise to repay you. Right now, I care about my people's safety!
We must be ready for the Pyrphorians if they come.
You could make the resistance yet! We are grateful to have such security now.
You're doing amazing work. Together we will fight them with everything we have!
Now you can focus on La Isla. Securing the future of men, women, and children!
Prosperity has been nothing but trouble for us. Go see for yourself.
My followers on that island are living in fear!
The persecuted, the diaspora, flock to La Isla. We must shelter them.
We need to be able to hold out should the Pyrphorians strike. Anything you can provide will help.
I feel bad for asking. But these people come here pockets empty.
This place, La Isla, can be a fortress of salvation to these people.
I didn't know if I could trust you. But you have given these people hope, and a future.
We must get the people what they need, before the Pyrphorians can break our supply lines.
Your father was guilty. I was with him when he signed the contract.
I wouldn't be surprised if the Pyrphorians pressured your father too.
The Pyrphorians took Prosperity from us the moment that deal was signed.
Helping you is too risky right now. My people need shelter from the Pyrphorian menace.
We had no choice. The Pyrphorians coerced us into buying Prosperity from your father.
Prosperity is so rich in natural resources. No wonder it is the source of all this conflict.
We want to forge something new, break away from the old.
I trust your Empire no more than the Pyrphorians. We are just pawns in their game.
Break free of La Corona, only to land in the lap of these Pyrphorian devils.
They will torch the whole city, if you try to meddle. I suggest setting up routine patrols!
Then the fires begin. It is their warning. You must find these masks who walk with the devil!
The scars the fire leaves behind do not heal fast.
We need a dedicated team to police the arsonists.
I don't think your sister likes me. But I have to keep fighting for what I believe in.
With your patrols, we can catch the arsonists in the act.
Catch the Pyrphorian arsonists!
It is these arsonists’ turn to be afraid!
The Pyrphorians work the weak to collapse. La Isla is their only hope of recovery.
Have sympathy for the many who are sick. Exhausted from the mines and the oil pumps.
There are many who struggle even to walk, cruelly made to work.
This is becoming a crisis. I worry the sick will die if we do not give them beds and clean linen.
Their homes were taken from them. Help them dream again.
First La Corona, now the Pyrphorians. If we come through this with our lives, we'll be lucky.
Take the sick and the weak from Prosperity to La Isla. Save them from a life of exploitation.
I cannot watch my people struggling under the Pyrphorian yoke.
We cannot rely on the old guard, they have given so much of their lives already.
This shall be the moment our movement truly begins! New ideas, new energy!
The young ones dream of something better. Better homes and a better life.
Without somewhere to call home, it is over for them.
These refugees, they have nowhere else to go.
You have to learn to make what friends you can out here.
I hate knowing the Empire or La Corona could just come here and crush us.
I'm sure your Queen wants to go charging in like a bull in a china shop. But good people still live on Prosperity.
I don't plan to leave anyone behind.
Keep the people moving. Now is not the time to stop and think.
All of us sticking together. That is the best chance we have of defending ourselves.
Even a modest fleet would give us independence.
It is not on land, but on water where we are vulnerable.
Wow this ship is so beautiful!
We shall name her after my brother, and pin a lock of his hair to the mast.
Pyrphorian ships approach. I have never dealt with them face-to-face. What can they want?
It is started—there's no going back. The Pyrphorians never give up.
Everything we produce here, the Pyrphorians take.
After the Pyrphorians come for the tithe, there is nothing left for us.
The cat is out of the bag. Now they know you are involved.
The Pyrphorian attack frightens them. Please, there must be room!
My island too must be evacuated, it is no longer safe there.
Many of my best were kidnapped. We have no hope of surviving without them.
What if these people grow sick? They're going to need a hospital!
My people's future is secure. They have you to thank for this.
The contract… it is gone! The Pyrphorians must have stolen it during the attack. How did I fall for such a simple diversion!?
You are going to have to inflitrate the Pyrphorians if you want to find that contract. I'm sorry.
You beat the Pyrphorians at their own game!
If you can convince the Queen to listen, we can explain to her.
I would give you that stupid island, if only I had the contract to tear to pieces.
We cannot thank you enough for preventing this war.
With that contract, we are taking the Pyrphorians down from the inside.
Prosperity is yours, take it! We have a new home now.
Near Prosperity, the Pyrphorians would kill us on sight.
At first I thought you were a spy of the Queen. Now I know your heart is in the right place.
I can tell you where the contract is. After that it's down to you.
Stay hidden, and you will succeed.
The man I met was your Uncle? I thought he was a creep!
I am sorry you had to go through all this just to have justice.
Of course I will be a witness. After all you've done for us.
With Prosperity off our hands, the Pyrphorians will leave us alone.
Let me help you. I know I can make a difference.
I will tell them everything I know.
I don't need to take an oath to speak the truth.
I hope as witness, I can prove the Pyrphorians were behind this deal, not us.
I was certain it was your father that day, but now I know was wrong.
Your majesty. Isabel Sarmento, at your service.
We fight with you, no matter what.
We can help you, just give us the sign.
Exploit their supply lines! Small operations can have big rewards!
Sabotage their supply lines! They rely on them as much as we do.
There is no dent in their supply! We missed an opportunity!
Ha, you did it! Without their precious fire they are nothing!
You broke the chain! Now we are really somewhere.
I never thought I would take the Empire's side!
The Queen has promised to recognise our independence.
I like Sir Archibald, he is a funny man.
Of course we will take a stand beside you, if you are for freedom and justice!
Now is the time for choosing sides. Just or unjust.
We join on one condition, that like you we are free to write our own history.
We can build on this.
It is good news.
Let's take nothing for granted.
This is progress at least.
We are all the stronger for this.
A small win, but we'll take it.
A flicker of hope.
Champion of the underdog!
I wanted to believe you'd come through.
It takes courage to make a stand.
I was right to trust you.
Your heart is in the right place.
You have achieved a lot.
May there be more good news from you.
It is only a setback.
We will come back stronger.
Nothing we aren't ready for.
We can't give up.
This cannot be allowed to harm our plans.
We can find a way around this.
We've seen worse.
You should have more faith.
Are you crazy?
I thought we had trust.
You will expose us.
I don't want to cut ties with you.
Ask youself, whose side are you on?
Don't burn all your bridges.
I am Isabel Sarmento and I will see my country freed. Are you with me or against me?
I am Isabel Sarmento. Do not stand between me and my country's freedom!
You are sure you weren't followed?
Good to see a friendly face in these times.
You are here to help?
We're running low on everything, as usual.
We search all our visitors - a necessary precaution.
We would welcome more volunteers.
Ready to evacuate at a moment's notice.
This is where liberation starts.
We make do with what we have.
I hope they'll remember this as the birthplace of a revolution.
This is our new home now, we should be happy for that.
We've got to be agile, ready to move at the drop of a hat.
We can load up in a day, and be gone in a night.
It's hard to get ships. We are lucky to have friends to help us.
We never sink a ship if we can take it.
We won't forget this.
I am so happy someone could help us.
Words can't express how grateful we are.
We could use a distraction.
We can make it work.
It is a risk worth taking.
I'll join them again in the fields... my brothers and sisters, once we have set this land free.
I was young when I joined the movement, I never imagined I would one day be giving the orders.
This is not about revenge, but securing our people a future free of La Corona. We have to stick together.
My brother fought back violently against La Corona. He was murdered. We have to try another way.
If we strike against La Corona, we have to make it count!
Jean is reckless like my brother was. I don't blame him. He is only trying to survive, to protect the ones he loves.
Let Admiral Silva cling to his dying dream, we hear the little birds of freedom sing!
La Corona may be our enemy, not the Queen, but to trust empire for us is impossible.
If Anne Harlow could forget the past, we could build a better future together.
Alonso is a powder keg. He threatens to destroy the delicate balance we've worked so hard for.
Madame Kahina is the best. Quick, clean, and never draws attention. How does she do it?
George dances well for an invalid, we all need to cut free sometimes.
In future, keep your flagship intact, resources are scarce.
There must be a better way.
There is no time for this.
This will not help our struggle.
I've uncovered a meaty opportunity.
You steam ahead, go on, mate.
Something fer you to fiddle with.
Shine yer blow lamp on this would'yer?
If you don't exploit this, some other bird will.
Look at you go.
Go then, I got stuff to do.
That's it, gimme some peace.
Fixed that up good, didn't yer.
Nice juicy little oyster that is.
Faster than the electric telegraph.
Lickety-spit, you've come back quick.
Corrr yeah, just how I likes it.
Didn't take you for a Janus-face, fair play to yer.
You've left the whole thing a ruddy jumble!
Well that's the nail in the coffin.
Luddite!
Steaming pile full o' nothin'.
Hurry or the flies'll start laying.
What about my job?
Sit on a firework would yer?
Got another lamp needs lighting n'all.
Sputter on little engine, I'll keep you greased.
Wonderful, but I've got another turkey for you to pluck.
Bit of a wrench, eh?
Old Nate can make double-cross worth your while.
Tied up the scrag ends?
Cobbled somethin' together?
Dug up more than bones?
Want more? There is no more!
Lean pickings at the moment.
Not even a morsel for yer.
Pumping pistons!
No flies on me.
I'm over the moon.
I'm lighter than air.
I'd be blown away, if not for me ropes…
Whizbang!
Soaring like a buzzard.
You're flying!
Self-propelled, I see.
You make silk purses from sow's ears.
Sift and you will find.
You've got a spark.
Something always drops from the pipe with you.
You're dynamite!
Rubbish!
Fly-blown frass!
It unhinges me!
Soiled my day.
Bahhh!
Hollow piles o' dung.
I haven't time for this!
You're cranking my crank.
Don't ratchet me temper!
I'll 'ave yer bones!
I've a bone to pick with you.
Yer damp and dirty drape.
Yer smudge-pot.
Oily little toerag.
Let me wipe me hand yer eminence. Turkey grease, see.
You made a lucky find! I'm a go-to for scrags and cut-offs, knick-knacks and gravy.
Is it rag or is it bone you're wantin'?
Bear-skin, dog-skin, cat-skin.
Eh? I'm trying to keep a low profile.
I've a wealth o' parts, real odds and ends.
You've got me by the Diri-giblets, whaddya want?
You wouldn't be after a mountain of lint would ya?
What's that I can smell on you, pickled eggs?
Should hold together for a time.
Soldiers had no use for the iron, all frozen such as they were.
I scratched and scraped for this.
I always dreamed of a little shack to call my own.
She used to be a wreck, but you'd never guess.
I put a lot o' graft into fixing her up.
The bow's made o' hodgepodge.
Made of sterner stuff— like boiled hooves.
How touching.
I'm a grateful sackful.
Tinker very much.
I'm in.
Could be worse I s'pose.
Then what we waitin' for, let's get stuck in.
Semaphore stations'll soon be disused - there's a tip for old iron.
Found an egg with a palace in it. Fixed the hinge and stuck it on the bow of my lady blimp.
Zeppelins'll take off, you'll see. Soon they'll all want a piece of my lady blimp.
Turn a greasy hat inside out, and it looks to 'ave been oiled purposely!
Coffins make nice boats. But make sure the lid doesn't shut on you.
Isabel's people are resistors, fighting for their Ohms.
I could use George Smith's bath chair, once he's gone. Can't be long now can it?
Archibald Blake commissioned the Queen a balloon, then he realised it was all a lot of hot air.
The Queen may have snatched every last bit of land and sea, but I have the skies to meself.
Alonso's good to follow at a distance; for all the leftovers.
That windsock Willie still complaining? The lad doesn't know his luck.
Don't dabble with Kahina, she's a lethal businesswoman.
I offered Bente a place on my balloon, but she guffawed and called it cheating!
That fell into place.
Bit fer you, chunk for me.
A few sundries.
Some nice little slivers in there.
Something for nothing!
We hammered something out.
I'm an impulsive shopper myself.
I won't be manipulated.
What's in it for me?
Gorr, take me for an idiot?
Well, it's time for me to move on. Until we meet again!
You're going to need your best ship and crew, only for it to sink to the icy bottom! Hehehe.
Terrible waste of human life of course, but don't let that stop you.
And be sure to prepare for the final curtain while you're at it.
You really do have quite the desire to depart don't ya? Well it's your funeral.
Never mind, eh! At least you won't die a block of ice.
Seems a long way to go to die, but you look ready for it.
Take your time, won't make a difference to Sir John.
Congratulations! You crossed seven seas for a wasteland!
Couldn't even shoot yerself in the foot? Well I feel sorry for ya.
The whole expedition's a failure. But we all know that teamwork drivel's a myth.
See— never worth getting mixed up in other people's business.
What a waste of time! Just goes to show, you can't rely on others.
There's nothing up there but the ruddy cold.
Hoping this will keep your head above water? Not Arctic water it won't.
Dunno why you're so desperate for your eyeballs to freeze.
At best we'll be pulling stiffs out the ice like teeth.
Like frostbite do ya? Botulism? Scurvy? Got that all to look forward to.
The Arctic's no more than a mariner's graveyard. Ooh, hang fire...
As we're here, we might ask the Inuits if they chanced upon any lost property...
The equipment won't have decomposed like the cadavers.
We've a responsibility to Sir John to gather up his valuables.
Hard to feel the cold when you see a glint, ain't it? Hehe.
Found nothing but emptiness, why isn't I surprised?
The deeper we go, the more likely we find something really juicy.
You want an Icebreaker, so we can get to the fancy stuff.
Never know what you'll find inside, if you don't crack things open.
Now we can finally see if Sir John bequeaths us summat shiny.
You need to grow yourself some tusks, my walrus-friend, or we'll never snag the goodies.
What d'you wanna help those old duffers for? Unless...you've sniffed summat out?
I've heard the Arctic Council ships are plushly furnished.
Shame they had to still be alive and we couldn't just help ourselves.
As long as their pocket watches still tick we should try afresh.
Never should o' come here, why do you think they call it a wasteland?
Looks like we'll have to dig up Sir John Faithful's army o' the dead another day.
Shame we couldn't find 'em, I was looking forward to expanding my collection of brass buttons.
Lady Faithful hopes to resurrect her marriage, but Sir John's got cold feet, hehehe.
Ice might even have helped preserve the merchandise.
I think we all know where Sir John Faithful is now, don't we? He's dead.
I know her old man’s long dead, but his lavish instruments won’t be, eh?
Don't be afraid to see the frozen look as you frisk their corpses, you’ll get used to it.
You can see a body a mile off out here, nice and exposed.
Knowing those old toffs, they'd probably skin each other before they'd skin a seal.
I 'spect there's a few nice bits and bobs suspended about the place.
Can't always wait til things are dead y'know...
No-one'll notice the odd body. If they're well-preserved, we could sell 'em for dissection.
Can't believe how much an Inuit'll give ya for a tarnished spoon, hehe.
I'd have come before, if I'd known how easy it is to fleece the locals.
If you're looking for the Hades and Styx, you're going in the right direction, hehe.
We can really milk this predicament for all it's got, as long as we're quiet.
Two years in a blizzard probably doesn't do your skin much good, does it?
Now, we don't want to look like we're only in it for the proceeds.
Now we're onto something. Let's hope for a shipwreck!
I hope those ships are stuck fast in the ice, free for the taking!
Ain't you wondering what's left of them ships?
Blimey, by foot!? This all looks very grim all of a sudden, doesn't it?!
Afraid? Never seen a real corpse?
If Lady Faithful thinks they're still alive let's humour the poor woman's delusion shall we?
Let's get to the bottom of this mystery, and what's become of 'em.
You'd think you'd seen a ghost, what's frozen yer?
Some of them live?! Brings a tear to an old man's eye.
Why d'you have to fade away before the final payoff!
Heavens what a name, no wonder their luck, eh?
You seem drawn to death, that's why I stick to you like fishglue.
This place is more indifferent to humankind than I am.
Cast your eyes about for any tidbits in the snow.
Lady Faithful's bewitched, she won't notice if we shuffle off for a bit.
A place so curious must have its curiosities…
What's all this endeavour of yours for?
A lot of furry animals out here.
These Inuit geezers are a help though, ain't they?
There are times even I give the dead their due.
Nothing but bone.
A sight to chill even someone as soulless as myself.
I think we could all use a tot of hot brandy.
Even I'd start to miss the sight of other beings out here.
We've come to a place of solitude.
I can't bear to watch you do this to yourself.
I thought you would end icebound too, but for your icebreaker.
You can count on that, heheh! The noble old dame belongs to one of the most prosperous families there is.
Most likely all those poor mugs indulging her husband are drowned or chewing on their own bones, but like I said, where that much lucre's rolling in, I'll never be far behind! How's about you?
Yeah, go on and help the old dame send even more ships to be lost in the nothingness. Looks like you finally found your captain Ahab.
Meanwhile, I will set up me own little camp nearby. Just in case you need anything, Ishmael!
So you're off to the icy marrow with the old dame, brrr. Don't get lost will yer, guv? You're me best customer!
All those ships transmuting into ghosts. And then... silence.
There you are. I thought you may have begun without me.
But… I’m Old Nate! don’t you recognise me?
Don’t do this to me! You know how I love musicals.

I know, / a lowly intern painted me / And he was badly paid / I know / I have no proper face / And now I look like a disgrace / I know / A lowly intern cobbled me / The team just stood and laughed. / I know / for colour there’s no money in the purse / And the midday sun / ensures I look ten times worse
Please say, that i am “in”. / My heart it breaks in twain. / And If, I cannot sing, woe! / What will I do then, oh? / Come now, shake my hand!
Yeah / I saw the whole thing coming / Now it’s time for me to go. / Dear mother she was a sketching book / And even she loathes how I look
Why not share some of my daily hell with you...
What I wouldn't give to get out of my shuttered bureau.
Guilty until you prove yourself innocent.
Think of it as 'hard evidence' of your character.
I hereby sentence you to not-very-hard labour.
See you on the other side.
A tiny crack of light.
You're getting off lightly.
It all looks in order.
Case closed.
Justice served.
Back on the straight and narrow.
So, a law-abider!
How do you manage to wriggle out of it?
You broke the key off in the lock!
The scales of justice don't balance themselves!
The jury are very much out on you!
You will be held accountable!
If I must be a good citizen, so must you.
You can't escape duty, believe me we've all tried.
I know where you live.
You're a link in a clanking chain of events...
Oh there's no end of work at Her Majesty's pleasure...
Are you a glutton for punishment?
Don't let them corrupt you too.
This is a matter of sovereign law!
Have your investigations been fruitful?
Ready to bail me out?
Coming clean?
As quiet now as it'll ever be.
No shortage of crims, just a shortage of leads.
I don't have anything straightforward.
Keep an eye to the horizon for miscreants.

Another came before you, bearing pineapples. But he enjoyed them more than I did.
Deserter?! Humanity is a desert. A clutch of hollow skulls between the dunes of entropy.
That was before my metamorphosis - a name dead to me!
Did I ever tell you about the time I turned a man inside-out?
Please, that is a word I don't like. I beg you, call us pigs.
Your words make me wonder, are you the one the omens said would come?
Not all my mites are so fervent. I will keep a wedge of flesh back for you.
How enlightened, at least as much as pigcrap humans can be.
That does sound like my work...and lice you say? Just wonderful.
I feel the skeleton of something good.
You don't need to be an insect like the others.
Your horizon is darkness. That's good.
I augur good things for you.
Imagine, we could be fine friends someday.
I have you down as a listener.
I don't know if I'd chop you up, rightaway.
I see myself in you, really I do.
You are not the chosen one.
When I think of you, I think drudgery.
You will always be a perishing wallflower.
I do not see outrage in you.
The locusts, whenever they speak of you, sound sad.
It's not me, it's you.
Too human.
You will never escape yourself.
Isn't friendship great?
We are getting along so well!
It makes me angry, watching you two frolic.
What you are doing with them hurts me.
It's damaging us both.
Cut them out, and I cut you out.
Why not, let's skin them together!
Yes, bad people! Naughty people!
Will I tell them I've seen you lurking?
I make friends so as to kill them, don't you slither in!
I like your furtiveness!
A snake? I go for the jugular myself.
You've built up a head of steam. Shall I vent it?
You're in bloom. Where are my secateurs…
Heads above the parapet get lopped.
You defile land special to me.
Trespassers in the sacred lands must be eaten.
Don't stretch yourself too thin.
Your sty is growing, pigcrap.
Man can't grow forever, it has to stop!
I'll gently harvest the wheatfields of your soul.
Greed, pure greed; it has a vice-like grip.
Funny how a few flaxen discs confer such absurd power.
I will feast upon this body of land…
It will be a nice new playground…
While you barter for a strip of my skin, I'm out in the woods looking for a rug.
Money is soaked in bloody fingerprints, remember that.
La Corona tried to buy me out. I burst their bubble.
If you eat it from the inside out, I may reciprocate.
That island is very precious to me.
Pigcrap let me have the island, believes anything I say.
With your blessing, anything I do here will feel legitimate now.
Settling like a butterfly? I have a great passion for lepidoptera.
Sad to see the place go. So many happy memories.
All I made upon that island removed. Admirable conviction.
Cleansed all trace of me? You are made in my own image.
All trace of me expunged from your island, how liberating.
I crush you like velvet.
I caress destruction.
Satisfy my thirst.
Humans are so ugly!
Fire and brimstone!
Your violence sustains me!
Hurt me, I deserve it.
Feed me!
Balm me with your animus.
Nourish me!
Drowning is always a favourite.
Like Atlantis, sunk to the deep.
Kneel before Poseidon.
You animal!
Yes, drown my pathetic sailors!
It's a mercy for them, the incompetents.
Let's watch it crumble together!
I sweep it away like gingerbread!
Yes, give in to your thirst for destruction!
Destroy! You were born to destroy!
It's for the best. Your island was going nowhere.
Your island is free now.
What brutality, if I may say so.
Take it, you've earned it. I'll get you back later.
Look into my eyes. I want to see the light fade before I harvest your husk.
Regrets? I wish I had done more cooking; I always had the temperament of a chef.
Killing my ally cannot hurt me, no.
I have no need of friends. Kill them.
I would like to see the body, if it is still all in one place.
I almost regret seeing the bad ones find release.
What is life without death?
Let fury engulf your mortal vessel!
Let terror lead you to deliverance.
Unshackle your mind, and swing its chains.
Don't fight, it's pointless. You are pointless.
Pigcrap, your forces are fat to be rendered.
Why don't you save your effort for the end.
I know you're keen, but it's not time yet.
I know on some occasion we agreed that together, we'd feast on their offal.
Our bodies shall fuse violently, pigcrap, against those wretches.
I am about to hurt your friend. Wanna join in?
A puppy chases your sheep, so you call a wolf for help!
But of course I'll join you; we are bound to the covenant.
Please, erase me. Tear down my wickednesses.
Topple this Babel. I have been proud and must be punished.
I see visions of white walls misted red with blood.
They are hungry; I rubbed their noses in your scent.
Finally it's getting exciting. I'm so thrilled you can be taken apart.
BOOOOOOM!
Looks like the party's started!
Isn't it nice to see people out and about.
Disease is Mother Nature's cull.
Sick in the body as well as the head.
Playing God!?
Humans cannot fight their natures.
It really seems to be hotting up over there.
Oh, I've been burning things too.
Oh will you let Rome burn?!
You put it out. Why can't you live a little?
What's black, white and red all over? I think you already know...
A delicious war article, it makes me foam at the mouth.
Your paper makes it sound like war is inevitable!
Don't think you can have her skull…
Then the prows of your ships point east.
Yes, I can't wait for him to die.
Him? He's almost passed over already!
Skewer her little urchins on toothpicks!
Burn the false prophet to the ground!
Perhaps you can bury him alive in gold.
Perhaps you can pin another medal on him, eh?
And keep a lid on her ashes so she can't remanifest.
Those teenage tantrums must end some day!
Let's see who has the better luck.
My two favourite birds now sit invitingly on the same perch.
High walls and flowers won't conceal the gore.
The splenetic, iron-sweet whiff of the warmonger…
So, your father was a traitor, eh? Sounds like my sort of fellow!
Why lose your head over a family scandal, when you could be losing it in so much more interesting ways?!
Puzzling, yes! I love a good mystery.
Off to the colonies as royal ambassador? You may end up a tray of hors d'oeuvres!
Welcome to the jungle!
Wow, your family is really messed up!
About time we saw some chaos!
The denizens of night have returned to their crack in the wall, for now.
Skulk in shade, guillotine blade.
Hide like a coward!
I have a sneaking suspicion…
Your emissaries curl like salted slugs.
I have blunted your dagger of espion.
Tentacles grow back.
I must be omnipresent.
They are my feelers, my antennae.
They foreshadow the coming frenzy.
Thank you for returning my cloak and dagger.
Science gives you new tools. I like new tools.
Your progress really gave me a jolt.
I also like to experiment.
I could make you my guinea pig?
Yet you fail to answer the fundamental questions.
I prefer practise to theory.
A mission of great tactical import.
Attention cadet! I have orders for you.
Worthwhile, no matter how much you hate empire.
Don't fail me, or there will be ramifications!
When I issue a task, I expect it carried out. Understand?
You are free to go now.
Very good, on your way.
Until your return.
You make a good minion.
Bravo, Bravo.
Good, soldier.
Oh yes, or why not comb monkeys instead! Feel free!
My, what a sense of duty!
If I could I'd have you court-martialled!
You bear a pigeon standard.
Don't come to me looking crestfallen!
Delay, and enter dangerous waters.
Time determines victory from defeat.
Your urgency, is very important to me.
Soldiers must be ready to adapt.
You would be helping a great cause...
If your conscience is clear, empire needs you yet...
If you have a choice, always make the right one.
Come, when is empire ever wrong?
Well? Don't be shy!
Mission accomplished?
Done your duty?
Stand easy, I have no new orders for you.
Whoever told you I needed help was fibbing.
I give the orders, as and when I see fit!
Escorts should scout ahead, anticipate trouble.
Protect your superiors on their voyage.
You will lead the charge, an exhilarating responsibility!
You're lucky your family's treachery is not pertinent to La Corona.
If the Empire is building a fleet, I better start building one too…
You have discovered your opponent's move. Isn't it time you made yours?
If I find out you've been meeting with rebels!
Sarmento is a sworn enemy of La Corona. One day we will deal with her rabble once and for all.
If real justice were done, Prosperity would still belong to La Corona, like back in the old days!
I could hire these Pyrphorians as mercenaries—defeat that nuisance Sarmento.
Hmmn I wonder if fire could fit in with my strategy...
A man of action, yet well-read, dressed, and drilled. What more could you want?
Barrack beds, early mornings and drill squares. All for the ultimate purpose.
History will remember me well, since I am to rewrite it for La Corona.
Simple logistics.
Effort is everything.
Bodes well for the campaign ahead.
Proof there is time for my nation yet!
La Corona smiles!
Yet another victory!
All falling into place, naturally.
They said you were good, so it appears.
Where did you school?
Good to see you know your drills.
You can be proud, soldier.
I better start taking you seriously.
No stain on your reputation.
Seems I have competition.
Am I the only one here with a brain?
I'm going to need every hour God sends.
I won't give up, not now.
A failure is never the end.
I'm not pessimistic, I'm realistic.
For the love of La Corona!
How am I to command amid such incompetence?!
I think I have the measure of you.
Insubordination!
You're a laughing stock!
Have you forgotten your rank?!
I'd sit you on a cannonball, and fire you out to sea.
You need a dose of naval discipline!
I will not be played for a fool!
Yes, I already know who you are. I? I am Admiral Vicente Silva.
I, Silva, have the executive power of a nation, but for you, I won't need it.
Pastel de nata?
Speak; my clerk will put it all on record.
Getting away from the action, are we?
Please, sit. Have an almond, or a fig.
What brings you out of your shell?
Now then, what must you be after?
So what if Empire's bad for everyone else - it's good for me.
Governed as they think they want to be, that is the secret.
People want to be shepherded, I don't need to wave my crook.
My model town would be a barracks, divided into squares.
Never rule as a general, but pretend you're a civilian.
Navigation is more than part of our national history.
La Corona was always an empire of seafarers, there's salt in our blood.
I hope you know your flags and semaphore?
I know every knot in every plank.
I can always rely on support.
There may be a reward in time.
Let's give ourselves a pat on the head.
It's not my funeral.
Agreed.
I give my word.
I don't think so.
Not worth any more of my time!
Non! I will not!
We must bivouac without brandy, and kayak without a paddle, on the road to victory.
We must have imagination to lead, yet in war, nothing is left to the imagination.
You better hope you've done your reading. Preparation is everything.
You think your Queen has no disputed colonies, and freely grants independence when asked politely?
La Corona, your Queen; empire is empire, a force of unstoppable destruction.
I took this command because it has always been my destiny. Under my leadership, La Corona shall once more be victorious.
Until La Corona is in open war with the Empire, your Queen is as much a friend as any.
Princess Qing gave me a fine copy of the 'Art of War'. Of course I've read it a thousand times.
Alonso's tactics are rash and confused, if he succeeds it will be down to luck!
Hunt plays the old battleaxe, waiting to drop the decisive blow.
La Fortune's days of piracy are numbered, La Corona will make sure of that!
Artur needs to look up the definition of "man" in the dictionary.
Isabel's rebels can't hide forever, the long arms of La Corona will soon tickle them out.
Von Malching doesn't realise, it's not about money, it's about power.
Why spree at Kahina's Emporium, when you can extract these goods at source?
Deal.
A supply line secured.
It all adds up.
I'm not here to make friends.
My accounts are suitably adjusted.
Then it's settled.
Just as I thought.
We have established an unbreakable chain of supply.
Your steady trade is helping change the course of history!
Your constant business is what empires thrive upon.
I do have the advantage of experience.
Ask for anything you wish, you won't get it.
Let's do this by the book.
Allow me to preside over our discussions.
Don't overthink it!
Come, this is your moment!
Take up your pen, and sign!
You have no choice but to concede.
Save your breath.
A necessary deterrent.
I do not suffer fools gladly…
It is an advantage to us both.
I'm still dubious as to its merits.
A lie we can agree upon.
Precisely as I see it.
I'm inclined to agree.
What sort of peasant do you think I am?

Utter caprice.
Who taught you this drivel?
What dullard's scheme is this?
I don't have to put up with this.
Rage quit!
This is pointless. Pointless!
If you're going to be stupid about it!
Oh forget it then!
It's for your own good.
Ah, you see your error now?
Must I fix everything?
What are the odds?
I yield.
Touché.

Come now, really?
The finer things…
How's your Latin?
No need to read the fine print.

The honourable thing I suppose.

I know you inside-out.
A little test.
I'll keep it brief.
Just playground games.
You become an unacceptable nuisance.
You are all that stands between victory and me.
I'm afraid war is my mission in life.
Lucid minds do not bear grudges.
Now, now, there has been anguish enough!
Cease fire at once!
This is your last chance of a truce.
I too am a pragmatist, you see.
Good tacticians take any advantage they can get.
I need you to supply the front line.
I'm cutting your supply off at the pass.
My armies have bread enough to march on.
Victory depends on consistent supplies!
You could make a useful ally.
What say we take the high ground?
Alliances fail, history proves it.
Doesn't really matter whose side you're on.
Let's resolve things the way honourable people do.
I'm sure we can come to an arrangement.
This, my good friend, is a bribe.
I'm warming to you.
Sunlight to lizards.
Thought you might.
Not much of a surprise.
Nothing special.
That's just silly!
Hardly conducive…
Contemptible.
Petty.
Incendiary.
Never interrupt your enemy…
I shall await your forfeiture in due course.
It's your funeral.
Yes, a glorious peace…
Stalemate.
Very well, but there's no use drawing this out.
Fine, but it'll only be a matter of time.
Just for necessities, nothing more.
Every soldier needs his rations.
I hope you'll have something for dry skin?
Who doesn't trade? You just embarrass yourself.
Is this revenge? I don't understand.
Are you a trader or are you not?
I say learn from anyone, no matter their station.
If you can't beat Empire, join it, eh?
Do you know something I don't?
And you would say that I'm arrogant.
What can you give the man who has everything? More!
A bribe? Very good.
Better to be short than short on brains!
Oh, the vacuous vocab of the lower-middle classes.
School was a long time ago, I am a master now.
No-one looks as super-silly-ous as you do at present!
Practice your pathetic attempts at flattery elsewhere.
Don't drool over me, you melon.
My boots don't need any more spittle thank you.
Yes well, I don't place much value in shows of emotion.
There is no reason I should let your comments about my proud nation get to me.
We are stronger day-on-day! This empire will never be forgotten, never!
She never used the word boring! And it was I who chose to break it off!
89 was not a defeat! It was a tactical retreat! ...And my first command!
A greasy little epithet, but I'll give you marks for trying.
Respect for your superiors, the sign of a reliable soldier.
Flattery is it? Then call me flattered.
Despite my privilege, I'm not so bad?' I'll take that as a compliment.
You should know, I have misgivings about you.
When I think about it, we aren't well-matched.
A Luso always watches the horizon.
I never needed friends.
Talent won't manifest without discipline.
Under scrutiny, I think you regress.
Call me old-school, but I don't have to 'like' anyone.
Your standing suffers an about-face.
My view on you hasn't changed.
You could still be infantry material.
If you could recognise them, you'd have good qualities.
I've heard enough to think better of you.
Opinion swings are common in statecraft.
Current affairs show you in a favourable light.
You warrant further examination.
I'm still trying to size you up.
Strong allies are the key to success.
We all need people we can trust.
I was wrong to think we shared a common foe.
I think you are confused as to who your friends are.
A pretty poor gambit to irk my allies.
A weak move, that's my ally.
A pincer movement!
Yes, an attack on two fronts!
The least honourable strategy toward my allies…
Cowards go behind friend's backs.
I don't blame you for watching your back around them.
Our enemy's ranks will crumble from within.
Sail full of wind, no rudder in sight.
Advance with caution.
Hearing about your achievements bores me to tears.
Change takes bold leadership.
You've stolen a march on our enemies.
Routine progress through the ranks.
Rash, don't you think?
What are you building, an empire?!
You'll soon know the difference between quality and quantity.
And how are you going to manage all of those outposts?
You don't seem to know what risk is.
Thirst for conquest; one of my indulgences.
Strategic expansion, centralised power.
Difficult terrain - I'm impressed.
Gains require blood, sweat and tears, happily not ours.
Ambition is important, the best of us have it.
A good leader uses every weapon at their disposal.
As you see I've never struggled for money.
As you see, the family wealth is considerable.
This island needs proper leadership…
Be honest, the responsibility is too much for you.
Only empires can assimilate!
I never agreed you could be a shareholder!
Every man and his dog has money these days.
This island is crucial, you'll ruin everything!
You can't just go waltzing in!
I'm glad you gave it up without a fight.
Thanks for giving me a view of the battlefield.
An insignificant little acreage.
I only care for strategic outposts.
Pillage marks the depraved, and the doomed.
Those who go too far always regret it.
The complete debellation of my legacy.
Do your duty men!
Rout them!
Positions!
Charge!
In line of battle.
You won't catch me off guard!
Go on, I dare you!
At my own game?
Evasive maneuvers!
Formations!
Bad for your morale!
Surrender.
The coup de grâce.

Hardly a triumph is it?
Not cruel unless I need to be.
Carthago delenda est.
Toppled by a pawn.
Never admit a mistake.
You must have feared this would happen.
I'm not one for long speeches.
Surely the decisive blow, no need to rub it in is there?
That's it. Why bother now. You've got everything.
Ha! HA! I got you. You my friend, have met your Water closet. I'm the king of the castle, you're the dirty rascal!
That's it! I refuse to be part of this farce any more. You cheated. Cheated all the way along! It's the only possible hypothesis.
The enemy is anyone who isn't your friend!

I can cross that off the list.
I was going to take care of that myself.

You can never overprepare.
Burnishing your battalia?
All present and correct, I see.
Haven't you heard the jangle of my medals?
